loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 53 years old and married, with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jesusa runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like junk food, canned goods, and groceries.

Jesusa has been in this business for 15 years now. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like junk food, canned goods, and groceries.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is aged 52 years. She is married with six children aged between 16 and 30 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been producing rice for 30 years, while her husband is a businessman. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers and to pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to buy a goat.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay workers.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Meet Ann. She is a small-scale farmer from Kapsowar, a rural town known for dairy farming. Ann has a husband, and they are blessed with a lovely family whom she has fought so hard to raise.

For the past 10 years, Ann has been actively involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been milk and maize farming. She sells her produce to the nearby market and also to neighbors, and has been making positive strides.

Ann wants to diversify and she is seeking a loan to start sheep farming and be able to make her dream come true. She is very passionate about sheep farming, and the most enjoyable task is raising the sheep. Sheep farming is a very profitable business venture, and the demand for sheep meat (mutton) is always high, being such a popular meal for many people in Kapsowar. Ann will also benefit from sheep wool which fetches a high price both in international and domestic markets. Additional profits from sheep farming will change her life, and she will be able to take care of the family expenses.

loans.use: to start sheep farming.

loans.name: Linah

texts.en:
Meet Linah, a small-scale farmer from Kapsowar, a rural town known for mango farming. Linah and her husband are blessed with adorable children, whom she has fought so hard to raise.
For the past five years, Linah has been actively involved in mixed farming; her primary sources of income have been milk, a variety of crops, and poultry farming. She sells her produce to the nearby market and to neighbors, and she has been making positive strides.
Linah is seeking a loan to grow the number of poultry birds in her farm. The passion she has for poultry business and the enjoyment she gets from raising chicks are what drive her to keep fighting business challenges and grow bigger. 
With your loan investment, Linah's family will benefit economically from poultry products and byproducts such as manure and feathers.

loans.use: to pay for poultry

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Bernard lives in the town of Masindi-Uganda. He is a teacher by profession. He is also engaged in farming to generate more income. 

Bernard wishes to educate his children but low salary payment affects his development. He needs a loan to to buy building materials like bricks  to construct his residential house

loans.use: to buy building materials like bricks to construct his residential house.

loans.name: Zhazgul

texts.ru: Жазгул, 28 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Жазгул- средне-специальное образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад. Благодаря целеустремленности и трудолюбию Жазгул, на сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть: 2 коровы и 20 овец. Также на собственной земельной доле мерою 1,0 ГА она выращивает клевер. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жазгул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) для покупки 3 коров, 2 телят. Жазгул намерена увеличить поголовье скота, что приведет к получению большей совокупной прибыли от перепродажи скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en: Zhazgul is 28 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. Zhazgul has a specialized secondary education and, to provide additional income for her family, has been involved in farming and animal husbandry for 10 years. Thanks to Zhazgul's drive and hard work, today her business contains 2 cows and 20 sheep. She also grows clover on 1.0 hectare of her own land. In order to further develop her business, Zhazgul requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 3 cows and 2 calves. Zhazgul intends to increase her livestock headcount, which will lead to increasing a higher combined profit from reselling livestock. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business and repairing her house.

loans.use: to buy 3 cows and 2 calves in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is age 58 and married with ten children. He does agriculture, specializing in tea growing and a banana and coffee planting business located in Mutojo, Kyangyenyi, Sheema. He started this agriculture business in the year 2000 to have an income. In his banana plantation, he works for eight hours a day and six days a week. Competition is his main challenge from fellow matooke [banana] traders and agriculturalists. Most of his clients are traders from the capital city, who come to his home to buy the plantain. 

Nathan is borrowing ugx.1,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy mulch for his banana plantation to increase his banana/plantain output.This is his tenth cycle, and he has been so loyal to the institution. He hopes to be financially stable in the future and educate his child that is still studying at university. He is so hardworking as described by his loving wife—even at his old age—but thanks UGAFODE and kiva lenders for meeting his financial needs.

loans.use: To buy mulches and fertilizer

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard needs a credit facility to buy spare parts for motorcycles. He is a hardworking man who sells motorcycle spare parts. He started the business to generate more income and meet his family's ongoing increasing demands. Benard wishes to buy a car to enable him to travel to different places on time and be able to coordinate his work with ease. However, inadequate capital affects his business returns.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycles

loans.name: Augustin

texts.fr: Jeune célibataire et très actif, Augustin est âgé de 33 ans. Il vit à Sagbado pour exercer son activité. Pour gagner sa vie, Augustin fabrique des foyers améliorés à base de la tôle pour faciliter la rapidité de la cuisson et de la préparation à la cuisine. Grâce à son activité, Augustin arrive à satisfaire l’attente de ses clients et désire améliorer sa prestation. Augustin s’approvisionne deux fois par mois à Sagbado et demande ce prêt pour commander des tôles et accroitre sa rentabilité.
texts.en: Young, single and very active, Augustin is 33 years old. He lives in Sagbado to run his business. To make his living, Augustin makes better fireplaces from sheet metal to improve cooking times and kitchen preparation time. Thanks to his business, Augustin manages to meet the expectations of his clients and wants to improve his service. Augustin stocks up two times a month in Sagbado and is requesting this loan to order some pieces of sheet metal and to increase his profitability.

loans.use: to purchase three pieces of sheet metal.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, aged 45 years old, is married and lives with his wife and their two children. He has benefited from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training and has gained good entrepreneurial and financial management skills. Peter does potatoe farming, sheep rearing and operates a butchery selling mutton. He is borrowing a loan to expand his farming by buying more lambs, which after maturity will be slaughtered for sale in the butchery. He hopes this will enable him to meet the demand of mutton in the market and improve his sales. This will lead to increased profits which he hopes to use in educating his children.

He is grateful to Kiva and the lenders for the support.

loans.use: To buy lambs for slaughter to help him earn more income for his family's upkeep.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Francisca. She is 43 years old, married and lives with her husband and their four children. Francisca is involved in poultry and vegetable farming. She has benefited from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training in enterprise and financial management. 

Francisca has applied for a loan to buy poultry feed and fertilizer. She hopes that this loan will help increase her farm income thus improving her living standards and paying her children’s tuition fees. Francisca is grateful to Kiva and Kiva lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed and fertilizer to boost her farming thus increasing her family's income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wheels, a tent, and for maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Sadeq

texts.en:
Sadeq is a 26-year-old, single man from Rafah city. He opened a small stall in the city where he sells hot drinks, like coffee and tea, at very low prices. It is a good business and he has his loyal clients.

Sadeq took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy more raw materials to use in his hot drinks stall. This should increase his sales and also his income. 

Sadeq appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials to use in his hot drinks stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve part of his room which is in bad condition.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mylene works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from nipa roofing. Mylene is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy containers of coconut wine to sell for her coconut wine vending business.

Mylene has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF (one loan). She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Zhamiyla

texts.ru: Жамийла 50 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей. У Жамийлы среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, на собственном земельном участке мерою 3,0 ГА она выращивает фасоль для реализации. Начав свой бизнес в 1998 году, на сегодняшний день кроме развитого полеводческого бизнеса в ее хозяйстве есть 5 коров, 20 овец. Ежемесячная совокупная прибыль Жамийлы составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жамийла обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 30 овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Zhamiyla is 50 years old, married and has 2 children. Zhamiyla has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry and farming, growing beans for sale on 3.0 hectares of her own land. Having started this business in 1998, today, besides the developed farming business, she also has 5 cows and 20 sheep. Zhamiyla's combined monthly profit amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Zhamiyla requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 30 sheep. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase 30 sheep for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Tatiyana

texts.ru: Татьяне 44 года, не замужем, 3 детей. У Татьяны - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 14 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Татьяны, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, а также 2,0 Га земли, где она выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Татьяна обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян, удобрений и 2 коров. Доходы от кредита Татьяна планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Tatiyana is 44 years old, not married and has 3 children. Tatiyana has a specialized secondary education and, to provide the primary income for her family, has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for 14 years. Thanks to Tatiyana's hard work, today her farm contains 2 cows and 2.0 hectares of land, where she grows beans. The monthly income amounts to 8,000 som (KGS), but because this money is not enough for a decent life, Tatiyana requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy seeds, fertilizers and 2 cows. Tatiyana plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows, as well as seeds and fertilizers, in order to develop her business further

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, a 31-year-old married mother of one, lives in Nkubu, a small remote rural town in Kenya that has bad terrain and is characterized by drought and bad weather conditions. For the past 15 years, Agnes has been actively involved in mixed farming. Her primary income comes from milk and crop farming. 

Agnes loves dairy farming. Milking her cow is her hobby, and feeding her cows makes her very proud. Dairy farming is very fulfilling for Agnes, but because Nkubu is a remote area without piped water or electricity, she faces the challenge of irrigating her farm and providing water to her animals. Since she is from a marginalized community, she is forced to walk long distances, typically two hours, to search for water. 

Therefore, Agnes is requesting a loan to buy a water tank and water pipes. She also plans to buy cereals for re-sale. Most of the rain water in her area goes to waste, and Agnes wants to harvest and store it in a water tank. Agnes will also be able to sell cereals to the local market and increase her income. 

This loan will save Agnes time and allow her to irrigate her farm during dry seasons and increase her productivity and hence her income, which will provide her with financial security. She will also use the stored water for home consumption. 

Agnes’s dream is to increase her farming activities and provide her child with a proper education. Education is the only way that her child can succeed.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank, water pipes and cereals for resale

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-year-old single man from Deir El Balah who lives with his mother and sister in a very simple house. Mohammad learned how to fish a few years ago and now works alone as a fisherman. It is a very good business and profitable.

Mohammad requested a USD loan from FATEN to help him make a new net for catching a specific kind of fish. This loan will enable Mohammad to increase his catch and also his income.

loans.use: to make a new net for catching a specific kind of fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goats to raise and sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a buy and sell sugar business in the Philippines for 35 years. She  earns additional income by running a general store, buying and selling rice, and selling vegetables.

Teresa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 50.000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of sugar to sell. 

Teresa dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of sugar to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk to her clients as well as to earn more income

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 29-year-old single man from Rafah city. He works in an educational center where they provide special lessons for school students. The center enjoys very good demand. 

Ahmad would like to improve his work and find new ways of teaching. so he took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his business.

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his business

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ellen works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Ellen is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Ellen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Anifel

texts.en:
Anifel is 32 years old and married with one child. With her child currently in school, Anifel works very hard to provide for them.

Anifel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, cooking oil, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, vinegar, cereals, etc. to sell.

Anifel has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items.

Anifel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, cooking oil, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, vinegar, cereals, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Anita is 42 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Anita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fishing gear for her business.

Anita has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Anita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing gear for her business

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Flordeliza is 32 years old and has two children who are in school.

Flordeliza has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Flordeliza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 37 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.  She has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, etc. 

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Fatbardha

texts.en:
This is Fatbardha, or "Good Luck" in English, who is in her 50s and is a married mother of two. She is requesting your financial help to buy potato and onion seeds for planting.

Fatbardha has been in the agricultural sector for the past 24 years, practicing the activity on her own. She lives in the region of Korca, known for the largest production of onions, potatoes, beans (those ones sold in their dried form to whole-buyers) and apple and quince fruits. On the six dynyms (1 dynym is equal to 1,000 square meters) of agricultural land that she owns, and on the other six that are in the possession of her brother-in-law who immigrated to the United States about twenty years ago, she plants potatoes, onions, garlic, and corn, and has fruit orchards as well.

Fatbardha’s husband works in a corn mill for a pay of about $200/month, while her younger son does seasonal work in Greece.

loans.use: to buy potato and onion seeds for planting

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is 46 years old and married with four children. With one child currently in school, Lorelie works very hard to provide for them.

Lorelie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like noodles, cooking oil, soft drinks, juice, cereals, toothpaste, sanitary pads, etc. to sell.

Lorelie has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items.

Lorelie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like noodles, cooking oil, soft drinks, juice, cereals, toothpaste, sanitary pads, etc. to sell

loans.name: Luzel

texts.en:
Luzel is 38 years old and has four children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Luzel is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional livestock, feed, and vitamins for her business.

Luzel has been raising livestock for ten years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Luzel would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, feed, and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a cow which will enable her to increase milk production for her customers

loans.name: Etedal

texts.en:
Etedal is a 41-year-old married woman from Nablus city. She is a mother of two kids; a son and a daughter. Etedal works in an educational center where they provide special lessons for special needs students. The center has a very good demand. 

Etedal would like to improve her work and find new ways of teaching. so she took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her business.

Etedal appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Emma

texts.en:
Ma. Emma works hard to support her family, she is married, and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Emma has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP, through NWTF, to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 3 years.

Ma. Emma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nour Eddin

texts.en:
Nour Eddin is a 23-year-old, single man from Khanyounis city. He lives with his family in a small house. 

Two years ago, Nour Eddin started his own business which is transferring goods, using his rickshaw. It is a good business and supports the family with a good income. 

Nour Eddin took a USD Murabaha loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy more products from wholesalers and resell them to local traders. This will help Nour Eddin to increase his income and productivity. 

Nour Eddin appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more products from wholesalers and resell them to local traders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow that will increase the milk supply she sells

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 26-year-old married woman, with one child, who is in school. 

Marilyn is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP, through NWTF, to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marilyn has been in the pig fattening business for 3 years, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Marilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Thoma

texts.en:
This is Thoma, who is seeking your compassion to pay for a medical visitation of his wife’s Flutura, or ‘Butterfly’ in English, shown in the photograph. In the past she had a surgery due to a paralysis she suffered, and since then she has been visiting a health specialist and taking medication regularly. 

Thoma and his wife are the parents of two grown children. They each receive a disability pension of about $139/month. They have had the opportunity to plant some seasonal vegetables and fruits for their own use. Kindly note that the village they live is best known for the mulberry tree, and for the grappa drink made from this fruit, which is locally called ‘raki mani’

loans.use: to pay for medical clinic fees

loans.name: Jane Lady

texts.es:
Jane es una mujer de 32 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 2 y 6 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, amable, activa, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el barrio ‘la Morita’ un área comercial ubicada en el centro de la ciudad caracterizada por agrupar a la mayor parte de oficinas de empresas, universidades e instituciones. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo a una temperatura aproximada entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el día.
Janes es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela el menor aún no está en edad escolar, viven en una casa alquilada, construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante, durante todos los días de la semana. Con un nylon sobre el piso, ella expone la ropa en oferta, los clientes levantan la ropa del piso y eligen la que les gusta. Su segunda actividad es la venta de utensilios de cocina, como: cubiertos, ollas, sartenes y otros, actividad que realiza paralelamente a toda hora. “una actividad le brinda a mi familia la posibilidad de comer diariamente, con la otra realizo el pago de los servicio…” comenta. Su sueño es comprarse una casa, ella desea realizar la compra de fardos de ropa de segunda mano y también utensilios de cocina. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Jane solicita un préstamo para la compra de fardos de ropa de segunda mano y utensilios de cocina para pagar los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Jane is a woman of 32. She lives with her partner and has two children, ages 2 and 6. Her business is selling secondhand clothing.

She is a good mother, entrepreneurial, friendly, active, responsible, and hard-working. She runs her business in the "La Morita" neighborhood, a commercial area located in the center of the city and characterized by a clustering of the majority of the business, university, and institutional offices. The area has a warm, tropical, and humid climate, with a temperature approximately between 21 - 35 degrees centigrade during the day.

Jane has a dark complexion, long black hair, dark eyes, short stature, and a thin physique. Her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish because of general culture and for the business that she does. She shares her life with her partner, who works in commerce, and with her children. The older one goes to school, and the younger one is not yet of school age. They live in a rented house made of bricks with a tile roof, and it has potable water, electricity, and a sewage system. 

Her business is selling secondhand clothing, work that she does as a street vendor every day of the week. With a nylon [sheet] on the floor, she displays the clothing for sale. The customers lift the clothing from the floor and choose what they like. Her second business is selling cooking utensils, such as covers, pots, frying pans, and other items, work that she does in parallel at all hours. "One business gives my family the possibility of eating daily, while the other pays for services, " she comments. Her dream is to buy a house. 

She wants to make the purchase of bundles of secondhand clothing as well as cooking utensils. This is her first loan with this institution in the 7 years that she has been working in these businesses.

It is for these reasons that Jane is applying for a loan for the purchase of bundles of secondhand clothing and cooking utensils, so that she can pay the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy bundles of secondhand clothing and cooking utensils to sell, so that she can pay her household expenses.

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Melania is 54 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

She has a business of farming corn in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years.

Melania requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Nena has been in this business for 35 years. 

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Nena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ma. Jojie

texts.en:
Ma. Jojie is a 43-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur in the Philippines and does business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing. 

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers.

Ma. Jojie has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 42 years old and married. She has one child, who is in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising goats in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her goats.

Maria Fe has been raising goats for 10 years now and has borrowed from NWTF four times in the past to sustain her business. She would like to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her goats

loans.name: Agron

texts.en:
Agron is 40 years old and the father of one daughter who is 13 years old. 

He is currently working in a car wash while his wife is a streamstress, working long hours to help provide for the family. 

They used to live in a very small and old home, but have managed to work hard and save money to build a new house to live in. However, they have not been able to finish the work on it and are now requesting a loan in order to complete the flooring and install the bathroom and toilet.

Agron is very happy to have this opportunity to improve his family's quality of life and living conditions and he wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to complete the flooring and install the bathroom and toilet in his home.

loans.name: Monik

texts.en:
Monik is a 34-year-old villager and a single man. He has been trying to open up a little bar-café in his village and needs your help with this to renovate the place and buy an espresso machine.

In addition to the bar-café he’s been practicing agriculture since he turned 18. In the 8 dynym (about 0.8 hectares) of agricultural lands that his family owns, he plants beans, potatoes, onions and wheat. 

He lives with his parents as do the majority of single people in the rural areas, yet even in the cities. His parents receive a retirement pension. 

The village where Monik lives is situated along the national road, Tirana-Korca, and that makes it easy for the villagers to sell their products to wholesale buyers or passersby as well.

loans.use: to renovate a bar cafe place and buy an espresso machine.

loans.name: Fadil

texts.en:
Fadil is 28 years old and the married father of 4 children. His wife stays home to take care of the children and the house while he works hard, cutting wood in order to make a living. 

They are very poor and receive social help because his salary is not enough to be able to provide for all of the basic needs for his family. 

He has been in business for 10 years and is very well known in the area, creating a large number of customers. 

For the first time, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase a new woodcutting machine. Fadil's current machine is very worn and damaged from so many years of wear and tear. 

He is very happy for this opportunity and knows that without the help of the lenders, he would not be able to purchase a new machine and continue with his business. 

Fadil is very grateful and wants to thank the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a new woodcutting machine.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.fr:
Clotilde est une restauratrice de spécialité malagasy (vary sy laoka). Elle exerce cette activité depuis 13 ans déjà. 
Elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter des légumes , des viandes , quelques sacs de riz blanc, des différentes sortes de piments supplémentaires en gros pour éviter la pénurie en cette saison de pluie à Madagasikara.
C'est une femme travailleuse et créative, c'est elle-même qui crée le menu, prépare et cuit le repas tous les jours.
Clotilde est une mère de famille dynamique, mariée et a 3 enfants de 21, 16 et 14ans, tous scolarisés.
Elle espère augmenter davantage ses revenus car les frais de scolarisation en formation professionnelle et à l'université sont plus cher. 
Elle projette ainsi de réaménager son lieu d'activité  pour attirer les clients
texts.en:
Clotilde owns a restaurant that specializes in a type of Malgache food called vary sy laoka. She has been doing this for 13 years.
Clotilde is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, meats, some white rice bags, and different kinds of peppers extra large to avoid shortages during Madagascar's rainy season. Clotilde is a creative working woman who creates her own menus, prepares, and cooks every day.
She is also married and the mother of 3 energetic children aged 21, 16, and 14, all of whom are in school.
She hopes to further increase revenues as school fees for vocational training and university are more expensive.
Thus, she plans to redevelop her place of business to attract customers.

loans.use: to buy beans, 2 sacks of rice, meats, peppers, and oil.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.fr:
Clarisse est une femme active, débrouillarde, elle vends des vêtements et nounours fripes. Elle exerce ces activités durant 5 ans.
Clarisse a besoin d'un prêt pour mieux ravitailler ses marchandises (friperie). Avec ce crédit, elle va acheter des vêtements et nounours fripes.
Clarisse a 50 ans, elle est mariée avec 3 enfants dont tous scolarisés.Son mari la soutienne dans cette activité. 
Elle a besoin de plus de revenu pour  le frais de scolarisation de son ainé à l'université.
Son rêve le plus cher est que  l'avenir de ses enfants soit brillant.
texts.en:
Clarisse is an active and resourceful woman. She has been selling clothes and secondhand stuffed animals for 5 years.
Clarisse needs a loan to better supply her thrift store. With this loan, she will buy clothes and secondhand toys.
Clarisse is 50 years old and married with 3 children in school. Her husband supports her in her activity.
She needs more revenue for the school his senior in college costs.
His fondest dream is that her children will have a brilliant future.

loans.use: to buy clothing, secondhand toys, and phone prepaid credits for her thrift store.

loans.name: Anseth

texts.en:
Anseth, who is in his late 20s, is single with one small child.  He has been running a retail shop for six years now.  He works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Anseth's second loan from to Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase on the shop inventory and has paid back his loan successfully.  He used the profit to save some money in his bank account, repay the loan and cover household expenses. 

He will use this loan to increase his shop inventory buy selling sugar, beans, flours,rice, all types of soap, eggs, sweets, biscuits  etc. He dreams of opening a wholesale shop.

Anseth will make sure he pays the loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to increase his shop inventory buy selling sugar, beans, flours,rice, all types of soap, eggs, sweets,  biscuits etc.

loans.name: Villa 23 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Villa 23 de Octubre forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que es un medio para poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una, e ir mejorando por medio de su trabajo y lucha.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ilda, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que está en una situación de pobreza extrema, pero que quiere ir mejorando, todo esto por medio de su esfuerzo y de las capacitaciones que va recibiendo en este grupo. Ella se dedica a la costura, y por medio de su trabajo lucha por sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group named “Villa 23 de Octubre” is participating in the poverty elimination program so that the members can understand their living situations and take steps to improve through work and determination.

One of the members is Sra. Ilda, whose survey indicated that she is at a Stage 1 poverty level. This means that she is in an extreme poverty situation. However, Ilda wants to improve so she is putting forth her best effort and participating in training seminars with the rest of her group. Ilda is a seamstress and strives to help her loved ones through her work.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics, thread, elastics, and other supplies so that she can continue sewing just as before. Ilda appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can continue growing and helping her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, elastics, and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Jardin De Rosas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JARDIN DE ROSAS” iniciará el décimo quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de mantas, venta de material escolar, venta de prendas de policía, venta de cosméticos, servicio de transporte, venta de chamarras, venta de venrduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rita es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años al observar que este producto tiene varias fortalezas, es por ello que guardo un capital pequeño para iniciar un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Jardin de Rosas” credit group will begin its fifteenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes regional hub.  It is made up of nine members and is lead by a board of directors where Rita is the President.  The members of the credit group carry out various businesses, among them: corner store, blanket sales, school supply sales, police uniform sales, cosmetics sales, transportation services, sweater sales, and vegetable sales.

The loan they are taking out will benefit smalltime entrepreneurs, one of whom is Rita.  She says that this is the first time she has joined with Pro Mujer.  She joined at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business selling clothing; she says that she learned this business a number of years ago when she noticed that that product has a number of strengths.  Because of that she saved a small amount of capital to start her own business.

The loan she is now taking out is to increase her working capital (to buy clothing in bulk), which she will get from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and will later sell in her sales space.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family financially, because she is married and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training seminars the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw wood for the family workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase the amount of milk she can supply to her customers, which will also increase her income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase dairy feeds to feed her dairy cows to have more production of milk to sell to her clients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow which will increase her milk supply and increase her income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow that will enable him to increase milk production.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nenita is 47 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional supplies for her fishing business, like gasoline, etc.

Nenita has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for her fishing business, like gasoline, etc.

loans.name: Indangamirwa Group

texts.en:
Josephine is a group leader, aged 43 years. She is married with 4 children between the ages of  9 and 17. They all go to school. 

She owns a restaurant and she has been in business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy items such as spoons, plates and saucepans for use in her restaurant.

The group is called INDANGAMIRWA, which means “”great people” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses in order to make their future better.

loans.use: to buy items such as spoons, plates and saucepans for use in her restaurant.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 56-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He works as a tailor and at the same time he is a farmer. He is faced with hardships of low capital that hinder the progress of his business. However, he has hopes of having a very good retirement package and educating all his children to higher levels of learning. 

Robert has asked for a loan to  buy uniform materials for sewing and sell uniforms  to schools and parents.

loans.use: to buy uniform materials for sewing and sell  uniforms to schools and parents.

loans.name: Heaz

texts.en: Heaz lives in Hoima, Uganda. He owns rental houses where he has attained an income to support his family. He hopes to construct more commercial houses to earn more income despite the challenges of high expenditures on water and electricity bills. Heaz will use the loan facility to furnish his commercial house.

loans.use: to furnish his commercial house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more charcoal  to extend her buiness

loans.name: Luca

texts.en:
Luca is a businesswoman in Mundri and has been working hard to manage her business of selling a variety of products, like onions, cooking oil, flour and beans. 

To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of 1,300 SSP from WOYE MFI to buy charcoal to sell. Luca is hopeful that this loan will give her some profit in the future.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Wyrga Hajaniony

texts.fr:
Wyrga, âgée de 34 ans, est mariée sans enfants. Elle est vendeuse de fruits et légumes depuis 4 ans. L'emplacement de son lieu de vente est très stratégique mais le problème est le stock de marchandises, c'est pourquoi elle demande un prêt. Avec le crédit, elle va acheter davantage des différents légumes et fruits et des poissons séchées pour augmenter les marchandises.
A part cette activité de vente de légumes,Wyrga tient aussi une petite gargote, pour prouver que c'est une femme débrouillarde et battante.
Actuellement, elle suit un traitement donc elle a besoin d'augmenter son revenu, elle rêve d'avoir d'enfants comme toutes les autres femmes.
texts.en:
Wyrga, aged 34, is married without children. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for 4 years. The location of her shop is very good, but she sometimes has trouble stocking it, which is why she is applying for a loan. With the loan, she will buy more varied vegetables, fruit and dried fish to increase her stock.
Apart from her vegetable selling business, Wyrga also runs a small tavern, demonstrating that she is a resourceful and strong-willed woman.
Currently she is undergoing fertility treatment, so she needs to increase her income. She dreams of having children like other women.

loans.use: to buy green beans, beans, bananas, mangoes, and dried fish.

loans.name: Mansour

texts.en:
Mansour is 32 years old, married, and the father of three children. He is an educated man with a university education. Mansour runs a small grocery in the area where he lives with his family in Sana'a, a city in Yemen. He has been involved this business for more than one year.

Mansour strives hard to get ahead with his small grocery, but most of what he earns goes to cover the necessary expenses of his family. His grocery is the source of income for Mansour and his children. Unfortunately, its capital is very small and it lacks a lot of goods. Due to his small capital, he can't keep up with customer demand. 

As a result, he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to buy soft drinks, canned foods, and other retail items to sell in his small grocery. With this loan, he can offer a wider variety to his customers and earn more profits that will enable him provide his family with a good living condition.

Mansour looks forward to sending his children to a private school.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned foods, and other retail items to sell in his small grocery

loans.name: Maua

texts.en:
Maua is 23 years old, and she has no children. She is not married. She lives with her parents in Kilombero district. She helps her family by supporting her young sisters and young brothers in paying school fees and helping her parents get social services like food, clothes and health care through her farming activities. 

Maua is a Camfed learner guide who volunteers to teach life skills at her nearby secondary school. She requests a Kiva loan to start a clothing business near her community. The profit will help her to assist her siblings.

loans.use: to start a clothing business

loans.name: Tres De Mayo De Ancachuro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TRES DE MAYO DE ANCACHURO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Karina, la socia continua dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores como chanchos, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua criando a sus animales para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan en las distintas ferias que se realizan por la zona, siendo de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de chanchos.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de agricultura, negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de ganadería y negocio de crianza de animales.
La socia que sale adjunta a la foto pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank  “TRES DE MAYO DE ANCACHURO”. This bank is located in the Anta district, belonging to the Anta province and the department of Cusco.

The member is Sra. Karina. She continues to make a living raising small animals, such as pigs. Karina is grateful to those who are part of this dream, by this means, and promises to make her payments according to the agreement.

She continues raising her animals, and then selling them to her customers that request  her, at various fairs held in the area, thus being able to continue to support her family. Karina is grateful to the people who form part of her dream in this way and promises to make her repayments according to the agreement.


She requests a loan to buy pigs.

The other members work in agriculture, run a grocery store, sell cattle, and raise animals. The member whose picture has been cropped into the photo asked permission to arrive late to the meeting for work reasons, and the member whose face has been covered does not belong to the community bank.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Blanca Ruby

texts.es:
La señora Blanca tiene gran experiencia en el área de panadería, hace algún tiempo inicio con su propia panadería que hasta ahora le ha generado muy buenos resultados.
Siempre ha preferido trabajar independiente, trabaja todos los días desde las 8:00 Am hasta las 9:00 Pm
Actualmente necesita un auxilio para realizar la compra de materia prima como harina, queso, levadura, entre otros.
El préstamo le permitirá trabajar en unas mejores condiciones y podrá garantizar la calidad de sus preparaciones.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener una gran panadería que surta diferentes tiendas.
Con esta ayuda podrá trabajar de una manera más organizada y con mejor capital.
texts.en:
Blanca has a lot of experience in the area of bakeries.  A while back she started her own bakery, which has been generating great results since then.  She has always preferred to work independently.  She works daily from 8:00 a.m. until 9 p.m.

Currently she needs help to buy ingredients such as flour, cheese, and leavening, among others.  This loan will allow her to work in better conditions and she will be able to guarantee the quality of her goods.

Her biggest dream is to be able to have a great bakery that sells to different stores.

With this help she will be able to work in a more organized manner, with better capital.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour, cheese, and leavening, among others.

loans.name: Yote Kwa Bwana Group

texts.en: Yote Kwa Bwana is a lending group from Uvira the city in the Eastern of Democratic Republic Of Congo. They have been part of Wezesha Project for more than one year and this loan will be their 4th. They have always been on-time with their payments. Suzana (second from right of photo) is one of these group members, she is 47 year old widow with 5 children. She will use this loan to purchase more juice and Fanta to sell and her kiosk. She would like to improve her business and to be able to support her family. She aims to support her children with a good education and never leave them hungry.

loans.use: to purchase juice and fanta.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
In the photograph are Sofia and Alki, her husband. Both of them are early retirees, with her receiving a pension of $139/month and Alki $309/month.

They live in the city of Korce, best known for serenade music, the first Albanian school, the first Albanian beer, an early civilization, rich cuisine, and for its cobblestone streets.

The loan that Sofia is requesting will be spent on health visitation to specialists. She has had two surgeries twice in Greece, and since then she has been taking medications regularly and is required to visit the doctor about twice per year.

loans.use: to pay for health visitation

loans.name: Faradja Group

texts.en: Kyalumba (far right of photo) is 33 years old, married and a mother of 5 children. She has a secondary education. She is responsive, honest and hardworking. She has been involved in selling fish for many years, having started her business 7 years ago. Since that time she has been the primary source of income for her family. In order to further develop her business, Kyalumba decided to request a loan in the amount of $250 from Wezesha Project in order to increase her stock. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan to further grow her business, which will allow her to increase the family's income.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Yesu Ni Jibu Group

texts.en: Vivianne (far left of photo) is one of Yesu ni Jibu Group from Uvira city, in Eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. 30 years old she is married and lives in a house with her husband. She earns her living selling clothes. Her customers prefer her because she's friendly. Her principal advantage is that his business is next to her house, which has allowed him to work and be near her two children, ages four and one. Vivianne started her work by choice; she wanted an occupation that would allow him to be near her family and she learned it from her sister. She is always hard at work as the business runs seven days per week. Vivianne is seeking a loan to buy more clothes. Vivianne is grateful in advance for the support and trust that lenders continue to put in her.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Skender

texts.en:
Skender is 39 years old and the father of 3 children.  In order to earn a living, he is working as a taxi driver in the southern part of Kosovo where he lives. 

He has a brother in a western European country who sometimes sends money to Skender's family to help when needed.  

In the past, Skender owned a cow and used the milk for his family and sometimes he would sell excess milk products to others. 

However, because of a lack of money at one point, Skender was forced to sell the cow for money to help his family. 

Now, for the first time, he is requesting a loan so that he can purchase a cow once again. 

He looks forward to being able to provide the milk and other dairy products to his family to save on expenses and ensure adequate nutrition. He is also planning to sell milk in his neighborhood for extra income.

He promises to pay on time and is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase a cow once again

loans.name: Umoja Ni Nguvu Group

texts.en:
Maombi (second from left in the photo) is a member of Umoja ni Nguvu Group. She lives in Democratic Republic of Congo in the city of Uvira, and she is married. She has six children ranging from 6 to 15 years of age, all of them are in school. Maombi has 3 three other children in her care who are members of her extended family. She has also been able to send them to school through her business profits.
Maombi's business is selling beans and maize, she has been doing this for 4 years. With her Kiva loan through Wezesha Project she will bolster her capital and buy a large quantity of cereals to resell so as to earn more money so that she can pay school fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase beans and maize

loans.name: Amtumainiaye Bwana Group

texts.en:
Bilombele (second from left in photo) is 30 years old and married with four children. She is a member of the Amtumainiaye Bwana Group in Uvira City Eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store and has requested a loan of $250  through Wezesha Project to purchase more plastics to sell in her general store. These plastics are things like basins, chairs, and so on.
Bilombele has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from Wezesha Project before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pigs. Bilombele aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase plastics

loans.name: Ushirika 2 Group

texts.en:
Anna Marie (far left of photo) is 24 years old, she lives in a house she owns that she built alongside her husband and their three children in the district city of Uvira in the Province of South Kivu, in the Democratic Republic of Congo. 

Anna Marie earns a living running her own bakery. She is well known in the area for her products and she very good at building relationships with people in the city. She will use to loan to buy flour to bake bread. This investment will enable her to ensure a good income with a healthy and good quality product, which she will be able to sell at a better price and also gain a larger number of customers. This will allow her to improve her income in a short period of time, increase her profits, and ultimately improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.en: Bukuru (far right of photo) is 35 old married woman and has six children living in Uvira in the Eastern of Democratic Republic Of Congo. She has been selling tomatoes for 3 years. She has three loans with an excellent record repayment. She received a loan of $150 to invest in tomatoes, she promised to continue to pay on time so that the lenders give confidence in her. She is motivated to provide her children with a good food and education through her profit. Her husband is unemployed, which means Bukuru is the only income earner, but she is hopeful to use this loan in a productive manner.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes

loans.name: Uaminifu Group

texts.en:
The desire to improve her personal situation and to have a better life is what has motivated Apendeki (centre of photo) to start her own business of selling fish. She is married and has her husband and 7 children. She comes from Uaminifu group lives in Bukavu in the Democratic Republic of Congo . Apendeki runs her business from home and uses the profit from sales to help her husband cover household expenses. She and her husband live in their own home.

Apendeki wants to expand her business and is requesting a loan to buy more wholesale products since she has many customers and wants to offer them good prices. This way she will be able to build a good reputation, earn more, and enjoy a better quality of life with her husband and their children.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Tulinde Group

texts.en:
Aline (far left of photo) is 45 old years old woman and has 10 children. She is from Uvira City in Eastern of Democratic Republic Of Congo, she fights every day to have a better life. She is very thankful for the opportunity to receive credit, since the benefits she obtained through her first loan were big. Through the loan, she was able to send her children to school.

Aline is requesting her new loan to buy more small fish to resell In this way, she will grow her business slowly and in a sustainable way. At the same time, she will be able to have more benefits and more earnings. Aline hopes to be able to repay this loan so that she can request another loan, which will improve the conditions of her home and help her take care of her children.

loans.use: to purchase small fish.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina is a 22-year-old volunteer teacher and single mother, living with her own mother. As a Camfed Learner Guide, she volunteers to teach life skills in her nearby secondary school. Her lessons focus on effective communication and on building her students’ confidence.

Evelina is currently struggling to get enough money to feed her family from selling commodities in her grocery store alone. She is now requesting a Kiva loan to invest enough in her grocery to ensure a better profit margin. Asia then plans to use her profits to launch a business selling food. The interest on Evelina`s loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: to invest in her grocery store

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, una mujer de 70 años de edad que ha dado toda su vida en beneficio de su familia intentando sacarla  adelante y superando juntos las adversidades que se les han presentado en la vida; gracias a una tienda que con mucho esfuerzo, paciencia y sacrificio logro montar, ha generado los ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus hijos. 

Trabaja sola todos los días durante 10 horas.
Buscando ser la mejor empresa familiar del sector quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido que le permitan aumentar su inventario como granos y abarrotes.

De esta forma ira superando dificultades como las bajas ventas y la competencia.

Este crédito será la gran oportunidad para consolidarse como la tienda más productiva en el barrio y le dará la oportunidad de cumplir ese sueño que tanto ha anhelado de comprar una vivienda propia.

Apoya a Mercedes con su negocio!
texts.en:
Mercedes, age 70, has given her whole life for her family in order to get them ahead.  Together they have overcome life’s adversities thanks to a store.  She was able to establish the store with great effort, patience, and sacrifice.  It has generated income to support her children.  She works alone every day for ten hours.

In looking to be the best family business in the area, she wants to request a loan to buy stock.  This will allow her to increase her inventory, and she will buy things like grains and groceries.  This way she will overcome difficulties like low sales and the competition.

This loan will be a big opportunity to establish the store as the most productive in the neighborhood.  It will give her the opportunity to fulfill this dream that she has longed for so much, to buy her own house.

Help Mercedes with her business!

loans.use: to buy stock of grains and groceries to allow her to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Marije

texts.en:
This is Marije and Ndrek (the couple) and their daughter, Nushe.  Nushe's daughter needs to visit health specialists, so Marije is seeking your compassion to pay for her granddaughter’s visit to a medical clinic in Italy because she suffers from a chronic illness.  Marije feels that doctors in Albania have not paid much attention to her granddaughter's illness. 

Marije receives a retirement pension, whereas Ndrek has been working as a welder for these past 24 years. Their son also works in a nearby country, and he helps them financially as well. The city of residence for them has been Lezha for the past nine years.

loans.use: to pay for her granddaughter's visit to a health specialist; she suffers from a chronic illness

loans.name: Serly Victoria

texts.es:
Serly es una mujer de buenas ideas y de mente creativa, siempre está tratando de buscar actividades para aumentar sus ingresos familiares.

Ella monto un café internet desde hace varios años y vende alternativamente algunos elementos de papelería en el mismo negocio.

Ella tiene 20 años y tiene todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar los desafíos que la vida le tenga preparados.

Ella solicita un apoyo económico para comprar algunos elementos de papelería para surtir un poco sus vitrinas y exhibidores. Con este dinero podrá invertir en su negocio y atraerá más clientes impactando de esta manera sus utilidades de una manera positiva.

Su mayor sueño es tener una gran sala de internet con buenos ingresos y generar empleo.
texts.en:
Serly is a woman of good ideas and creative mind, always trying to look for activities to augment her family income.

She opened an internet cafe several years ago and also sells some stationery items in the same business.

She is 20 years old, and is charged up to face the challenges that life has prepared.

She requests a loan to buy some stationery items, to stock up her displays and showcases. With this money she will invest in her business and attract more customers, thus impacting her profits in a positive way.

Her greatest dream is to have a great internet room with good income and employment.

loans.use: to buy some stationery items to restock her displays a bit

loans.name: Tabitha A.

texts.en:
Tabitha, pictured above, is a hard-working entrepreneur who sells solar products to rural communities in Kenya. She is 32 years old, married, and has two children. Her son is 7 years old and attends Class 3 in Primary School. Her daughter is 2 ½ years old and will attend Kindergarten next year.  

Previously, Tabitha was a member of the Kenya Women’s National Volleyball Team, but due to the high cost of travel and the need to be closer to her family, Tabitha was forced to drop out. With her little savings, Tabitha purchased a few solar home systems, including BrightBox, One Degree Solar’s solar energy kit that powers lights, phones, and radios, and began to educate local communities, primary schools, and women’s groups on the benefits of solar. Through her product demonstrations and trainings, Tabitha was able to grow her business and improve the lives of thousands by providing access to sustainable energy products. With the small margins that Tabitha has earned, she has also been able to uplift her family. 

Through a Kiva loan, Tabitha will be able to purchase 15 solar kits, which will allow her to increase her inventory to serve more customers, scale her business, and earn more money for her family. Her long-term goal is to conduct trainings and live demonstrations across the entire Western Kenya region on the benefits of solar energy when compared to traditional energy sources, such as candles, kerosene, and disposable batteries.

loans.use: To purchase solar lights to supply to households and schools without energy access.

loans.name: Hmaw Bi Village Group 1

texts.en:
This community is located in Hmaw Bi Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, 5 CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 23 village customers. This loan will help some group members purchase ducks, whereas other group members will use the funds to purchase high-quality feed, costing $28 for 6 days to feed 100 ducks. This use will boost villagers' incomes from more duck eggs. 

Hmaw Bi village has a population of over 1,300, and many of them are farmers. Those with arable land cultivate rice paddies and plant seasonal vegetables and fruits such as bananas and coconuts. Besides duck raising and farming, villagers also raise pigs as a source of saving. Some households have small grocery or dry food stores at their houses.

Pictured above are CBO members from Hmaw Bi Group 1, named Htwe, Su, Than, Thandar and San. Htwe (seated, first from left) is 47 years old and married with three children. In addition to raising ducks, Htwe and her husband farm their crop farm and have two pigs. Htwe has raised ducks for over 20 years. Like her fellow members, Htwe will purchase high-quality feed with Proximity's loan.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and high-quality feed

loans.name: Hmaw Bi Su Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Hmaw Bi Su Village, in the Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. There are 5 CBO (Community Based Organization) members overseeing a group of 22 village customers. This loan will help the group members purchase ducks or ducklings and also repair their duck farms. The funds will also enable remaining group members to purchase high quality feed.  

Hmaw Bi Su village has over 3,000 villagers, and many of them are farmers and livestock raisers. Some households plant seasonal vegetables and nipa palms. For livestock, in addition to ducks, villagers also raise pigs and chickens. Pigs are raised as a source of savings, while chickens are boost income (similar to ducks).  Villagers prefer ducks since they have significantly lower disease rates.

Pictured above are the CBO members from Hmaw Bi Su Village Group, named Tun, Aung, Tun S, Kyaw and Win.  Tun (second from right) is 36 years old and married with four children, all of whom are students.  In addition to livestock, Tun farms his crop farm.  His wife both sorts out the house chores and sells livestock and farm proceeds at the town market. 

Proximity's loan will help Tun's family purchase high quality feed, so that the ducks will be better nourished and produce more duck eggs. The usage will boost the family's income.  Tun plans to use part of the proceeds to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase more ducks and high-quality feed

loans.name: Lucy Kerubo

texts.en:
Lucy, pictured above, is a passionate entrepreneur who sells solar products to rural communities in Kenya. She is 27 years old, married, and has two children. 

When Lucy first heard about BrightBox, One Degree Solar’s solar energy kit that powers lights, phones, and radios, she saw the potential to energize and empower households across her region. Using the last of her savings from banana farming, Lucy decided to start her own business from scratch to provide solar energy solutions to local communities without access to reliable, affordable energy. For the past 5 years, Lucy has been working with One Degree Solar to sell BrightBox to women’s groups, schools, and households in her town. 

While happy with her initial success, Lucy has realized that many customers cannot afford to pay with cash upfront. These same customers are often stuck spending $10-$15 per month - a considerable portion of their income - on lighting and phone charging. To break this cycle and provide renewable energy to these customers, Lucy would like to start offering flexible payment terms to those who need it most, while also increasing her inventory on hand to serve more customers. She seeks support from Kiva lenders to make this happen.

Lucy will use funds for 15 units of BrightBox solar kits, which will energize and empower households across her region. Customers will be able to collect BrightBox systems immediately and pay for them upfront or over several months. Since they are currently spending money on polluting, unsafe, and inefficient energy, most will save enough to recoup costs in 4-5 months and never worry about fuel or fire again. With your help, Lucy will help families eliminate energy expenses, improve safety, and allow their children to read into the night.

loans.use: To purchase solar lights to supply to households and schools without energy access.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fresh fruit for his  juice stall

loans.name: Viviana Carolina

texts.es:
Gracias a la perseverancia y coraje de Viviana es que su hogar puede tener una vida digna.
Ella prepara y vende comidas rápidas en el municipio de Medellín, actividad que emprendió con el afán de buscar nuevos ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.
Su esposo e hijos son la mayor motivación que tiene para trabajar diariamente y esforzarse para ser cada día mejor.

Trabaja con sola durante 6 horas todos los días.
Ella espera poder impulsar su negocio con la compra insumos y materia prima, este impulso se lo pueden dar la Corporación Interactuar y los prestamistas de Kiva.

Con estos elementos ella podrá tener sus alimentos disponibles para sus clientes en todo momento.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un restaurante en la misma zona para no perder a sus clientes.
texts.en:
It is thanks to Viviana's perseverance and courage that her household can have a respectable life.  She prepares and sells quick meals in the city of Medellín, something she undertook with the ambition of looking for new sources of income to support her family.

Her husband and children are the biggest motivation she has to work each day and make an effort so that each day she is improving.

She works alone for six hours every day.  She hopes to be able to energize her business with the purchase of ingredients and supplies.  This energy can be given by Interactuar Corporation and Kiva lenders.

With these items she will be able to have her meals available for her customers at any time.

Her biggest dream is to be able to have a restaurant in the same neighborhood, so as not to lose her customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for her quick meals.

loans.name: Butrint

texts.en:
Butrint is 21 years old and single.  He is very energetic and has a lot of ambition for his future. He is planning to start a business with his father, operating and owning a small pizza restaurant. His mother is employed by the post office and his family is very supportive. 

The loan that he is requesting is to help with the start up costs of his business and will be used to purchase a pizza oven and grill. He is very optimistic that he will be successful and have a productive business. 

Butrint feels confident because he is very friendly and has a lot of friends and potential customers. He has also gained experience and insight by working other pizzerias before. 

He really likes this profession, and his eventual goal is to open a big restaurant and serve many people from all over.

He is very grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase a pizza oven and grill

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase amount of sugar, milk, tea, and coffee, and different drinks

loans.name: Andi

texts.en:
This is Andi and his wife Lule, or ‘flower’ in English; they are applying for a loan from lenders that will help them buy a dairy cow, feed for it, and a vehicle that he will use in his construction activity. 

Andi is 39 and a father to their two children, 17 and 10; construction and agriculture are the types of activity that he has engaged himself for years now. He considers himself ‘a journeyman’ in construction, and does the work with his own materials. As far as the agricultural concerns, he owns about 14 dynym lands where they plant mainly wheat and corn. While he keeps the wheat for his own use, he sells the corn. 

Living with Andi and his family are his parents as well, who contribute their retirement pension.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, feed for it, and a vehicle that he will use in his construction activity

loans.name: Minire

texts.en:
Minire is 44 years old and the mother of three children. She and her family are living in a small village in the southern part of Kosovo. Her husband is the main source of income, working as a security guard in a private company, but his salary is low. 

Minire's life was not always easy, as she has always lived in poverty. She is not satisfied with the way she has lived, and wants to provide a much better life and opportunities for her children. She has owned a cow in the past to provide milk and dairy to her family, and she enjoyed taking care of the cow and contributing to her family, but she had to sell it when finances were more difficult than normal. 

Now, she is requesting a loan in order to renovate her stable and purchase another cow. She plans to start to selling milk in her neighborhood, contribute to the family budget, and save money for her children's future. 

She hopes in the future to add even more cows and create a small farm to improve their lives and income even more. 

She is very happy for the opportunity, and thanks all of the lenders.

loans.use: to renovate her stable and purchase another cow

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
This is Adelina and her husband Gezim or ‘Joy’ in English. She is seeking your compassion to pay for her husband’s visitation to a doctor. Adelina receives a retirement pension of $115/month whereas her husband's pension is $125/month. They also have a son who offers taxi services in the city of Korce, where they live.

Adelina and her family are members of the ethnic vulnerable community of Egyptian Albanian. The majority of this community lives in their city and in three other large cities in Albania. Long ago it was suburban where they lived, but since the cities have expanded, their house is situated in the urban areas. Kindly note, that this ethnic minority is known for their multiple talents including music and dance, craftsmanship, recycling and buying/selling used and new items.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's health visitations for aches and pains.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 19-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a small house. Mohammad has a grocery store which has been opened for the past two months. It is a very good business and the demand is high. but Mohammad would like to improve it.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more grocery products for his store to sell. This will increase his sales and also his income.

Mohammad appears in the photo in his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products

loans.name: Abdel Hadi

texts.en:
Abdel Hadi is a 29-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He also works in a stall for selling canned food and kid's candy. It is a good business and provide a good income.

Abdel took a $2,000 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products for his food stall to resell. This will increase his sales and also his income.
