loans.use: to buy more products for his food stall to resell.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a 33-year-old single woman from Rafah city. She lives with her family in a simple humble house. Rana's brother works in fishing. It is a very good business, and provides the family with a very good income. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Rana took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her brother buy a new net for the fishing work. This will improve his business. 

Rana appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new net for her brother's fishing work.

loans.name: Jawdat

texts.en:
Jawdat is a 31-year-old married man from Khanyounis. He is a father of two small daughters. Jawdat has a grocery store which has been opened for the past two years. It is a very good business and the demand is high.

Jawdat took a $1,500 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more grocery products for his store to resell. This will increase his sales and also his income.

Jawdat appears in the photo in his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products for his store to resell.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 25-year-old single man from a village near Nablus city. He lives with his parents and two brothers. Abdallah has a grocery store which has been opened for the past two years. It is a very good business, and the demand is high.
 
Abdallah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more grocery products for his store to sell. This will increase his sales and also his income. 

Abdallah appears in the photo in his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products

loans.name: Mousa

texts.en:
Mousa is a 21-year-old single man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his parents in a small house. Mousa has a grocery store which has been opened for the past year. It is a very good business and the demand is high. 

Mousa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more grocery products for his store to sell. This will increase his sales and also his income. 

Mousa appears in the photo in his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fertilizer to grow and sell rice

loans.name: Katherine

texts.es:
Katherine, en su incansable búsqueda de una mejor vida y una mejor estabilidad económica para su hija de 5 años, inicio con un negocio de arreglo de uñas y cepillado de cabello prestando su servicio a domicilio en el municipio de Medellín, un municipio donde el empuje y verraquera es un referente muy importante de los habitantes de esta zona.

Ella trabaja todos los días en horarios muy variados y siempre está ocupada en algún servicio ya que es muy solicitada por su buen trabajo.

Solicita un aliento económico para realizar la compra de un modulo de peluquería y tintes de muchos colores, así podrá prestar un mejor servicio y podrá mantener a flote su servicio.

Hoy en día se siente feliz por el buen trabajo que hasta ahora ha realizado y que le ha permitido gozar de un trabajo más estable.

Con un crédito podrás apoyar a Katherine a continuar con su proyecto de vida!¡
texts.en:
In her tireless search for a better life and better financial stability for her five year old daughter, Katherine started a business of doing nails and hair.  She provides home service in the Medellín municipality.  Drive and determination are very important standards to the inhabitants of this area.

She works every day, and her schedule varies a lot.  She is always busy with some service because she is requested a lot because of her good work.

She is requesting a financial assist to buy a hairdressing module and many colors of dyes.  This way she will be able to provide better service, and she will be able to keep her service afloat.

She is happy about the good work she has done so far and that she has been allowed to enjoy more stable work.

With a loan you will be able to support Katherine in order to continue with her life project.

loans.use: to buy a hairdressing module and many colors of dyes.

loans.name: Narcisse

texts.en:
Narcisse is 35 years old. He is married with five children between the ages of two and 16 years.  Three of them go to school. He is a farmer and has been producing rice for 14 years. His wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers to grow rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers to grow rice to sell.

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is 34 years old. He is married with one child aged three. He is a farmer and he has been producing rice for 16 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers to grow rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy seeds for rice production.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, to buy more fertilizers, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers to grow rice to sell.

loans.name: Pacifique

texts.en:
Pacifique is 37 years old. She is married with a child aged of five years. He goes to school. She is a farmer and has been producing rice for 19 years. Her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers to grow rice and to sell rice. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, to buy more fertilizers, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers to grow rice and sell rice.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.es: Desde muy niña, la madre de Rosanna le regaló una cámara fotográfica y desde ese moemento se convirtió en la fotografa de la familia, asi que en las fiestas paseos etc, ella tenia un cupo para hacer su tareita mientras todos se divertian. Cuando Rosana creció estudió en la universidad diseño gráfico y fotografia y hoy la calidad con que trabaja le ha permitido realizar estudios fotograficos y alternar con diferentes productos derivados de la fotografía, a una clientela que ha conquistado dia a dia, sin establecer un horario, trabajando a la medida de las circunstancias.  Sus metas de crecimeinto y expansión no se detienen y por eso planea seguuir estudiando para mantenerse actualizada en su desempeño. En la actualidad está aplicando a unc redikiva, primer financimeinto que hace a la Fundción Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una cámara fotográfica con mayor tecnologia y accesorios especializados. Con esta inversión mejorará aun mas la calidad de su servicio e impulsará su acceso a nuevos nichos de mercado, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
When she was a little girl, Rosanna’s mother gave her a camera, and that was the moment that she became the family photographer. At family outings, parties etc. it was always her task, while everyone else was having fun. 

When Rosana grew up she studied graphic design and photography at the university, and now the quality of her work has permitted her to pursue photography studies and be involved with different kinds of photography-related production. She earns more customers by the day, working when and as needed, with no fixed schedule. 

Her goals of growth and expansion are ongoing, and for that reason she plans to keep studying to stay up to date with her profession. She is applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy a camera with better technology and specialized accessories. With this investment she will provide even higher quality service and be able to reach new market niches, making her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy a camera with better technology and specialized accessories.

loans.name: Bujar

texts.en:
A loan of 60,000 Albanian Lek will help Bujar and his wife, Liri, or ‘freedom’ in English, to buy a dairy cow. They have been photographed together with the cow they currently have. They are parents to two children, 19 and 14 years of age. So far, their focus has been on agriculture and livestock with this being the only source of income for them. They sell about eight liters of raw milk/day, generating about $5/day, and also a baby calf a year at an approximate price of $600/calf. In the lands that they own, they plant mainly corn that they use as feed for animals and themselves. They also plant tomatoes and leeks which they sell in large quantities.

The village they’ve been living in was once considered a touristy place under the communist era. It is situated near the city of Elbasan. At the moment, nobody is visiting, due to the fact that all the beautiful scenery that was once there had not been preserved during these past years.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to improve the family earnings since this is the only source of income for them.

loans.name: Pina

texts.en:
Pina has been photographed with her husband, Ndoc; they own a little type of village restaurant and another little variety store located near their house and the village school also. The location is in their advantage, because both the store and the restaurant are frequented by students and their parents. In addition to this type of activity that they have been pursuing, Ndoc works as a school-bus driver for a monthly salary. They are parents of two; 15 and 10 years old. 

The loan that they are requesting from you will help them buy a grill for roasting meat for the restaurant and to stock up on inventory items for the variety store. 

Kindly note that since it was early morning when their photograph was taken, their restaurant was not cleaned yet and they felt uneasy; thus, they took a photo in the front of the place.

loans.use: to pay for a grill for their little village restaurant and stock up on inventory items for their variety store

loans.name: Saudith Susana

texts.es:
Saudith, a sus 34 años de edad, es una mujer carismática y servicial que se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que inició por la necesidad de generar ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia. 
A pesar de las adversidades, ella tuvo la fortaleza y la determinación para levantarse y seguir adelante y, gracias a ello lleva 2 años de trayectoria en esta actividad.
Trabaja todos los días durante 7 horas.
Su propósito en la vida es seguir progresando y por ello desea fortalecer su negocio acreditándolo con la compra de surtido de productos como abarrotes, granos, frituras, bebidas gaseosas y en general productos básicos de la canasta familiar, de esta forma podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor calidad y servicio, logrando aumentar notablemente sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe de sus ventas.

Saudith manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo su negocio con la ayuda de Interactuar y en un futuro desea convertirlo en un supermercado, en el que los clientes puedan encontrar todos los artículos que necesiten. 

Apoyando a este crédito estarás contribuyendo con el emprendimiento de las mujeres Colombianas!
texts.en:
Saudith, age 34, is a charismatic and helpful woman who works in her own business.  She has a grocery store that she started out of the need to generate income in order to get her family ahead.

In spite of the adversities, she had the strength and determination to lift herself up and get ahead.  Thanks to this, she has been engaged in this business activity for two years.  She works every day for seven hours.

Her aim in life is to continue making progress.  In order to do so, she wishes to strengthen her business by purchasing stock of products like groceries, grains, snacks, soft drinks, and basic needs products.  This way she will be able to offer her customers better quality and better service.  She will manage to notably increase her sales and the earnings that she gets from her sales.

Saudith says that her biggest desire is to continue growing her business with the help of Interactuar.  In the future she wishes to convert it into a supermarket in which the customers are able to find all of the items that they need.

By supporting this loan you will be contributing to the entrepreneurship of Colombian women.

loans.use: to buy stock of products like groceries, grains, snacks, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Entsar

texts.en:
Entsar is a 48-year-old widow from Jericho. She is a mother of one son and two daughters. Two years ago, Entsar decided to find a source of income so she can provide the necessary items her children need. She opened a grocery store in the city.
 
Entsar took a USD loan form FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more products for her grocery store to resell. This will increase her sales and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more products for her grocery store to resell

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 48-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her two sons and two daughters attend school. Her husband has been running his own clothing business for 10 years. He is responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothing in bulk to resell. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Abida is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband by purchasing these clothes for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan.
 
Abida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy clothes in bulk for her husband's business

loans.name: Maria Liliana

texts.es:
Maria, con 30 años de edad, se ha dedicado por 10 años a vender abarrotes en una tienda en el municipio de Chigorodo; de esta forma complementa los ingresos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos.

Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido luchar incansablemente, siempre buscando la manera de salir adelante, esto lo impulsa a solicitar el crédito para comprar una vitrina y comprará surtido al por mayor como mecato, gaseosas, dulces, productos de panadería, entre otros, esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y tendrá más variedad de artículos para ofrecer a los clientes, mejorando así las ventas y los ingresos.

Maria manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder adquirir un local propio ubicado en el centro de la ciudad para montar su negocio y lograr que sea mucho más rentable y que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Ella confía en el apoyo de la Corporación interactuar y en los prestamistas de Kiva para lograr este objetivo.
texts.en:
Maria is 30 years old and has dedicated 10 years to selling groceries in a store in the municipality of Chigorodo in this way complimenting the income that she has raised her children. Her tenacity and perseverance has allowed her to fight unceasingly always looking for a way forward.

This has prompted her to request a loan to buy a display case and and variety of goods like cakes, soft drinks, sweets, amongst others. this will allow her to with her work and have more variety of items to offer to her clients, improving her sales and income.

Maria says that her biggest dream is to be able to have her own store in the center of the city to open her business and make it much more profitable. It would guarantee her an economic stability suitable for providing a better quality of living for her family. She has confidence in the help from the Interactuar Corporation and the Kiva lenders to achieve this objective.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items wholesale like cakes, soft drinks, sweet, bakery items amongst others.

loans.name: Hatun Rumiyoc Group

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal HATUN RUMIYOC, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Melina continua con su negocio de venta de cosméticos como cremas, perfumes, colonias entre otros, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo a sus amistades, entre otros, la socia a la vez continua  administrando  un hospedaje, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes para damas.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de artesanía, producción de zapatos, periodista, contadora, elaboración de tortas.
texts.en:
Melina is a member of the communal bank Hatun Rumiyoc, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.  She continues on with her business of selling cosmetics such as creams, perfumes, colognes, and other items.  She feels grateful for the provided loan and she is committed to making her established loan payments.  She continues to sell to her friends, among others, and at the same time continues managing an inn, allowing her  to move her family forwards.  She is applying for a loan to buy women's perfume.

The members who appear in the attached photo asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting for work reasons.  The other members sell handicrafts, produce shoes, work in journalism, work as an accountant, and make cakes.

loans.use: to buy women's perfume

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmar es un hombre casado, es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable, trabajó con su familia en  diferentes negocios donde adquirió experiencia en las ventas. 

Desde hace 2 años inició con una tienda de abarrotes para trabajarla como independiente y  labora desde las 7:00 am a 10:00 pm  
Wilmar sueña con tener un supermercado a futuro, por lo pronto con el crédito solicitado desea adquirir al por mayor una gran variedad de productos como verduras, granos, frutas, hortalizas etc., y poder brindarle a sus clientes artículos de excelente calidad. 

Con este negocio ha podido salir adelante poco a poco e intentara mejorar su vida y la de su familia al lado de la Corporación Interactuar y los prestamistas de Kiva.
texts.en:
Wilmar is a hard-working and responsible married man who works with his family in various businesses where he acquired experience in sales.  

2 years ago, he started a grocery store so that he could work there independently and he works from 7:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.  Wilmar's dream is to have a supermarket in the future, but for the moment with the requested loan he wants to buy a large variety of products wholesale, such as vegetables, grains, fruits, and leafy greens, among other products, so that he can provide his customers with excellent quality products.  

Through this business, together with the Interactuar Corporation and Kiva loans,  he has been able to get ahead little by little and try to improve the lives of himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables, grains, fruits, and leafy greens

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is 56 years old and is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is the mother of 4 children, and her husband is a plumber by profession. 

While her husband is the primary earner responsible for his family's needs, Rabia has also been running her clothing sales business for the past 4 years. She is able to contribute income to her husband's, which helps them manage household costs.

Rabia needs to buy different types of clothing to resell, but due to insufficient financial means, she is not in the position to make the purchase. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With help from this loan she can buy the clothing with ease and fulfill her business needs. 

Rabia will be able to both earn more income and support her family and business. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Lefterije

texts.en:
Lefterije has requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 Albanian Lek (ALL) that she plans to use to buy pesticides for her plantations. She is in the photograph with her 2-year-old granddaughter, and due to the fact that it was snowing outside at the time of the photo, she preferred to stay inside for the sake of the little one. They are members of the ethnic minority of Egyptian Albanians.

Lefterije is 54 and a married mother of one who’s been practicing agriculture since her 30's; she owns about 21 dynym of agricultural land and about 8 she rents from other villagers where she plants mainly beans, red peppers, onions, wheat, corn, fodder, and beets. She also has a horse that she uses for the transportation of her products.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for her plantations

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is a 25-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her one child. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years; he is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Saira is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.
 
She needs different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc., for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and will also be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Saira is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business with different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is a 32-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years; he is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Uzma is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.
 
She needs different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc., for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and will also be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Uzma is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business with different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, threads, pieces of cloth and machine oil

loans.name: Olfat

texts.en:
Olfat is a 26-year-old married woman from Khanyounis. She lives with her husband and six kids — four sons and two daughters. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a very low income. This income is not enough to cover all the family needs. He also has a workshop for repairing electrical machines, especially refrigerators.

Olfat took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to buy more repair parts for his workshop. This will increase his productivity and also his income. 

Olfat appears in the photo.

loans.use: to help her husband buy more repair parts for his workshop

loans.name: Islam

texts.en: Islam is a 30-year-old married man from Khan Younis. He opened a barber shop five years ago. Islam now has very good experience in this field and he is well known in his area. Islam requested a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new chair for his barber shop. This loan will help him to improve his salon and attract more clients. Islam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new chair for his barber shop.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en: Zamira is 37 and a married mother of two children who go to school and are ranging in age between 14 and 17 years old. She wants to buy potato seeds with the loan that she is requesting from Kiva lenders. Since she turned 18 she’s been practicing agriculture in the 16 dynym of lands that her family owns; there she plants fodder, wheat and beans in addition to apple orchards. From the only dairy cow she has, she sells only one baby calf each year because the milk is not enough to sell. In addition to the income she brings home from all the activity above, her husband works for a construction company for a pay of $240 per year.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds for the seasonal planting that has already started

loans.name: Jadallah

texts.en:
Jadallah is a 35-year-old married man from a village near Hebron city. He opened a barber shop 7 years ago, and he now has very good experience in this field and is well known in his area. 

Jadallah has requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools and hair products for his barber shop. He will be able to both improve his salon and attract more clients. 

Jadallah appears in the photo above.

loans.use: to buy new tools and hair products for his barber shop.

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.en:
Shabnam is a 27-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her two children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years; he is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Shabnam is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.
 
She needs different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc., for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and will also be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Shabnam is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business with different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 26-year-old married man from Jabalia city. He opened a barber shop three years ago. Ahmad now has very good experience in this field and he is well known in his area.

Ahmad requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools and hair products for his barber shop. This loan will help him to improve his salon and attract more clients.
Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new tools and hair products for his barber shop.

loans.name: Victor Alfonso

texts.es:
Victor es un hombre con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.

Tiene una panadería en el que vende productos la mas alta calidad y el mejor sabor. Inicio el negocio hace 2 años y a pesar de su poco tiempo en funcionamiento ha tenido buena acogida en el sector.

El desea ampliar su oferta de productos y mejorar sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para darse la oportunidad de ser mas prospero. 

El dinero será invertido en la compra de materia prima como harina, queso, levaduras, entre otros.

Tiene grandes esperanzas en su negocio y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de entidades como Interactuar que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Victor is ready to take on the world and lead a full life through his efforts. He has a bakery where he sells products of the highest quality and best taste. 

He started the business two years ago, and it has been well received despite its short time in operation.

He wants to expand the product line and improve sales by injecting some capital into his business. This is why he is requesting a loan, so he may get the opportunity to be more prosperous. With the loan he will buy ingredients such as flour, cheese, leavening, and more.

Victor is placing great hope in his business. He thinks his future can be considerably improved, thanks to the support of institutions such as Interactuar that make it possible for people to dream of a better, more stable life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, cheese, leavening, and more.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is single and lives in Irbid. He is studying to get his bachelor degree in mechanical engineering, and he is now in his second year. 

The income from his father’s job is income for his entire family of six members. 

Mohammad’s future plan is to work in mechanical engineering.  He is a very ambitious guy who wants to improve his standard of living and develop his experience in this field.  He is working hard to achieve his dreams.

Recently, though, he is facing some problems that lead him to apply for an educational loan to help cover his semester fees.

loans.use: To help him cover his semester fees

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is 25 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and three children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 15 years. He is solely responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family.

Sadia's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories such as pieces of cloth, laces, needles, and sewing machine accessories. But due to financial constraints he is not in a suitable condition to buy these items for his business. Therefore Sadia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her husband to purchase these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn more profitable income.

For this financial assistance Sadia is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tools and hair products for his barber shop.

loans.name: Lisseth

texts.es:
Lisseth de 24 años, es soltera y tiene 1 hija, desde hace 1 año tiene una tienda de abarrotes  la cual atiende todos los días. 
Tiene como sueño ampliar su tienda donde distribuye artículos como leche, granos, verduras, lácteos y otros. 

En la actualidad tiene poco surtido y esto es perjudicial ya que no puede suplir con muchos productos que le pide su clientela. 

Lisseth, en vista de esto, optó en solicitar un préstamo con el fin de organizarse más y comprar al por mayor el surtido necesario como granos, azúcar, galletería, lácteos para incrementar su oferta y poder brindar mejor atención a las personas,  esto le representaría también el aumento en sus ingresos para cumplir necesidades básicas de todo negocio como son los servicios públicos, impuestos, y demás; mejorara también el bienestar de ella y el de su hija.
texts.en:
Lisseth, aged 24, is single and has one daughter. She has been running a grocery store daily for a year now.

Her dream is to expand her store, where she sells products such as milk, grains, vegetables, dairy products, and other goods.

Currently, her stock is low, and this situation is detrimental to her business as she is unable to supply her customers with many of the products they demand.

In view of this, Lisseth has decided to apply for a loan in order to get more organized and buy the merchandise she needs in bulk such as grains, sugar, cookies, and dairy products.

With this purchase, she will increase her sales and provide her customers with a better service. This will translate into an increase in her income, which will help her to cover the basic expenses of any business, including paying for utilities, taxes, and the like. In addition, she will be able to improve her and her daughter's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy the merchandise she needs in bulk such as grains, sugar, cookies, and dairy products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover his nephew's university fees and give him a chance to achieve his dreams.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is 34 years old an an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and two children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 10 years, he is solely responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family.

Zahida's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories such as pieces of cloth, laces, needles, and sewing machine accessories. But due to financial constraints he is not in a suitable condition to buy these items for his business. Therefore Zahida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her husband to purchase these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn more profitable income.

For this financial assistance Zahida is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To help her husband rent a kiosk in a busy area where he can sell more corn.

loans.name: Mar De Plata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MAR DE PLATA” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Dominga es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: taller de chapería, venta de cosméticos, venta de chompas, venta de ropa de bebe, tienda de barrio, chompas de alpaca, venta de alfombras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Dominga es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de zapatos y cosméticos por mayor; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, por iniciativa propia, al observar que es ampliamente comercializados en el mercado.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de zapatos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará a solicitud de la cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “MAR DE PLATA” communal bank is staring their 4th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional branch. It is made up of 8 members led by a board of directors with Dominga as the President. The businesses of the members vary. amongst them are a veneering shop, cosmetic sales, selling sweaters, selling baby clothing, a neighborhood store, alpaca sweaters and selling rugs.

The loan that is being taken out will benefit all these micro-entrepreneurs including Dominga. She indicated that she joined Pro Mujer 2 years ago on the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Today she has a business selling shoes and cosmetics wholesale. She let us know that she started this business several years ago on her own initiative observing the ample sales in the market.

The loan she is getting is to increase her capital (buying shoes wholesale) that she will acquire from the wholesalers in La Paz and later sell at the request of her clients. This method of working allows her to generate resources to support her family economically as she is married and has 2 children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she liked the health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase pagnes (colorful wax cloths).

loans.name: San Valentin Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN VALENTIN, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia Flor de Azucena continua con su negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, colonias entre otros, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo  a sus amistades, familiares, clientes entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes.
Los demás socios se dedican al negocio de tienda de abarrotes y trabajadores de empresa privada.
La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “St. Valentine” communal bank, the bank is located in the Cusco province. Member Flor de Azucena continues selling beauty products such as creams, perfumes and colognes among other items. She feels grateful for the loan and is committed to making the established payments. She continues to sell to her friends, family and other clients. She is a responsible and determined person, this is how she gets her family ahead.

The member requests this loan to purchase perfumes. The other members have convenience stores and work for private enterprises. The member in the insterted picture requested to be able to arrive late to the group meeting due to work commitments.

loans.use: purchase perfumes.

loans.name: Milena Patricia

texts.es:
Milena es una mujer muy emprendedora y tenaz, con grandes deseos que ha estado cultivando y tratando de cumplir.

Tiene una pequeña chaza en la que venda frituras, dulces, cigarrillos y algunas bebidas. 

Con esta actividad intenta día a día  salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia compuesta por su esposo y sus 4 hijos quienes son el motor de su vida y su motivación para luchar diariamente.

Su mayor dificultad es la competencia del sector, pero con su gran capacidad de trabajo es capaz de sostenerse y progresar.

Milena solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de surtido de dulces y frituras para su negocio.

Con tu ayuda Milena Podrá pagar la educación de sus hijos que es uno de sus más grandes sueños!
texts.en:
Milena is a very enterprising and tenacious woman with great desire that she has cultivated and is trying to fulfill. She has a small stand where she sells snacks, sweets, cigarettes and some drinks. She tries to get ahead each day and improve the conditions of her family which is composed of her husband and 4 children who are the main motivation in her life and her motivation to struggle daily.

Her main difficulty is the competition in her area but with her great capacity for work she is able to sustain her business and progress. Milena is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of sweets and snacks for her business. With your help Milena can pay for the education of her children which is one of her big dreams.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of sweets and snack food for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 39 лет, замужем, 4 детей. В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи 20 лет назад начала свой сельскохозяйственный  бизнес. Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул на сегодняшний день у нее есть 14 коров, 40 овец. На участке мерою 4,0 Га она выращивает люцерну. Выручка от деятельности составляет около 30,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бактыгул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и проведение ремонта дома.
texts.en: Baktygul is 39 years old and she is married with four children.  She began her own farming business 20 years ago as a way to earn income for her family.  Thanks to her hard work, Baktygul now has 14 cows and 40 sheep.  She also grows lucerne on a 4-hectare plot of land.  Her revenue from this business is approximately 30,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of developing her business further, Baktygul has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle.  She plans to use the income from this loan to develop her business further and to make repairs to her home.

loans.use: to increase her head of livestock

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгул 48 лет, замужем, от брака имеет 5 детей. В настоящее время занимается животноводством и полеводством.  Айгул имеет не только практический опыт в животноводстве, но и теоретические навыки. Она с большой ответственностью относится к своему делу. Ежегодно обрабатывает 3,30 Га земли, выращивая клевер и картофель. В своем хозяйстве Айгул имеет 6 коров, 15 овец, имеет сарай, где имеются все необходимые условия для содержания скота. Айгул обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений и коровы. Доходы от кредита она направит на ремонт и увеличение площади дома.
texts.en: Aigul is 48 years old and she is married with five children.  She currently works raising livestock and growing crops.  In addition to having practical experience in raising animals, she also has theoretical skills.  Aigul approaches her with with a great sense of responsibility.  She grows annual crops of clover and potatoes on a 3.3-hectare plot of land, and she has six cows and 15 sheep on her farm, as well as a shed that holds all of the necessary items for raising cattle.  Aigul has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy mineral fertilizer and a cow.  She plans to use the income from this loan to make repairs and expansions to the area of her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to cultivate her land and to buy a cow

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is a 23-year-old single, young man from a village near Tulkarem City. He lives with his family in a small house. Saleh opened a barber shop two years ago. It is a very good business and provides the family with a good income. 

Saleh requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools and a chair for his barber shop. This loan will help him to improve his salon and attract more clients. Saleh appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new tools and a chair for his barber shop.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Humilde y trabajador, así es Santiago, un joven guerrero que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al estudio, vive en el municipio de Envigado, donde se gana la vida con la preparación de alimentos variados como almuerzos y desayunos en un pequeño restaurante.
Trabaja con 1 familiar todos los días durante 6 horas.

Sus alimentos son conocidos por los vecinos del sector, quienes visitan su restaurante porque saben que podrá comer de una manera deliciosa.

Santiago ha decidido mejorar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, por esta razón acude a un préstamo para comprar ingredientes e insumos para sus recetas.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia y su negocio.

Apoya a este joven con un préstamo y haz realidad sus sueños!
texts.en:
Santiago is humble and a hard worker. He is a young warrior who has dedicated a large part of his life to studying. He lives in the city of Envigado where he earns a living by preparing various foods, lunch and breakfast, in his small restaurant. He works with a relative everyday for 6 hours.

His food is known by the neighbors in the area who visit his restaurant because they know they can eat in a delicious way.

Santiago has decided to improve his business and to increase his sales. For this reason he is applying for a loan to purchase ingredients and supplies for his recipes. This loan will allow him to move his business forward to in that way obtain the necessary income that gives him the opportunity to continue maintaining his family and his business.

Support this youth with a loan and make his dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for the recipes prepared in his restaurant.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma is a conservative married woman so she asked her daughter, Islam, to take her place in the photo. Basma is 39 years old, has three children, and she lives in Baqaa. Basma wants to see her children be successful persons in the future, so she is fighting all obstacles she is facing to pay the education fees for her children. 

Basma's daughter, Islam, is 22 years old now and she is studying at the university. She is in her fourth year, majoring in business administration. Basma is dreaming of the day when Islam will graduate and she will be proud of her. Basma asked for an educational loan to help her pay university fees for Islam due to an inability to pay her fees.

loans.use: to pay university fees for her daughter, Islam, due to an inability to pay her fees.

loans.name: Zahida Perveen

texts.en:
Zahida Perveen is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport services by driving a taxi for 18 years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of entire family. Her husband needs to maintain his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to maintain his taxi. Therefore, Zahida Perveen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Zahida Perveen's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily. He can provide better transport services to earn a profitable income. Zahida Perveen also plans to save a portion of her husband's profits to meet the family's needs in future. Zahida Perveen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike to take her goods to market

loans.name: Shela

texts.en:
Shela is a 27-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and two children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for five years. He is the only one responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Shela's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories such as pieces of cloth, lace, needles and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints he is not in a suitable condition to buy the above items for his business purposes. Therefore Shela has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her husband to obtain these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs so that he can earn more profitable income.

For this financial assistance Shela is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: help her husband to increase his tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in his business selling bread and clothes and to improve the sales that allow him to further support his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow so as to increase the milk supply to her clients.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16,000 PHP  through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Vivian has been in this business for five years. Vivian earns additional income from selling tobacco.

Vivian has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Asylkan

texts.ru: Асылкан, 50 лет, замужем, есть дети, самой младшей 5 лет. В 1985 году она начала заниматься сельским хозяйством. У Асылкан в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 2 овцы, дополнительно реализует молоко.  Также на участке мерою 1,0 Га арендованной земли она выращивает фасоль, перец и клевер для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет примерно 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса Асылкан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и корма для скота. Доходы от кредита Асылкан планирует направить на покупку земельного участка для полеводческих нужд.
texts.en: Asylkan is 50 years old, married and has children. her youngest daughter is 5 years old. Asylkan started doing agricultural work in 1985. At present she has two cows and two sheep and sells milk. In addition, on  a leased land plot of 1.0 ha [2.5 acres] she grows beans, peppers and clover for sale. Her monthly revenue is approximately 12,000 KGS. In order to develop her business further, Asylkan has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance association for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy a cow and animal feed. Asylkan plans to use the resulting revenue to buy a land plot to use for farming.

loans.use: to buy one cow and feed for livestock

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 53 years old and has seven children. She is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Teodora is in the agricultural business, and she raises goats in the Philippines. Teodora requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her goats. She has been raising goats for four years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Teodora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her goats.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 59 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Teofila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like soy sauce, seasonings, detergent soap, coffee, canned goods, noodles, etc. to sell.

Teofila has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soy sauce, seasonings, detergent soap, coffee, canned goods, noodles, etc.

Teofila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like soy sauce, seasonings, detergent soap, coffee, canned goods, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel, se ha ganado el cariño de todos sus vecinos por su amabilidad y buen sentido del humor. 
Ama su familia, la cual es el motor principal para luchar cada día y generar el sustento para sobrevivir. Aunque no contaba con recursos para iniciar su negocio, esto no fue impedimento para cumplir su sueño de convertirse en comerciante, con un pequeño capital, esta mujer inició con un negocio de tienda de abarrotes.

Sus sueños no paran, por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de estanterías para ubicar sus productos y hacerlos más visibles y atractivos a sus clientes, además comprara surtido de productos de la canasta familiar para abastecer su negocio. 

Espera poder mejorar su condición económica, poder tener una vejez sin preocupaciones monetarias y garantizarle a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Maribel has won the hearts of all of her neighbors because of her kindness and good sense of humor. She loves her family, which is her driving force for working everyday and generating nourishment for survival. Although she did not have resources for starting her business, this was not an impediment to fulfilling her dream of becoming a merchant. With a little capital, this woman opened a grocery store.

Her dreams do not stop. For this reason, she finds herself requesting a loan that she will invest in buying shelves to place her products on, making them more visible and attractive to customers. Additionally, she will buy an assortment of family necessities to restock her business.

She hopes to be able to improve her financial condition, to have an old age free of financial concerns and to guarantee her family a good future.

loans.use: to buy shelves and an assortment of family necessities to restock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of iron and hot and cold solder for his workshop

loans.name: Donika

texts.en:
Donika is 38 and is in the photograph with Besnik, her husband. They have three children ranging in age from 6 to 16. 

They want to buy baby calves with your financial help that they will appreciate very much, according to them. 

The past ten years, their focus has been on the agriculture/livestock, and they have been doing well, as per their statements. They have 2 dynym of land, and they have rented from others about 12 more dynyms where they plant mainly fodder for the animals. Added to that, they’ve got about two dairy cows, 17 sheep and 20 chickens. From these, they sell roughly 20 liters of milk per day in a nearby dairy farm at a price of $0.40 per liter, two baby calves per year at a price of approximately $600 each, and also six baby sheep a year and 10 eggs per day. Besnik also works on other people's land for a pay of about $120/month. 

The reason they request your financial help is to buy baby calves to expand their livestock.

loans.use: to buy baby calves to expand the livestock

loans.name: Gjon

texts.en:
Gjon is 46 and a married father of four who has been photographed with his two youngest daughters inside their home. His home needs some repairs including the replacement of very old doors and windows. This is the reason why he is seeking your financial help. 

“It has been very cold inside the home and what worries me the most is that the children and my mother have to put up with such a cold place. We are poor and we cannot afford having heaters to heat up the place. Replacing some of the windows, it will probably prevent a little bit the cold,” said Gjon in an  interview.

Gjon has been a butcher for the past ten years and this is where he accidentally lost his left hand. The income in their family is as follows: a monthly disability income of $105 for Gjon, a monthly retirement pension of $104 for his mother, and $59/month.

loans.use: to replace the old windows and doors that buzz in all the cold.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow for more milk production so as to satisfy the demands of customers and also expand her small business.

loans.name: Tayseer

texts.en:
Tayseer is a 20-year-old single man from Khanyounis. He has a workshop for marble. He buys it as a raw bar and manufactures it so the construction workshops can use it in building kitchens. It is a good business and very profitable, but the raw materials are very expensive.

Tayseer took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy marble bars for his workshop. This will increase his productivity and also his income.

Tayseer appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy marble bars for his workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow for milk production so as to satisfy the demand of milk from her customers and also expand her small business.

loans.name: Wenly

texts.en:
Wenly is 21 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Wenly has a buying and selling of fruits business in the Philippines. Wenly requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fruits like bananas, jackfruit, etc., to sell.

Wenly has been in this business for three years. In the future, Wenly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits like bananas, jackfruit, etc., to sell

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco is 34 years old. He is married with five children, aged between one and  fifteen years. Four of his children go to school. Bosco is a farmer and he has been producing rice for 11 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers to grow and sell rice. The profits from the business will be used to pay more workers.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, to buy more fertilizers, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers to grow and sell rice.

loans.name: Edrona

texts.en:
Edrona is a 45-year-old, hardworking honest single woman, living in Kasese, Uganda. She is charged with the responsibility of looking after four children.

Edrona sells cassava flour, which is a business she started in order to pay school fees for her children and manage to meet daily expenses. Edrona hopes to increase her stock, but market competition and inadequate capital to expand her business are challenges she faces. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a hardworking woman who grows maize as her major crop. She lives in Masindi, Uganda. She also sells local brew as additional income. 

She wanted to sustain her family and educate her offspring, so she started up a farming business. She has a dream of educating her children to university, though price fluctuation and pesticides hinder her production. She wants a loan to plow and weed her garden.

loans.use: to plow and weed her garden.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her six children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family. He has been running his own scrap business and one of her son's has been running a mobile shop for the past two years.

Razia's son wants to purchase different types of mobile accessories for his business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore Razia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she’ll enable her son to purchase relevant items for his business purposes so that he can earn more profitable income to manage his business and household.

Razia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: help her son to increase his mobile business.

loans.name: Gjon

texts.en:
Gjon is a villager and a married father of four. He is 46 and for the past year he’s been raising livestock in addition to the agriculture that he has been in for years now. Currently, he’s got 4000 square meters of land where he plants corn and fodder and other seasonal veggies and has orchards such as oranges, plums, lemons and persimmons. Added to the above, he has chickens and pigs. Almost all of the products above are used for the family, selling only a bit of raw milk and a baby calf each year that comes from the dairy cow they have. Gjon receives a disability income of $99/month for one of their sons and an income of $250/monthly from their oldest child, their son.

Gjon wants to add another dairy cow since the one he has does not produce much milk anymore due to its age.

loans.use: to add another dairy cow since the one he has doesn't produce much milk anymore due to its age.

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is a 39-year-old married woman from Samtredia district. She lives with her husband, pensioner parents, daughter and sister, who works as a cleaner and gets a small income. She is the only employed person in the family. They live under poverty, as they have no source of significant income. 

In the region, there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. So, she decided to start trading business with the loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers.  

Natia’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives poor people the chance to start or restart businesses. Natia will rent or purchase a place for her new business, renovate it and start selling various kind of flowers. 

The little store she will own because of Kiva lenders will become the significant source of income for this six-member family and will satisfy even their increased needs. Natia will be very thankful for the loan.

loans.use: to start flower trading and get her own income

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda works hard to support her family. She is married and sells used clothing in the Philippines.

Yolanda requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more used clothing to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for six years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en:
Vevencia is 57 years old and married with six children. With one child still in school, Vevencia works very hard to provide for them.

Vevencia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock like vinegar, snack foods, noodles, cooking oil, soft drinks, candies, etc. to sell in her general store.

Vevencia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as vinegar, snack foods, noodles, cooking oil, soft drinks, candies, etc.

Vevencia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock like vinegar, snack foods, noodles, cooking oil, soft drinks, candies, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maen

texts.en:
Maen lives in Zarqaa. He is a 25-year-old single guy. He is a bachelor student majoring in Monuments Science. Maen chose this major because it is easier to find jobs in this field.

He has been facing some financial problems that prevent him from paying his university fees and completing his studies. Thus, he has applied for an education loan to help him pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Elvije

texts.en:
Elvije is a widowed mother of three children and also a member of the vulnerable Egyptian Albanian community. She lives in a little town in the central-north part of the country.
 
Elvije is a fisher woman. She fishes in a nearby lagoon and she is seeking your financial help to buy new fishing nets. The earnings from fishing are about $50/month and she has some pension totaling $123/month. She lives with one of her sons who is married and with a child. Her other son has been living in France for years now and he tries to help her financially a bit. Elvije has been fishing for the past 15 years and she says she has been enjoying it so far. Elvije was photographed repairing the fishing nets.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet, who lives in Masindi, Uganda, is married with four children. She operates a textile shop selling clothes, shoes and bags. She started the business to cater for her family's increasing needs. Inadequate capital is still a challenge on top of high license fees. She needs a loan to buy clothes, bags and shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes, bags and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Victorina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Victorina has been in this business for 16 years now.

Victorina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 57 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Angelita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her store.  She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, noodles, milk, cereals, beers, candies, etc. 

Angelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicines, do medical tests, and to pay for appointments with doctors and related travel expenses.

loans.name: Maribel Cirila

texts.es:
La socia Maribel  pertenece al banco comunal "UNION, FUERZA Y AMISTAD" de la Asociación Arariwa. 
La socia continua con su negocio de venta de anticuchos de forma ambulatoria, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de carne, carbón entre otros.
La socia  agradece a los inversionistas por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” loan group at Asociación Arariwa.

She continues working at her business selling roasted meat skewers as a street vendor. She has had the business for some time now, thanks to the hard work she puts in every day. Maribel continues to sell her products to customers as this allows her to help her family to get ahead.

Maribel is applying for a loan in order to buy meat, coal, and other items.

Maribel is grateful to investors for this loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy meat, coal, and other items.

loans.name: Los Amigos Empresarios Group

texts.es: Geraldine tiene 23 años de edad es soltera. Ella tiene su librería hace 07 años.  Su mayor deseo es ampliar su librería. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de útiles escolares cuadernos lapiceros lápiz. Ella participa en el grupo “LOS AMIGOS EMPRESARIOS”. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Geraldine es la tercera del lado izquierdo viste polo negro y chaleco jeans.
texts.en:
Geraldine is 23 years old and single. She has had a stationery shop for seven years. Her biggest wish is to expand her shop. Geraldine will use this loan to buy more school supplies, such as notebooks, pens and pencils. 

Geraldine is a member of the “Los Amigos Empresarios” loan group, which thanks Kiva investors for this loan.

In the photo, Geraldine is third on the left, wearing a black t-shirt and denim jacket.

loans.use: to buy more notebooks, pens and pencils.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal "Unión, Fuerza Amistad" de la Asociación Arariwa.
El socio continua con su negocio de compra de carros usados para luego desarmarlos y después vender sus partes como chatarra en una feria sabatina, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de faros, parabrisas de segunda.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” loan group at Asociación Arariwa.

The member, Leonicio, continues to work at his business buying used cars to dismantle and sell their parts as scrap at a Saturday market. Leonicio has had this business for a loan time, and it is going well thanks to the hard work that he puts in every day. This work allows him to get ahead with his family.

Leonicio is applying for this loan in order to buy secondhand headlights and windscreens.

loans.use: to buy secondhand headlights and windscreens.

loans.name: Burmachach

texts.ru: Бурмачач 54 года, замужем, есть 4 детей. У Бурмачач среднее образование, уже много лет она занимается земледелием и скотоводством, в качестве стартового капитала у нее было всего 20,000 сомов (KGS). Сегодня в хозяйстве Бурмачач есть земельный участок мерою 2,22 Га, где она выращивает фасоль. В хозяйстве есть и 20 овец. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 18,700 сомов (KGS). Бурмачач обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), на который она купит овец. Доходы от кредита позволят Бурмачач отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Burmachach is 54 years old and she has four children.  She has a high school education and for many years she has been raising livestock and growing crops.  Her startup capital was only 20,000 som (KGS).  Today her farm has a 2.22-hectare plot of land where she grows beans, and she also has 20 sheep.  Burmachach's monthly income is about 18,700 som (KGS).  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS), with which she plans to buy sheep.  The income from this loan will help Burmachach to make repairs to her home.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 29-year-old married woman from Khan Younis. She is a mother for one small son. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Maryam wanted to help her husband in the family expenses. so she started selling kids clothes on a stall.

Maryam took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new collection of kids clothes for her stall to resell. This will increase her sales and also her income.

Maryam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of kids clothes to resell in her market stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats to rear and sell later at a profit and also expand her small business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a 36-year-old married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Anita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Anita requested a PHP 23000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials like food containers, utensils, meat, spices, etc. for her food production business.

She has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Anita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials like food containers, utensils, meat, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Proscovia

texts.en: Proscovia is 55 years old and a hardworking married nurse with six children and 3 attend school in Hoima Uganda. She started the business of buying and selling produce like maize, rice and beans in order to supplement her business. She dreams of developing her business and paying school fees for her children. She will use the credit to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family.

Belinda requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like cooking oil, meat, salt, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

She has been in this business for 6 years now.

Belinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like cooking oil, meat, salt, spices, etc. for her food vending business

loans.name: Mphatso Credit Group

texts.en:
Manesi thanks Kiva for the previous loan that they granted her. She used the loan to buy different kinds of fish, and this helped her to increase her supply to the market thereby also increasing the demand. Manesi used the profits obtained from her previous cycle to buy a new sofa set for her house and to pay school fees for her children.

She will like to obtain another loan in order to diversify her business into a food shop. She believes this new business will help her to greatly improve her returns. Manesi is now able to pay school fees for her children without facing any difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase more fish in bulk, in order to increase profit margins.

loans.name: Dava

texts.en:
Dava is a widow villager from the north, and the way she’s been dressed can tell other Albanians where exactly she comes from. She’s been photographed in front of an animal stable that is about to collapse as showed in the background of the photograph.

The loan of 120,000 Albanian Lek that she is applying from VF Albania will be used to repair this stable and to pay for the arrears in the electricity bills.

Dava has one dairy cow and sells 1 calf per year and homemade cheese as well. Also in the 10 dynym of lands that she owns, she uses five dynym where she plants fodder and corn for the animals and also some seasonal veggies for the family use and also the rest five has rented out to other villagers. In addition, Dava is the caretaker of her paralyzed sister-in-law and receives some money for it.

loans.use: to repair the animal stable that is collapsing and pay for the electricity bill

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow for milk production to satisfy the demands of her increasing customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paints and brushes that he needs in his business.

loans.name: Zephania

texts.en:
Zephania is 66 years old and a single father of nine children and with four attending school in Hoima Uganda. He operates a retail shop mainly selling of general merchandise like salt, sugar, soap among other items, supplemented by incomes from agriculture.

He has hopes of satisfying his customers by expanding and developing his business. He will use the loan facility to buy more stock like salt, soap and sugar for sell. However, shortage of capital poses to him a big threat.

loans.use: to buy more stock like salt, soap and sugar for sell

loans.name: John

texts.en: John lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged 35 and a married father of two children, one of whom attends school. He has started a business buying and selling maize, beans and rice among other items in order to support his family, supplemented by income from farming. He hopes to pay school fees for his child and will use the loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Helder

texts.pt:
O Sr. Helder de 41 anos de idade,  casado e pai  de 3 filhos dos quais 2 estao a frequentar  escola no ensino primario e a outra nao tem idade para frequentar a escola. Ele è funcionario do Estado afecto  na escola secndaria.
Com os emprestimos anteriores foram aplicados no sector de habitacao para a construcao da sua casa e com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar produtos basicos (amendoim, arroz, feijao manteiga, tomate, cebola e mais diversos produtos) para iniciar com o seu negocio, actividade que vai explorar no seu estabelicimento comercial na sua casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Helder is 41 years old, married and the father of 3 children, 2 of whom go to primary school and the other who is still too young to go to school. He's an employee of the State and works at a high school.

Previous loans were used to build his home and this current loan will be used to buy basic products (peanuts, rice, beans, butter, tomatoes, onions and other various goods) to start his own business, which he will be carrying out from his commercial establishment in his home.

loans.use: buy basic products (peanuts, rice, beans, butter, tomatoes, onions and other various goods) to start his own business

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 29-year-old married man from Jericho who lives with his wife and small son. He works as a tiler in the construction industry. It is a good business but the income is not stable due to the low demand in winter.

Mohammad has taken out a $1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him buy more tiles at a low price for his business. This will help him to prepare himself for new orders in the spring and summer.

loans.use: to buy more tiles for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Vicente

texts.pt:
O Sr. Vicente de 28 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos 1 esta a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e a outra sem idade para  frequentar a escola. Ele è funcionario da Ara-Sul (Adiministracao regional da Agua do Sul) com cargo profissional de Mecanico Auto.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (cimento, barrotes, janelas, prtas, tijoleiras e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para terminar com a construcao da sua casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Vicente is 28 years old, married and the father of 2 children - 1 goes to primary school and the other is too young to go to school. He works as an Auto Mechanic for Ara-Sul (Regional Administration of 'Agua do Sul' [Southern Waters]).

With this loan he will buy construction materials (cement, rods, windows, doors, tiles and pay for labour) to finish the building work on his home.

loans.use: buy construction materials (cement, rods, windows, doors, tiles and pay for labour) to finish the building work on his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow for milk production so as to meet her clients' needs and also increase her number of litres of milk produced per day.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is 46 and the married father of a 17-year-old. He and his family lives in the northern part of Albania.
