He farms livestock, as well as selling biscuits to stores and doing seasonal agricultural work in Greece. His wife works in a nearby fish factory as a labourer. Andrea has bought 27 goats and given them to his brother to take care of, since they have to graze up in the mountains where the food is more nutritious. Of the livestock, he sells baby goats in the months of May and June. As far as the milk, he leaves that to his brother since he is the one who looks after the goats. 

Your loan will help Andrea pay for the goats, for which he still owes money, make some home repairs and prepare for seasonal planting.

loans.use: to pay for goats, repair his house and prepare his farm for planting

loans.name: Titukule Group

texts.en:
Margret appreciates Kiva for the previous loan that was granted her. She used the loan to purchase more beans. The profits from her business helped her to provide adequate basic needs to her children. 

Margret now has many customers and she is requesting another loan in order to buy more bags of beans since in the new season, beans are highly demanded. So she believes she will be able to benefit from them.
 
She plans on sending her children to better schools and she hopes to be able to cover her children's medical services in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy beans to resell.

loans.name: Zaida

texts.pt:
A Sr. Zaide de 35 anos de idade, solteira e mae de 3 filhos dos quais de 2 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario  e outro è menor de idade para frequentar a escola. Ela è funcionaria afecta numa Escola Primaria.
O seu primeiro emprestimo foi aplicado na compra de material de construcao para iniciar com a construcao da sua obra e com o presente emprestimo pretende comprar material de construcao (cimento cola, tijoleiras, e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para terminar  com  a sua  casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zaida is 35 years old, single and the mother of 3 children, 2 of whom go to primary school and the other is still too young to go to school. She's a member of staff at a Primary School.

Her first loan was used to buy construction material to start building her house and with this current loan she plans to buy construction material (cement glue, tiles) and pay for labour to finish the building work.

loans.use: buy construction material (cement glue, tiles) and pay for labour to finish the building work on her house

loans.name: Vasco

texts.pt:
O Sr. Vasco  de 24 anos de idade casado e pai de 2 filhos que estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario, sustenta sua mae e seu irmao mas novo. Ele è canalizador na empresa de producao de banana, actividade que esta a exercer a mais de 2 anos.
O primeiro credito aplicou para compra de Varoes,Cimento, Blocos para iniciar com a construcao da sua casa e com o presente emprestimo pretende comprar outro material de construcao (cimento, blocos, barrotes)para dar continuidade da sua obra e fazer pagamento de mao-de-obra.
texts.en:
Mr. Vasco is 24 years old, married and the father of 2 children who are in primary school. He supports his mother and his younger brother. He's a plumber in the banana production company, an activity he's been carrying out for more than 2 years.

He used his first loan to buy rods, cement and bricks to begin building his home and this loan will be used to buy construction material (cement, bricks and bars) and pay for labour to continue building his home.

loans.use: buy construction material (cement, bricks and bars) and pay for labour to continue building his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow for milk production so as to increase her number of litres produced as she meets her customers' demands and increases her income.

loans.name: Rodrigues

texts.pt:
O sr Rodrigues, de 37  anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos que frequentam o ensino primário. Para além dos seus filhos, de vez enquando, tem ajudado os seus pais que se encontram numa outra Provincia.  Ele  é  funcionário do Ministério do Interior, afecto no Porto da Mozal, é membro há mais de 05 anos.
Com o presente empréstimo será aplicado para comprar material de construção (cimento, varrões, tijoleira,  pedra, areia para aumentar a sua casa e, tem como grande desafio concluir a sua casa para acomodar os seus filhos e posteriomente adquirir uma viatura para a facilitar nas suas deslocaçoes.
texts.en:
Mr Rodrigues is 37 years old, married and the father of 3 children who go to primary school. As well as supporting his children he has, on occasion, helped out his parents who live in another Province. He works for the Ministry of the Interior, a permanent employee at the Port of Mozal and he has done this for more than 5 years.

This loan will be used to buy construction material (cement, rods, tiles, stone and sand) to expand his home. His big challenge is to finish the building work on his home to accommodate his children and then to buy a vehicle to facilitate getting back and forth.

loans.use: buy construction material (cement, rods, tiles, stone and sand) to expand his home

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
El señor Juan es un experimentado carpintero el cual a desde hace muchos años aprendió este oficio gracias a la experiencia obtenida trabajando en muchos talleres de maderas y con el paso del tiempo fue independizándose hasta montar su propio taller con el cual, a pesar de las adversidades, ha logrado salir adelante junto con su familia.

Su mayor orgullo es haber construido una muy buena reputación y prestigio gracias a su buen trabajo.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de madera que le permitan fabricar más muebles y lograr tener una buena rentabilidad por sus trabajos.

Su principal sueño está enfocado en sus hijos, puesto que quiere darles una muy buena educación y que en un futuro sean personas muy exitosas.
Siempre pensando en Interactuar como su aliado y compañero en su proceso productivo.
texts.en:
Juan is an experienced carpenter who through many years learned this trade thanks to the experience gained working in many wood workshops. With the passing of time he went independent opening his own workshop which despite adversities he has managed to get ahead with his family. His biggest pride is having built a good reputation and prestige thanks to his good work.

He is requesting a loan to buy wood which will permit him to make more furniture and be able to make a good profit from his work. His main dream is to focus on his children given that he wants to provide them with a good education and that in the future they are successful people. He thinks of Interactuar as his ally and companion in his productive process.

loans.use: to buy so he can make more furniture.

loans.name: Artan

texts.en:
Artan is 45 and a father to his children, 15 and 13 years old.

Agriculture is the activity that he has been pursuing for almost ten years. This has been the only source of income for his family of four. 

He’s got about ten dynym land. (A dynym is a tenth of a hectare.) He plants onions in two of them, potatoes in three dynym, beans in two and corn in the rest. He’s got five Alpine goats and he sells baby goats and dairy products to the nearby farmer’s market. 

Artan will use your loan to buy potato seeds for seasonal planting that has already started.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds for seasonal planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy materials (baskets, mugs, sweets, bread, flours and stuffed teddy bears) to produce breakfast baskets to sell to her neighbours and at college.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy products (makeup and perfumes) to have as stock to present to her clients and also to be able to deliver quickly.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Maria tem 65 anos de idade, viúva  e mãe de 04 filhos todos maiores de idade e estão a viver nos seus lares. Vive com 05 netos que as suas mães as deixaram com ela, todos vão a escola e estão na responsabildade dela.
Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar matéria prima (barro, lenha, pregos,chapas ) para o fabricar  panelas de barro, vasos, moringas, alguidares e outros utensίlios domésticos. 
É com base nesta actividade que consegue custear os estudos dos seus netos e de despesas de casa.
 Sonha em ter mais clientes para subir a receita e construir uma casa melhorada para aconchegar os seus netos.  Tem o desafio de reembolsar o empréstimo dentro do prazo estipulado, e pedir outro empréstimo para habitação
texts.en:
Maria is 65 years old, a widow and the mother of 4 children who are all of age and live in their own homes. She lives with 5 grandchildren whose mothers left them with her; they all go to school and are her responsibility.

With this loan she plans to buy raw materials (clay, wood, nails and sheet metal) to produce clay pots, vases, jugs, basins and other domestic items.
It's thanks to this activity that she is able to pay for her grandchildren's studies and household expenses.

She dreams of having more clients to increase her income and buy a better house to make her grandchildren more comfortable. Her challenge is to pay back the loan in the agreed time period and to ask for another loan for her house.

loans.use: buy raw materials (clay, wood, nails and sheet metal) to produce clay pots, vases, jugs, basins and other domestic items

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 55 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Alicia runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc..

She has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, Alicia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 60 years old with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Adelaida runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc..

She has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Adelaida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 37 years old. He is married with five children aged between 2 and 18 years. Three of them go to school. 

He is a farmer and he has been producing rice for 19 years. Also his wife is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers to grow rice and sell the rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy seeds for rice production.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, to buy more fertilizers farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers to grow rice to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 41 years old with six children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Anita runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like toothpaste, candies, groceries, etc..

She has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Anita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like toothpaste, candies, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 31-year-old woman with a great future ahead of her. She is a mother of four who has been running a small-scale mixed farm in Kenya for 10 years. Her primary income sources are maize, vegetables, and profits from a small-time personal business. 

Eunice is seeking a loan to purchase modern farming implements. She realized that she is working increasingly longer and harder on her farm. The work women in the area are currently doing on the farm was previously done by men. They have been forced to take over as their husbands migrate to find wage labour in urban areas. Therefore, the tools women use are of great importance for improving productivity and yields and reducing time and physical effort. There are health implications as well in using poor traditional tools. 

The increased income from the use of better tools will help her meet business-related expenses. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" Eunice replied, "I will be able to educate my children."

loans.use: To buy farm implements.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 56 years old and widowed with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Arsenia runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, junk food, groceries, etc..

She has been in this business for 20 years now. 

In the future, Arsenia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, junk food, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Milka, who is 43 years old and is very hardworking, honest and humble. She hails from Eldoret, Kenya, an area that is blessed with elite and world renowned runners and also the best weather patterns that favor farming activities. 

Milka is a proud mother of four children whom she really loves and adores. She will do anything in her power to always give them the best. 

She has been farming for the past five years, and through these years she has always provided them with all the basic needs that they require. Milka practices mixed farming, that is, crop and animal farming, and through these two she has been able to support her family, but she still faces challenges, which is why she wants to diversify and start poultry farming so that she can make ends meet. 

She is seeking a loan to buy poultry, and she believes that through the increased income she will be able to comfortably take care of her family and assure her grandchildren a secure future. 

Milka has experienced difficulties in acquiring funds to start her poultry business, but she now feels relieved knowing that Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and other lenders to support aspiring women like her to be economically empowered and be able to realize their dreams. Because of the many years that Milka has had in farming, she has learned the culture of saving and being honest with money. She hopes through the loan she will be able to save more and repay the loan on time. She believes that the loan will assist her to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children.

loans.use: To pay for poultry.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Jane. She is a 44-year-old smallholder farmer based in Eldoret, which is a small rural town in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. 

Jane and her husband have been blessed with 4 angel-looking children. For six years, Jane has been a mixed farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows vegetables, among other crops. Despite prevailing animal diseases, she finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. 

Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening. In African communities, gardening is the most popular, yet the least exclusive hobby for women.

Jane is taking this a little step further. She is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming. This is a big deal for her. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high. 

Income from this venture will cover the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace, 42, is a small-holder farmer who resides in the Eldoret area of Kenya. The loving mother has been a farmer for more than five years. Her primary income sources are eggs, milk and a side business. Grace finds farming to be very enjoyable. However, as she is aging, she is finding dairy farming to be challenging. She is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. Poultry farming is a less strenuous activity that is profitable. Many poultry farmers find a sense of fulfillment having hens all over their homestead. The hens lay eggs that can be consumed or sold. If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business since the demand for poultry products is always high. With your loan, Grace is going to make more income that will enable her to take care of her family's expenses. As the times keep getting harder, Grace is doing all she can do to ensure that her family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ardjan

texts.en:
Ardjan is photographed with his wife Shpresa, or 'hope' in English. He's been selling items for sometime, and since he doesn't have his own vehicle to transport the items from home to the market, he's been paying for taxi. 

The loan that he is requesting from you will be used to buy a tricycle. 

Added to this request, Ardjan and Shpresa wanted to thank their lenders for the previous loan.

loans.use: To buy a tricycle to transport the items he sells from his home to the market.

loans.name: Lirie

texts.en:
Lirie is 42 and a mother of three teenage children whose activity for the past almost twenty years has been agriculture/livestock. She has about 30 dynym of land. On some of this land, they plant cord and fodder for animals. Most of the land is left as pasture for the animals to graze. On just a few meters of land, they plant seasonal veggies for their family’s use. Currently, they have five dairy cows, fifteen chickens and piglets. Around their house, they have orchards including figs, pears and grapevines. They sell about 40 liters of raw milk/day at a price of $ 0.4/liter and also five baby calves a year. Lirie’s husband works too for a pay of $250/month. 

The reason she is requesting this loan is because she wants to buy a tool to cut the grass.

loans.use: to invest in a tool to cut the grass.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
L’homme qui a la tête du bœuf juste devant lui et la main levée est Gouanyouma.  
Gouanyouma est un jeune éleveur de 30 ans, marie et père de 6 enfants âgées  de 07 ans à un mois.
Les enfants ne sont pas scolarisés. Il a fréquenté l’école et compte inscrire tous ses enfants à l’école. Sa femme est ménagère et exerce l’élevage des petits ruminants. Il réside dans une commune rurale au Mali. Il fait recourt au RMCR pour avoir de l’argent afin d’acheter de bœufs pour les engraisser. Il ambitionne d’être un grand éleveur dans sa localité. Son activité consiste à acheter des petits bœufs pour les engraisses durant au moins quelques mois et les revendre sur le marché de sa localité. Le financement reçu  de RMCR est utilisé dans l’achat des petits taureaux. L’intérêt produit par l’activité l’aide à prendre en charge les dépenses familiales.  Il exerce ce métier depuis 10 ans et affirme qu’il fait beaucoup d’intérêt dans cette activité environ 30000FCFA par tête. La hausse des prix de l’aliment bétail est un problème qu’il rencontre très souvent. Il apprécie ce travail qu’il fait.
texts.en: The man with the bull's head just in front of him and with his hand raised is called Gouanyouma. He is a young breeder, who is 30 years old, married and father to six children, aged between one month and seven years old. The children do not go to school, but Gouanyouma went to school and is planning to register his children in school. His wife is a housewife and raises small ruminants. He lives in a rural commune in Mali and is turning to  RMCR so that he can get some money to buy bulls to fatten. His ambition is to be a significant breeder in his town. His business consists of buying small bulls and then fattening them up for at least several months before he resells them in the market in his town. The funding he gets from RMCR is used to buy small bulls. The money he makes from this business helps him to provide for the family's expenses. He has been carrying out this trade for the past ten years and confirms that he gets a lot of interest in his animals, around 30,000FCFA per head. The rise in prices of food for livestock is a problem that he often encounters, but he enjoys his work.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise and resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare her house to make more rooms to rent that will allow her to increase her income for the good of her family.

loans.name: Joao

texts.pt:
O senhor João, tem 37 anos de idade, casado e pai de 03 filhos, todos frequentam o ensino primário do 1º grau. Para além dos seus filhos, sustenta a sua mãe e o seu cunhado, ambos a viverem na mesma casa.
Com o presente empréstimo será aplicado para comprar de uma moto-serra industrial para a serracao de madeira para fabricar , aros portas, malas e muito mais.
O sonho do sr João é ter uma serração e empregar os jovens que neste momento não têm emprego. Apesar de enfrentar dificuldades financeiras, tem o desafio de reembolsar o empréstimo dentro do prazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Mr. João is 37 years old, married and the father of 3 children who all go to primary school. As well as his children he supports his mother and his brother-in-law who both live in the same house.

This loan will be used to buy an industrial chainsaw to cut up wood to produce door frames, trunks and much more.

Mr. João's dream is to have a sawmill and employ young people who currently don't have a job. Despite facing financial difficulties, his challenge is to pay back the loan in the stipulated amount of time.

loans.use: buy an industrial chainsaw to cut up wood to produce door frames, trunks and much more

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
El socio Mateo vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “UNION, FUERZA Y AMISTAD” de la Asociación Arariwa. 
El socio continúa con su negocio de anticuchos de forma ambulatoria, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando en su negocio para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos como carne, aceite, entre otros.
El socio  agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Mateo lives in the beautiful city of Cusco.  He belongs to the Unión, Fuerza y Amistad communal bank with the Arariwa Association.

He continues with his business of selling grilled meat in an itinerant manner.  He is a responsible and diligent person.  He wishes to be able to continue working in his business in order to continue supporting his family in this way.

He is requesting the loan to buy supplies like meat and cooking oil, among other items.

He is grateful to the lenders for the loan, and he pledges to make his payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy supplies like meat and cooking oil, among other items.

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.es:
Rogelia es una mujer de 27 años de edad, soltera, tiene 1 hijo varón de 8 años, y su negocio es la producción de estuco.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, fuerte, decidida, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Vichaya’ ubicado a 86 kilómetros de la ciudad, cuenta con importantes estructuras funerarias ‘Chullpares’ y sitios defensivos posiblemente de la época de los denominados “Señoríos Aymaras” 1100- 1400 dc., estas chullpas se pueden observar a simple vista en los municipios, de clima frio y seco, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 5-16 grados centígrados.
Rogelia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, viste de forma tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la comparte con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo. Su negocio es la producción de estuco, se trata de la roca (el yeso) encontrada en estado natural, convirtiéndola en una pasta flexible para ser aplicada sobre superficies como muros, cielos rasos y cementos, con la que se pueden hacer rellenos y revestimiento de acabados de la construcción. “realicé varios negocios anteriores, vendí empanadas, intente con una tienda de barrio, hasta que se me ocurrió elaborar estuco…” comenta. Su sueño es vender por mayor a ferreterías y tiendas de materiales de construcción, ella desea realizar la compra de leña y combustible para la explotación de estuco. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rogelia solicita un préstamo para la compra de leña y combustible para la producción de estuco.
texts.en:
Rogelia is 27 years old, single and has one 8 year old son. Her business is the production of stucco. She is a good mother, enterprising, strong, decided, responsible and hard-working.

Her business takes place in ‘Vichaya’ located 86 km from the city. It has important funeral structures called ‘Chullpares’ and defensive sites possibly from the period called “Señoríos Aymaras” 1100- 1400 AC. These funeral towers can be easily seen in these municipalities. It has a cold and dry climate with a daily temperature that varies between 5 and 16 degrees Celsius.

Rogelia is dark-skinned, with long black, braided hair, dark eyes, short in stature and thin. She wears traditional dress ( hat, shawl and skirt). Her native tongue is Aymara but she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and the work she does. She shares her life with her son who studies in school. They live in their own house made of abode with a metal roof and has electricity and well water.

Her business is the production of stucco which is rock (plaster) found in it's natural state converted into a flexible paste to be applied over surfaces like walls, ceilings and cement. You can use it to make filling and coating for finishing construction." I had several previous businesses, I sold empanadas, tried a neighborhood store, until it occurred to me to make stucco" she commented.

Her dream is to sell wholesale to hardware stores and construction material stores. She wants to make this purchase of wood and combustibles to make stucco. This is her first loan with the institute in the 3 years she has been doing this business. For these reasons Rogelia is requesting loan to buy wood and combustibles to produce stucco.

loans.use: to buy wood and combustibles to produce  stucco.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Irene, a youthful, 38-year-old mum. Irene is happily married and, together with her husband, blessed with four lovely children. 

She is a wise farmer, whom neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in Eldoret, in the Rift valley region of Kenya. For the past 12 years she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been growing maize and vegetables. She also keeps dairy cows. She has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Although she has been making profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with a challenge of timely delivery of the produce to the market. Irene is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge that has caused her to suffer so many losses. Perishable products, such as milk, vegetables, and tomatoes, require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price. This challenge has not made her give up; “I have to do something for my family,“ she said.

Irene mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo, via Kiva lenders, to buy another motorbike. Through this loan, Irene is going to achieve her dream and goal.

Accessing a financial solution is an uphill battle for women in Kenya. Irene feels relieved now to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo (with help from Kiva) that help women so that they can gain equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan are many, because Irene will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market. In addition, she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market, increasing her income level. 

Irene is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community, because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping her in farm work. With your loan, Irene will improve her living conditions and assure her children of a secure future.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike to transport produce to market.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Carmelita is 48 years old now.

Carmelita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed.

Carmelita has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed.

loans.name: Cheril

texts.en:
Cheril is 34 years old and married with seven children. With four children in school, Cheril works very hard to provide for them.

Cheril runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

Cheril has been in this business for 4 years now. 

In the future, Cheril would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 43 years old and has six children. Cynthia is married and has three children who are in school.

Cynthia is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Cynthia requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Cynthia has been in this business for 4 years now and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Cynthia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en: Speaking with Getrude, it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful woman, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and wellbeing. She lives in a humble home in the town of Eldoret, along with a handsome husband and their two angelic looking children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education. She has been doing agriculture for 7 years now. She makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs, and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her and also poor productivity. Getrude is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way in changing the life of Getrude and her family.

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en: Jeniffer is a 27-year-old woman with a great future ahead of her. For the past year, Jeniffer has been actively involved in mixed farming. As she is from rural Kenya, gender roles still adhere and women do the heavy work of fetching and carrying water and wood, in addition to household chores, childcare and tending crops. Many are left to run farms alone while their husbands migrate in search of paid employment. This has not been a setback because Jeniffer has been making great profits in dairy farming. Eldoret is one of the places with conditions that favor horticulture farming:  good climate, soil, a transport system, and a market. Jeniffer has always wanted to diversify and start horticultural farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is the lack of funds. She is therefore requesting a loan to start horticultural farming. Through the Tuiya self-help group, whose members co-guarantee each other to secure a loan, Jeniffer joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization that supports young and enterprising farmers. With this loan she intends to buy good quality vegetable seeds, flowers and potatoes. Proximity to an airstrip will allow her to transport the produce faster to an international market, enabling her to make more money. This loan will improve Jeniffer's living conditions and secure the future of her children.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Mayra Mercedes

texts.es:
Doña Mayra es una señora de 50 años que con esfuerzo día a día lucha para salir adelante. Ella lleva 11 años dedicándose a la comercialización y distribución de bebidas gaseosas en el mercado central de su municipio. 
Solicita el crédito debido a que desea invertir en su negocio y comprar nuevas bebidas como refrescos naturales, con el objetivo de complacer los gustos de sus clientes. Las metas y planes de esta mujer emprendedora son ampliar y abrir nuevas sucursales de su negocio en el municipio.
texts.en:
Mayra, age 50, struggles every day with great effort in order to get ahead.  She has been selling and distributing soft drinks for 11 years at the central market in her municipality.

She is requesting the loan because she wishes to invest in her business.  She will buy new drinks like natural soft drinks.  Her objective in doing so is to satisfy her customers’ tastes.  

The goals and plans of this enterprising woman are to expand and to open new branches of her business in the municipality.

loans.use: to buy new drinks like natural soft drinks.

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
Tarek is a 20-year-old single man who lives with his family in a poor area in Haja city, Yemen. 

Tarek is a very dynamic and responsible young man who studies in the university. His parents couldn't save for his study fees because they have not a fixed source of income. Tarek didn't give in to the miserable condition of his family but decided to start his own business through selling women's clothes in a small shop. That business was not profitable for him, so he decided to change it by selling food materials and different kinds of items. He started his business ten months ago. 

Unfortunately, his income is very low and he needs to a lot of financial support in order to enlarge it. His parents couldn't help him because they are very poor. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase different kinds of items such as canned food, soft drinks, and other necessary materials to be able to meet the demands of his customers.

He hopes that, by this loan, he will be able to attract a lot of customers to make money that will help him continue with his a study.

loans.use: to purchase canned food, soft drinks and other necessary materials for his a small shop to be able to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.name: Yeredeme Group

texts.fr: Mary est l’homme arrêté au bout du mouton et il a touché le mouton. Mary est un malien de 50 ans ; marie et père de 5 enfants âgée de 25 à 9 ans dont 2 scolarisés. Sa femme est ménagère ; ils habitent en milieu rural au Mali. Il exerce l’embouche depuis 8 ans. Il fait l’embouche des ovins maigres  comme activité. Son travail consiste à acheter des animaux maigres, les engraisser et les revendre. Il s’approvisionne au marché de sa localité  et revend sur le marché local en gros. Le prêt  du RMCR sert  à l’achat des moutons pour emboucher. Il souhaite agrandir son activité d’embouche  pour être financièrement indépendant dans les jours à venir.  Il génère un intérêt de 50000 f sur 5 mois, les profits lui servent à faire face aux dépenses de la famille. Mary affirme ne pas constater d’obstacle dans l’embouche.
texts.en: Mary is the man who is standing by and touching the sheep in the photo. He is from Mali, 50 years old, married and father to five children aged between nine and 25 years old; two of the children are educated. His wife is a housewife, and they live in the Malian countryside. He has been fattening lean sheep for the past eight years and his work consists of buying these lean animals, fattening them up and reselling them. He gets his supplies in the market in his town and resells them wholesale at the market. The loan from RMCR will be used to buy sheep to fatten up. He would like to expand his fattening business so he can be financially independent in the future. He makes 50,000 francs over five months and the profits are used to provide for the family's expenses. Mary confirms that he does not meet any obstacles in the fattening business.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and selling on.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase medicines, examinations and ultrasounds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies as well as school shoes and uniforms.

loans.name: Chamwino Group

texts.en:
Lwiza who is in her early 40's is single with three children, who are still at school.  She has been running two projects, Genge and charcoal for the past three years.  She works from 7:00am to 8:00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Lwiza’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use it to increase her stock of Genge and to buy sacks of charcoal stock. She dreams of opening an equipment shop.

Lwiza will share this loan with her loan group "Chamwino" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on her Genge stock and to buy sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her genge (fruit and vegetable stand) stock

loans.name: Limousine Group

texts.en:
Mele. who is in her late 30s, is married with two children who are still in school. She has been selling charcoal for six years now. She works from 06am to 07pm daily and is able to make a good monthly report.

This will be Mele’s 9th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the charcoal stock and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayments and household expenses. She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoals. She dreams of opening a food shop.

Mele will share this loan with her loan group “ Limosine” which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a very hard working woman who is 54 years old.

Cynthia has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients to produce more food.

Cynthia has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Elivera

texts.en:
Elivera has owned a wheat mill now for more than 20 years, About four years ago she replaced some of its major parts and now wants to replace some funnels with your loan.

Elivera also has some land where she grows apples, and she sells her fruit to wholesale buyers at a price of about $.30/kg. 

Elivera is in the picture with her husband, Pellumb.

loans.use: to buy funnels for her wheat mill.

loans.name: Arta

texts.en:
Arta has four dairy cows and owns some agricultural land where she plants feed for her animals and wheat that she sells it. 

Arta's oldest child, her daughter, has been diagnosed with a disease and she needs treatment as soon as possible and another visitation to the doctor. This is the reason, Arta is seeking your compassion and financial help.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's medical costs.

loans.name: Parwish

texts.en:
Parwish thanks all the Kiva lenders once again for their help.
Last season he made profits and saved some money for a pick- up truck. But that is not enough. Parwish wants to save more and continue his rice production.
For this, he wants to borrow another SRD 13500 to purchase diesel, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase diesel, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Nurije

texts.en:
This is Nurije, a mother and a villager being photographed with her own animals; for the past twenty years, her entire family has been focused on livestock. They have 150 goats and 15 sheep, 6 dairy cows and 20 chickens from which they have sold 4 baby cows, 60 baby goats and baby sheep and eggs and 1600 kg homemade cheese at a price of $6.4/kg as well. Around the house they plant some feed for their animals but it is never is enough. Nurije also receives a pension of $98/month and her husband receives $144/month
.
The loan they are requesting from you will be used to buy fodder for their animals.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her 171 animals

loans.name: Niko

texts.en:
Niko is a 50-year-old man who sells religious items near a catholic church where people claim to have health miracles. This church is visited by thousands of devotees and other people especially on the weekends. It is said that on the 13th of June and the prior days of every year, there are almost 1 million people visiting the church seeking miracles and donations for the poor. There are also people from nearby countries who visit this church out of curiosity.

Niko’s wife makes crochets and other lace work that she sells in Greece. They both receive some disability pensions in total of $210/month and also cash from their little activities. Niko’s mother lives with them and contributes her pension of about $98/month.

loans.use: to buy religious items to resell

loans.name: Dharmen

texts.en:
Dharmen is grateful to Kiva lenderms for helping him pursue his dream . He thanks them with all his heart.

He wants to buy a own rice plot, and for this he had already saved some money. He repaid his previous loans fully. With the profits he was able to expand his rice cultivation by sowing more fields. 

But to save more, he needs to plant more hectares with rice. For this, Dharmen needs SRD 10,000 to buy the fertilizers and pesticides for rice cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Yamikani Group

texts.en:
Bertha is  a mother of three children and she looks after two orphans. She used to be a homemaker and is obtaining a loans to help her to start up a new business. Bertha sells second hand clothes to people living in her surrounding community. She started this business to reduce her families levels of poverty.

Bertha will use the loan to buy more bales of t-shirts and skirts since this will help her increase her profit. She plans to build a better house for her children. Her previous loans have helped her become self-reliant.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy onions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand the wall on the side of her house in order to ensure the safety of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to continue building a room for his children. This will allow for more privacy and better conditions for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in her business in order to keep the products her customers seek to guarantee sales.

loans.name: Amanecer 16 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMANECER 16 DE AGOSTO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Adelaida es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chatarras, venta de mantas, venta de tucumanas, venta de miniaturas, venta de cereales tostados, venta de pescados, venta de chicharron (comida tradicional boliviana). 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Adelaida es integrante, ella indica que hace un dos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chamarras; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años al aprender la costura de estos productos en un taller, donde ella trabajaba como empleada, al contar con un pequeño capital decide implementar un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “AMANECER 16 DE AGOSTO” communal bank will begin its second cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Centro Focal de Panamericana. It is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors, of which Adelaida is the president. The businesses that the communal bank have are varied. Among them are selling scrap, selling blankets, selling tucumanas, selling miniatures, selling toasted grains, selling fish, and selling chicharrones (a traditional Bolivian food).   

The loan that they will take out now will benefit the micro-businesswomen, including Adelaida. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago at the invitation of a friend, who is a client of the institution. Right now she has a business selling jackets. She reports that she started this business several years ago after learning how to sew these products in a workshop where she worked as an employee. When she had a little bit of capital, she decided to start her own business. 
  
The loan she will take out now is to increase capital by buying fabric wholesale, which she will acquire from sellers in the city of El Alto. After making the products, she will sell them in her sales space. This work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is single. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the area of health that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.en: Alvaro is 22 years old and he is a mason. He lives at his parents' house. He works very hard every day. Right now he is helping to build chambers to contain water from rivers that flow under the city of La Paz. Alvaro needs a loan to buy equipment and tools.

loans.use: to buy equipment and tools

loans.name: Alondra

texts.es: Alondra is 20 years old and she lives with her parents. Alondra colaborates a lot at her house because she loves her parents very much. That is why she needs a loan, Alondra wants to finish the construction at her parents house Alondra works at a packing bread company and she works a lot.  Alondra is in her home in the picture as you can see it is important to finish the details at her parents house Alondra really want to have a "complete" home
texts.en:
Alondra is 20 years old and she lives with her parents. Alondra collaborates a lot at her house because she loves her parents very much. That is why she needs a loan, Alondra wants to finish the construction at her parents' house. Alondra works at a bread-packing company and she works a lot. 

Alondra is in her home in the picture. As you can see, it is important to finish the details at her parents' house. Alondra really wants to have a "complete" home.

loans.use: to finish the construction at her parents' house

loans.name: Diomedesia

texts.en:
Diomedesia is 59 years old and married with four children. Diomedesia works very hard to provide for them.

Diomedesia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, junk foods, groceries, etc.. Diomedesia has been in this business for 6 years now. 

In the future, Diomedesia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, junk foods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Santa Rosa, está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, son de una zona eminentemente rural, donde todas están luchando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Señora Liboria, es una de las integrantes, ella tiene una despensa en el cual trabaja diariamente para salir adelante, genera su propio ingreso y ayuda a su familia. Es una mujer muy luchadora y sacrificada que lucha y se esfuerza por sus seres queridos.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser verduras, carne, frutas, enlatados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group name is Santa Rosa and they are in their first loan cycle of the women’s committee program.  They are from a prominent rural zone where all of them are struggling to improve their living conditions.

Liboria is one of the members.  She has a store where she works every day to get ahead. She generates her own income and helps her family.  She is a selfless woman who struggles and works hard for her loved ones. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of supplies for her store, such as vegetables, meat, fruits, can goods and others to be able to continue to work as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, fruits, can goods and others to supply her store.

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.es:
Zacarías tiene 55 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto con su cónyuge y su menor hijo de 16 años de edad el cual cursa secundaria en colegio nacional del Distrito de Pucara, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, así como de verduras, las ventas lo realiza en el mercado de abastos de su distrito, también se desempeña como operador de maquinaria pesada en la Municipalidad de su distrito.

Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Zacarías is 55 years old. He lives in his own home made of rustic materials with his wife and their 16 year old son who is in the public high school in the district of Pucara. It is a community with a warm climate. Its population works in agriculture, trade and cattle. It is located in the province of Jaén and belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern sierra of Peru. 

He sells general groceries such as vegetables. He sells in the wholesalers market of his district. He also works as a heavy machinery operator for the town hall in his district.   

He has asked for a loan to buy a variety of products to offer his customers and thus generate more income for his family and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to offer his customers.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Divino Niño Jesus, está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty,  una zona eminentemente rural, una zona alejada de la zona urbana de la ciudad.
La Señora Elida, es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas en la ciudad y en zonas aledañas. Ella con ese trabajo genera ingresos y ayuda a su familia para salir adelante. Comenta que su meta es poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener y evitar que pase por necesidades.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas para la venta, como ser remeras, camisas, pantalones, jeans y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group called 'Divino Niño Jesus' is in their first cycle with the Woman's committee Program. It is from the city of Curuguaty, a very rural zone far away from the urban areas of the city.

Elida is one of the members. She sells clothing in the city and the surrounding areas. With this work she generates good income and helps her family to get ahead. She comments that her goal is to be able to provide her loved ones all that she could not have and avoid them going without. She is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of a variety of clothing for sale such as t-shirts, shirts, pants, jeans and others so that she can continue with her work as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shirts, pants, jeans and others.

loans.name: Narsisa

texts.es:
La señora Narsisa es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, ella se dedica a la venta de roperías varias, comenta que le va muy bien en sus ventas, y que ya tiene muy buena clientela.
Es una señora muy luchadora y emprendedora, que está esforzándose arduamente para que a su familia no les falte nada.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas varias, como ser jeans, remeras, pantalones, polleras y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo y sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Narsisa is from the city of Curuguaty. She sells varied clothing. She says that it is going very well for her in her sales, and that she already has a very good clientele. 

She is a women who is a fighter and enterprising who is working very hard so her family will lack for nothing. She is asking for this loan to buy varied clothing such as jeans, t-shirts, pants, skirts and more. This way, she can continue with her work and her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy jeans, t-shirts, pants, skirts and more to sell.

loans.name: Montserrat

texts.en: Montserrat is married and has a twelve-year-old son. Her husband is a taxi driver and she sells bread, snacks and candy outside of her house. She is asking for a loan to buy more products for her food stall. She started helping her parents but then she began to manage the business on her own and introduced more products. Her biggest achievement is her role as a mother and having a stable marriage. She likes to work and help her husband with the expenses.

loans.use: To buy bread and snacks for sale.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is 30 years old. She is single and she lives in her parents' house. Lourdes is still working as a secretary in the same office. She has the chance to take another class to improve her education so she needs the loan to pay for a class in business administration because she has the chance to get a promotion in her job. Lourdes is single and responsible, so she hopes you can trust her again.

loans.use: to pay for  a business administration class.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a room for her daughter, to allow her to have better conditions and among all privacy by having her own space.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rosa Mistica está en su ciclo número 3, es un Comité de mujeres trabajadoras, donde estas señoras son muy sacrificadas, todas vecinas y la mayoría trabajan juntas en artesanía, ellas hacen ferias y ahí venden sus productos. Se reúnen siempre para brindarse apoyo y ayuda unas a otras. 
Las señoras son luchadoras, entre ellas se destaca Reinalda, quien se dedica a la venta de frutas de manera ambulante, comenta que por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia, y tiene los ingresos para poder darle a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de frutas frescas para la venta, como ser manzanas, piñas, naranjas, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo y seguir luchando cada día.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Rosa Mistica" is in its third loan cycle.  This is a group of hardworking and self-sacrificing women who are all neighbors.  Most of them work together in handicrafts.  They hold fairs where they sell their products.  They always meet to provide support and help to each other.  These are tenacious women.

One of these women is Reinalda, who has a business selling fruit from place to place.  She tells us that through her work she helps her family, and she has the money to give her loved ones everything that she was not able to have.

Reinalda is requesting this loan to buy fresh fruit to sell, such as: bananas, pineapples, oranges, and other fruit.  This way, she can continue with her sales as she has been doing, and continue to fight for success each day.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: José Ignacio

texts.en: José Ignacio repaid his first loan on time and now is asking for a second loan to continue investing in his fruit-selling business. He says that his goal is to continue investing and growing his business, achieving financial independence, and helping his parents.

loans.use: to stock his fruit-selling business with seasonal produce

loans.name: Michel

texts.en:
Michel's father was all about the bakery business. He made a normal life out of a small bakery business. Michel has reported that all his good memories of his father have been related to bakeries. They enjoy making bread for fun.  Thanks to this common interest, the owner and his dad were able to spend a lot of time together. 

A few years later, Michel decided to start his dream business operation. He created a line of baked goods that resonates with his love for his father, for people, and his heart to see lives change in the community.  Due to challenges, he has called several other friends for help. 

La Difference Boulangerie is an agribusiness company that processes raw materials into food products. Consequently, the business has bought flour, processed eggs, and pasteurized milk to make tasty bread and other baked products for its clientele. For years, the business has been using one industrial propane gas oven which has helped with the transition from wood charcoal to a cleaner energy. 

The business has been making huge leaps in getting the venture going. But the business is still lacking some equipment that will be crucial to the success of the firm. Because of equipment depreciation and the high increase of customer demand, the business needs to acquire an electric oven, and commodity processor materials. This is where the Zafen loan request comes in.

loans.use: an electric oven and raw commodity processor materials

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El Sr. Sergio  es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, es una persona que se esfuerza siempre por poder ayudar a su familia y sus seres queridos. Comenta que tiene un negocio ubicado en su propio local, además se dedica a la Ganadería en pequeña escala. 
Es una persona que quiere crecer, todo esto por medio de su propio esfuerzo. Pide este préstamo para la compra de ganados, para poder criarlos y venderlos. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Sergio is from the city of Curuguaty. He's always making efforts to help his family and loved ones. 

He has a business located in his own shop, and additionally he works  as a small-scale livestock farmer. 

Sergio wants to grow through his own performance. He's requesting this loan to buy livestock that he will raise and sell. 

He's grateful for the opportunity to continue with his work.

loans.use: to buy livestock to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing materials for resale

loans.name: Daimonth Hector

texts.es:
Daimonth es un hombre de 37 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de derecho.
Él es inteligente, responsable, comprometido con sus estudios, constante, responsable y trabajador. Sus estudios lo realiza en la universidad técnica en la zona central, un área caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas, y que alberga a universidades, oficinas públicas y empresas privadas que conviven lado a lado, de clima frío y seco, con una temperatura ambiente entre 14-24 grados centígrados que varía durante el día
Daimonth es de tez morena, cabello negro/gris corto, ojos obscuros, usa lentes de aumento, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará el cual ya no habla porque sus estudios lo realiza en español y estudia inglés como segunda lengua. Su vida la realiza junto a sus padres que trabajan, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con los servicios de electricidad, gas domiciliario, agua potable y alcantarillado. El estudio la carrera de derecho la cual ya finalizó, no se graduó y necesita rendir el examen de grado para titularse. Trabaja como administrador de una empresa que importa material de construcción. Posee conocimientos teóricos en derecho, es una persona diestra en el manejo de la lógica para vencer y convencer, su experiencia valiosa se basa en el oportuno contacto con la realidad mediante la práctica jurídica, actúa de buena fe y cree en la buena fe de los demás. “terminé mi carrera profesional hace varios años, pero no me titulé por falta de dinero…” comenta. Su sueño es ser profesional y desea realizar el pago de su examen de grado para titularse. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica al estudio profesional. 
Es por esos motivos que Daimonth solicita un préstamo para pagar su examen de grado y titularse para poder trabajar en su rubro.
texts.en:
Daimonth is a single 37 year old man with no children. He's studying law. He is intelligent, responsible, dedicated to his studies, constant, responsible and hardworking. 

He studies in a technical university in the central zone, an area known for commerce from all regions, which houses universities, public offices and private businesses side by side, with a cold and dry climate with an ambient temperature between 14 and 24 degrees Celsius which varies during the day.

Daimonth has a dark complexion and short black/grey hair, dark eyes, glasses, short stature and a skinny physical complexion. His native language is Aymara, which he doesn't speak because his studies are in Spanish and he studies English as a second language. He lives with his parents, who work, and they live in their own brick and cement house with a tin roof that has electricity, gas, potable water and sewer.

He already finished the law degree, but didn't graduate and needs to take the degree exam to be certified. He works as an administrator in a business that imports construction materials. He understands legal theory and is a person skilled in using logic to win and convince. 

His experience is based on the timely contact through the practice of law, acting in good faith and believing in the good faith of others. "I finished my professional career several years ago, but didn't get certified because of lack of money," he says. 

His dream is to be a professional and wants to pay for his degree exam to be certified. This is the first sequence of loans in the institution in the 5 years that he's done professional study. Because of these goals, Daimonth seeks a loan to pay for his degree exam and get certified so he can work in his field.

loans.use: to pay for his final exam and graduation to be able to work in his field.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Editha is 40 years old and has two children who are in school.

Editha has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Editha requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy containers of coconut wine to sell.

Editha has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 52 years old and married with eight children. With two children in school, Elsa works very hard to provide for them.

Elsa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, candles, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc.

Elsa has been in this business for 20 years now. 

In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, candles, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emelia is 42 years old and has one child in school.

Emelia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Emelia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Emelia has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 45 years old and married. Emelia works very hard to provide.

Emelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, groceries, etc.

Emelia has been in this business for one year now. 

In the future, Emelia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Evelyn is 47 years old and has two children who are in school.

Evelyn has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed.

Evelyn has been in this business for four years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed

loans.name: Las Reynas Group

texts.es:
Las Reynas es un grupo ubicado cerca de las vías del tren mejor conocido como "La Bestia" que recorre todo el país de sur a norte y hace su aparición 4 veces al día. "La Bestia" es el medio de transporte de pasajeros que van en busca del sueño americano desde centroamérica. 

El nombre de este grupo de préstamo tiene su origen en la vida y pensamiento de las integrantes quienes comentan “Las Reynas de la casa somos nosotras”, ellas son:

Belem, María –comida
Ofelia –abarrotes y carne de cerdo
Soledad –bisutería 
Hortencia –abarrotes 
Gabriela -tacos
María Tita –ropa 
Bartola –venta de elotes, esquites y chicharrones.

Desde hace 10 años muchos han podido disfrutar de un rico elote, esquite o chicharrón de los que vende doña Bartola quien instala su mesa, su vaporera y anafres, e ingredientes como crema, queso, verduras, salsa, elotes y esquites. Ella es mejor conocida por sus clientes como Barto.

Los hijos de Barto le ayudan a transportar el material e ingredientes desde su casa hasta el parque y en ocasiones la acompañan durante las ventas para que no esté sola, ellos son la motivación principal para seguir con su actividad. Barto siempre les menciona a sus pequeños que la mejor herencia que les puede dejar son sus estudios y que deben aprovechar esa oportunidad al máximo.

Doña Bartola está muy orgullosa con su puesto de antojitos mexicanos y para impulsarlo se ha unido al grupo Las Reynas ya que quiere invertir y comprar más ingredientes como elotes, mayonesa, queso, pasta de chicharrones, vasos, servilletas y picante en mayor cantidad ya que la fiesta del pueblo está próxima y quiere prepararse ya que es una buena oportunidad para vender más. En un futuro a Barto le gustaría vender los mismos antojitos desde su casa. 

*La fotografía fue tomada frente a la casa de Doña Ofelia la cual está ubicada detrás de las vías por donde transita "La Bestia". Bartola es quien viste suéter, pantalón color gris y tenis color gris con agujetas en azul.
texts.en:
"Las Reynas" (Queens) is a group located near the major train routes known as "The Beast" that cover the entire country from south to north and show up four times a day. "The Beast" is the transportation method for passengers who travel to South American from Central America.

The name of this loan group originates in the life and thoughts of the members, who say, "We are the queens of the house." They are Belem and Maria (fodo), Ofelia (groceries and pork), Soledad (costume jewelry), Hortencia (groceries), Gbriela (tacos), Maria Tita (clothing) and Bartola (sale of corn, esquites - a Mexican dish involving toasted corn with vegetables and other incredients - and pork rinds).

For 10 years, many people have been able to enjoy a delicious corn, esquite or pork rind that Bartola sells where she installs her table, steamer and clay pot and ingredients like cream, cheese, vegetables, salsa, corn and esquites. She is better-known by her customers as Barto.

Barto's children help her transport the material and ingredients from her house to the park, and occasionally acocmpany her on sales so she's not alone. They are her main motivation for continuing her work. Barto is always telling her little ones that the best inheritance she can give them is their education, and that they should take maximum advantage of this.

Bartola is very proud of her offering of Mexican dishes and for getting together the Las Reynas group. Now she wants to invest and buy more ingredients like corn, mayonnaise, cheese, pasta, pork rinds, glasses, napkins and spices in a larger quantity, since the town festival is coming up and she wants to be prepared for a good opportunity to sell more. In the future, Barto would like to sell the same dishes from her home.

The photograph was taken in front of Ofelia's house, which is located across from the lines where "The Beast" runs. Bartola is the one wearing a sweater, grey pants and grey tennis shoes with blue laces.

loans.use: to buy corn, mayonnaise, cheese, pork rind pasta, cups, napkins and spice.

loans.name: Fulgencia

texts.es:
La Sra. Fulgencia se dedica a la granja, venta de huevos caseros, gallina, queso y leche, está casada, y tiene hijos, se dedica a esta actividad  hace más de 10 años.- 
Es una persona  muy trabajadora y emprendedora y con buena moral de pago, tiene varias operaciones canceladas con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder hacer quesos, también de gallinas para la cría. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Fulgenicia earns a living farming, selling homemade eggs, chickens, cheese and milk. She's married, has children, and has been doing this business for more than 10 years.

She is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial person with good morals for payment. She has various completed operations with Fundación Paraguaya. 

She's seeking this loan to be able to invest in inputs to make cheese and chickens to raise. She's thankful for the opportunity she's receiving to be able to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy inputs for cheese making and raising chickens.

loans.name: Jeana

texts.en:
Jeana is 51 years old and widowed with four children. With three children in school, Jeana works very hard to provide for them.

Jeana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, canned goods, eggs, beverages, and other groceries, etc. Jeana has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Jeana would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, canned goods, eggs, beverages and groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 28 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jocelyn has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other equipment.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other equipment for her bicycle transport business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 37 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Gina is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Gina has been in this business for 4 years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman and has one child who attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Judith is 49 years old.

Judith has a business buying and selling scrap in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy scrap to sell.

Judith has been in this business for two years. In the future, Judith would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy scrap to sell

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado kuña Rory está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Flora, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, es decir que ha ido creciendo y mejorando a través de las capacitaciones que ha recibido.
La Sra. Flora tiene una humilde peluquería que con esfuerzo pudo montar, comenta que tiene una Buena clientela que siempre va hasta su negocio para hacerse algún tratamiento en el pelo, donde después todas quedan muy conformes.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues, peines y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su buen servicio para sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The group named “Kuña Rory” has taken the poverty elimination survey. One of the group members is Sra. Flora, whose latest survey indicated that she is at a Stage 3 poverty level. This means that she is growing and improving as a result of the training she has received.

Sra. Flora has a modest beauty salon that she established with effort. She says that she has a good clientele who always arrive at her business when they need a hair treatment. All of them have remained very satisfied.

Flora is requesting a loan in order to buy dyes, crèmes, shampoo, rinses, combs, and other supplies so that she can continue providing good service to her clients. She appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can improve each day.

loans.use: to buy dyes, crèmes, shampoo, rinses, combs, and other supplies.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es de la ciudad de Pilar, se dedica a la venta de huevos caseros y quesos, está casada y comenta que se dedica a esta actividad  hace más de 10 años, y con lo cual ayuda a su familia.
Es una persona  muy trabajadora y emprendedora que está luchando para poder  ganarse la vida de una manera digna y sin privaciones.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de gallinas ponedoras para poder seguir con la venta de huevos. Está contenta por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes is from the city of Pilar. She makes a living selling fresh eggs and cheeses. She is married and comments that she has made a living from this work for more than 10 years, and with that she helps her family. She is a very hardworking and enterprising person who is fighting to be able to make a living in a dignified way without deprivations. 

She is asking for this loan to buy laying hens to be able to continue selling eggs. She is happy to have the opportunity she has to be able to improve her and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy laying hens for egg production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a gate to install at the main entrance of her home, guaranteeing safety above all

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
Kuña Rory es un grupo integrado  por  17 mujeres, está en  el 4to. ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan, se encuentran dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lida, quien tiene una despensa bien surtida con todo tipo de productos que ella ofrece a sus clientes del barrio y de otras zonas. Comenta que al principio le fue un poco difícil poder empezar, pero que poco a poco se fue abriendo camino.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder surtir su despensa, como frutas, verduras, carne, bebidas, enlatados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
Kuña Rory is a group comprised of 17 women. It is in the fourth cycle of the program of the women's communal bank, where everyone works and helps each other. Within the program, they find the elimination of poverty to be able to improve their and their families' living conditions.

One of the members is Lida, who has a well-stocked store with all types of products which she offers to her customers from the neighborhood and from other areas. She says that at the beginning it was a little difficult to be able to start, but little by little she made headway. 

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in buying consumables to be able to stock her store, like fruits, vegetables, meat, drinks, canned goods, and other items. That way, she can continue with her sales as has been the case. She appreciates this opportunity she has to be able to continue growing and getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, meat, drinks, canned goods, and other items

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
El socio Justo  pertenece al banco comunal “UNION FUERZA Y AMISTAD” de la Asociación Arariwa.
