El socio continua con su negocio de  compra y venta de granos secos como trigo, habas y entre otros, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de trigo, cebada entre otros.
 El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Justo is a member of the Communal Bank “Union Fuerza Y Amistad” (Unity, Strength, & Friendship), which is affiliated with Asociación Arariwa. He continues to manage his business of selling dry goods such as wheat, beans, and other products. Justo has been in business for quite some time and is doing well thanks to the effort he puts forth each day into his business. He wants to keep working so that he can continue to support his family.

Justo is requesting a loan in order to buy wheat, barley, and other products. He is grateful for this loan and promises to complete his payment according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy wheat, barley, and other products.

loans.name: Elmie

texts.en: Elmie is a businesswoman from Ozamiz. She is married and has a farm where she has a good harvest of fruit. Her farm has helped support her family. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has had several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now she has applied for a loan to purchase fruit-bearing seedlings. Elmie continues to expand her farming activities by planting more to have more produce. It is proof that she has the determination and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fruit-bearing seedlings

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina has mastered her swine production in Mahayag, Philippines. This is how she makes a living in support of her husband for their family. She was at her dull moment when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to request a loan to fully support her business. She takes care of her swine production business and her membership with PMPC in the same way.  She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always request help with any financing needs. 

Now, the loan of PHP 20,000 will be used to purchase animal vitamins and bags of feed for gestating swine for her swine to produce healthier and bigger piglets. This will help her gain more income. In the future, Divina hopes to build concrete pig pens that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to purchase animal vitamins and bags of feed for gestating swine for her swine to produce healthier and bigger piglets

loans.name: Maria Haydee

texts.es:
Maria tiene 54 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de esta zona se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros, cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio el cual está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para incrementar el stock de su negocio, dicha inversión le servirá para incrementar sus ventas, con gran influencia en el negocio, con esto Maria espera tener mayor stock de productos para poder atender las diversas necesidades, requerimientos y gustos de los clientes de la zona lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old, unmarried, and lives with her family in the Oyotún district in a rural area which is located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Perú. The inhabitants of this area make a living with agriculture, retail, and livestock farming. 

She makes a living selling groceries like rice, sugar, oil, noodles, among other things. She has more than 10 years of experience in the business, which is located in her own home. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to increase the inventory of her business. Said investment will serve to increase her sales, with a large influence on the business. With this, Maria hopes to have a larger inventory of products to be able to attend to the diverse necessities, requirements, and preferences of the customers in the area. That will allow her to increase her level of income and therefore will improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to increase the inventory of her business

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 38 years old, married, and has one child. With one of the three children in school, Leonora works very hard to provide for them.

Leonora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, snack foods, etc.

Leonora has been in this business for 5 years now. 

In the future, Leonora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 51-years-old, married, and has five children, three of which are in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lolita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a 8,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lolita has been in this business for 4 years. 

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 47 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Lolita works very hard to provide for them.

Lolita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Lolita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 40 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. Anna works very hard to provide for them.

Anna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, shampoo, noodles, breads, coffee, milk, sugar, etc.

Anna has been in this business for eight years. 

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, shampoo, noodles, breads, coffee, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 45 years old and married with six children. Four of her children are in school.

Mercedes works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell.

Mercedes has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from restaurant and vulcanizing businesses.

Mercedes aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Merry Ann

texts.en: Merry Ann is aged 25, married, and they are blessed with four children. She has sold home appliances in their village for almost 10 years and earns a net income of PHP 10,000 a month. Due to insufficient funds she would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase a television, electric fan, refrigerator, and washing machine to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable so that she can earn more income in her business.

loans.use: To purchase a television, electric fan, refrigerator, and washing machine to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria thought of a good fortune when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail herself of financial assistance for her chosen business. Victoria has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she availed herself of an amount to purchase additional hogs for commercial sale and bags of feed for her piglets. Victoria wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family. Someday, she hopes to build concrete pig pens in her farmland to focus on a piggery business.

loans.use: to purchase additional hogs for commercial sale and bags of feed for her piglets.

loans.name: Genelita

texts.en: In 2012, Genelita learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Genelita tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Genelita borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help her farming income get a big boost. Genelita looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay labor for cultivation of her rice land.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en: Ernesto is 59 years old and lives in Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. He is married with three children now at their adult age. Ernesto earns a living from his funeral service and has been in the business for seven years already. He earns approximately PHP 20,000 each month from doing this type of work. At present he is also engaged in a business buying and selling vehicles. He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing an automobile to be reconditioned and resold. Ernesto has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, he hopes to expand his funeral services not only in Misamis Occidental but also to the neighboring Provinces in Mindanao.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing an automobile.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Shirley had the skills and expertise to be a potter, yet she had no capital to start a pottery business. As a mother from Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, she never gets tired of supporting her family in any way she can and helping her husband earn an income. She joined PMPC after she learned she could gain financial assistance and she decided to start a pottery business. It has been doing well as she has worked to perfect the shape and quality of her pots. Shirley has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. She has requested another loan from PMPC to purchase additional raw materials and needed equipment for her business to increase production and to purchase stock in bulk. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and continue to benefit her family. Today, other retail businesses sell her pots, which in turn helps them earn an income for their own families.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials and needed equipment for her business to increase production and to purchase stock in bulk

loans.name: Dario Alexander

texts.es:
El cantón se llama así en honor de la Virgen del Carmen. Posee una considerable riqueza en flora y fauna, siendo una de las fuentes principales de ingreso el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete.
En este lugar vive el señor  Dario,   tiene 19  años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres.
Don Dario con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en conducción de motos realiza fletes, el hace entregas a domicilio de la comida que realizan en el comedor de la mamá y también vende la comida a sus conocidos, esto lo viene realizando hace algún tiempo. Trabaja todos los días desde las 11h00 hasta las 14h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar.
Este nuevo crédito será para comprar víveres para el comedor  de su mamá. Es un socio antiguo, tiene algún tiempo desde que inicio el grupo comunal, el grupo es muy unido y le gusta los créditos emergentes y los  intereses bajos.
texts.en:
The canton named in honor of Virgen del Carmen has a considerable abundance of flora and fauna. One of the main sources of income in this area is the cultivation of bananas of the Barraganete variety.

Sr. Dario lives in this place. He is 19 years old, single, and lives at his parents’ house. In order to earn his own income and take advantage of his training as a motorcycle fleet driver, Dario makes home deliveries of food that has been prepared at his mother’s diner. He also sells food to acquaintances and has been doing this for some time. Dario works every day from 11:00 A.M. to 2:00 P.M. and sometime much later when there are orders to deliver.

This new loan will be used to buy provisions for his mother’s diner. He is a long-time member, having been with his Communal Bank from the beginning. His group is very close-knit and he enjoys the increasing loans and the low interest rates.

loans.use: to buy provisions for his mother’s diner.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 58 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Lilia has a boarding house rental business in the Philippines.  Lilia has been in this business for four years.

Lilia requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional hardwood for her boarding house.

 In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional hardwood for her boarding house

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Marivic works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from frozen foods.  Marivic is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of clothing to sell to customers.

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jelene

texts.en:
Jelene is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jelene is 33 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Jelene has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jelene requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo and maintenance for her boat.

Jelene has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo and maintenance for her boat

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 32-year-old married woman and has five children, two of which are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marites has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Marites has been in this business for 9 years.

Marites requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other equipment.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other equipment

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 46 years old, married, and has eight children. With four of her eight children in school, Marivic works very hard to provide for them.

Marivic runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Marivic has been in this business for 4 years now. 

In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 47 years old and married with three children who are all in school.

Jessie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like canned goods, soft drinks, spices and other groceries to sell.

Jessie has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Jessie aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, soft drinks, spices and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maylen

texts.en:
Maylen is 26 years old and married with one child.

Maylen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Maylen has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from raising ducks and rice retailing.

Maylen aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lourdes is 45 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Lourdes has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business.

Lourdes has been in this business for 15 years and earns additional income from raising pigs. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is 52 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

May has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. May requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of frozen foods to sell.

May has been in this business for 19 years. In the future, May would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Senith Judith

texts.es:
Senith es una mujer de buen corazón, muy entregada a su hogar, en el habita sus dos hijos y su pareja, también en su hogar tiene su actividad económica la cual es ofertar servicios de sala de internet, que para una zona muy afectada por la desigualdad es una bendición pues mucho de los hogares no cuentan con este servicio debido al costo mensual de este que no pueden asumir.
Senith en el momento quiere dar un mejor servicio y es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para realizar algunas adecuaciones como lo son, pintar paredes, realizar mantenimiento a sus máquinas y revocar el suelo ya que genera mucho polvo que están dañando los equipos.
texts.en:
Senith is a good-hearted woman who is devoted to her family. She lives with her partner and their two children. In addition, Senith manages an Internet café out of her home as her business. Living in an area heavily impacted by inequality has been a blessing because many households do not have this service because of the unaffordable monthly costs.

At the moment, Senith wants to provide better service. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can make a few renovations such as painting the walls, maintaining her machines, and replacing the floor since there is a large amount of dirt that is damaging the equipment.

loans.use: to paint the walls, maintain her equipment, and replace the floor of her Internet café.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Amy works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen foods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing.  Amy  is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of frozen foods to sell.

Amy  has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money in order to support financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve the bathroom in his house, which currently does not meet the required sanitary conditions

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 66 years old and lives in Mapang, Rizal, Philippines. She is married with four children. She sells different kinds of fruits to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Some of her fruit stock is from her farm produce. To take advantage and have more inventory, she has requested a loan to purchase more fruits to sell. Lilia has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, she hopes to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fruits.

loans.name: Emilita

texts.en:
Emilita is 46 years old, married and a resident of Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines. Her husband is a tricycle driver. Starting with capitalization of 3,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoy the benefits given by the co-op. She became a member in April, 2005 and has taken out three loans.

Now she is applying for 25,000 PHP to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday, and will be fully satisfied if they were bless of children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries.

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en: Melvin is 28 years old and single from Molave. For the past ten years, he has been a farmer focusing on rice farming. He earns 10,000 PHP each crop and is a new member of PMPC. Melvin is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan for the purchase of fertilizer for his rice farm to potentially have a higher and heavier crop yield. In the future, he hopes to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his rice farm to potentially have a higher and heavier crop yield.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
This is Arlene, 51, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Raul, a company driver and has five children, of whom two are already married, two are still in college, one is a high school student and the youngest is still at the elementary level. She manages their own household while doing buy and sell. She works to augment their income to support their daily needs and to send her four children to school.

Arlene has been into the buy and sell business for five years already. She buys dozens of various designs and colors of flips and sell them with a little profit. Flip flops have become popular and widely used also in the Philippines for their comfort and durability. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations and increase her sales, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan which she will use to buy additional products such as shoes, clothes, flip flops, and sandals to sell and to meet the advanced orders of her customers. This will definitely boost her earnings as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be extended to her, for it will surely help fund their everyday needs and support the education of her children. 

Arlene dreams of opening a store to display her merchandise and attract more customers. She aims to send all her children to college to allow them better opportunities in life. She prays to continue to live a godly life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for dozens of shoes, slippers, flip flops and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a 58-year-old resident of Mitimos, Rizal, Philippines. She has two children. She owns an office supply store that forms part of their house, and her neighbors are their clients.

Since she has a college student to support, she has decided to improve their small business to support their children, so she has requested a loan from Paglaum MPC in the amount of 12,000 PHP. Aside from the financial assistance, she also received add-on benefits like insurance, savings, etc. She hopes that with Paglaum's help, she will become a successful businesswoman someday.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of office supplies

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Her name is Cerila, 56, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Vicente, a driver whose offspring are all married. She manages her household while operating a business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs.

Cerila operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food.  She earns income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of 600 PHP a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a 11,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, condiments, rice, soda and other grocery products. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given and for the good return on her investment, for it will surely help in their daily sustenance.

Cerila hopes to maintain and grow her business so she and her husband could have a more comfortable life and save for their old age. She prays for good health and long life and strives to be faithful to God. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell

loans.name: Las Florecitas Group

texts.es:
Entregarse en cuerpo y alma a trabajar en su negocio es lo que hacen los habitantes de la comunidad donde se ha consolidado el grupo “Las Florecitas”. Este lugar cuenta con la presencia de World Vision, empresa socia de VisionFund México por lo que la mayoría de los niños forman parte de un programa de patrocinio. Además, como parte de un proyecto de colaboración entre ambas instituciones, varias familias recibieron capacitación y material para tener estufas ahorradoras de leña y huertos familiares para mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Las integrantes del grupo son:
Francisca –Medicina Naturista
Jessica –Bisutería 
Gumara -Estética
María, María De La Luz –Antojitos 
Leticia -Refrescos
Madai -Verduras
Agustina –Carne De Pollo Y Cerdo 
Dominga -Abarrotes
Susana –Agua Purificada
Jacinta –Cosméticos 
Amada -Comida
Eva -Postres
Edith –Cosméticos Y Tamales 
Felicitas –Papelería Y Ropa 

La señora Edith es una mujer muy trabajadora, en ocasiones ayuda a su esposo en la siembra y cosecha del maís. Ella es madre de tres hijos, dos de ellos patrocinados por World Vision y la familia fue una de las beneficiadas con una estufa ahorradora de leña. 

Hace 4 años, ella comenzó a elaborar y vender tamales rancheros que vende en la misma comunidad. Sus ventas son más altas en eventos y celebraciones especiales como cuando los profesores le hacen pedidos. Edith invirtió las ganancias de los tamales para comenzar a vender cosméticos hace poco y se ha unido al grupo de préstamo con el propósito de hacer funcionar los dos negocios a la par. Por lo anterior, invertirá un préstamo equitativamente para comprar perfumes, cremas, maquillaje, carne, manteca y chiles pues la hoja y el maíz, necesarios también para hacer los tamales, los siembra ella misma en casa.

Doña Edith está muy contenta con sus actividades, el aportar dinero para el gasto de la casa y el bienestar de su familia la hace sentir productiva y satisfecha.

*En la imagen: las integrantes de Las Florecitas, doña Edith viste suéter color café a cuadros con puntos blancos.
texts.en:
The inhabitants of the community where the "Las Florecitas" group was formed engage themselves, body and soul, in working in their businesses. World Vision is present in this place, a social enterprise of VisionFund México within which most of the children form part of a sponsorship program. In addition, as a collaboration project between both institutions, various families receive training and materials to have wood-saving stoves and home gardens to improve their quality of life.

The members of the group are:
Francisca - Herbal Medicine 
Jessica - Costume Jewelry  
Gumara - Aesthetics 
María, María De La Luz - Snacks
Leticia - Drinks
Madai - Vegetables
Agustina - Chicken and Pork Meat
Dominga - Groceries
Susana - Purified Water
Jacinta - Cosmetics
Amada - Food
Eva - Desserts
Edith - Cosmetics and Tamales 
Felicitas - Stationary and Clothes

Edith is a very hardworking woman. On occasion she helps her husband to plant and harvest corn. She is the mother of three children. Two of them have World Vision scholarships, and the family was one of the beneficiaries of a wood-saving stove.

Four years ago, she started to make and sell tamales rancheros which she sells in the same community. Her sales are higher during events and special celebrations like when the teachers make requests. Edith invested the proceeds of the tamales to start to sell cosmetics a little while ago, and she joined the lending group with the intention of making the two businesses work alongside each other. For the above, she will invest a loan equitably to buy perfumes, creams, makeup, meat, butter, and chiles as well as corn leaves, also necessary to make tamales, which she plants herself at home.

Edith is very happy with her work; providing money for household expenses and the wellbeing of her family makes her feel productive and satisfied. 

*In the photograph: the members of Las Florecitas. Edith is wearing the brown, checkered sweater with white dots.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, makeup, meat, butter, and chiles

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en: Lyn has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and earning as well for her family. As a member of PMPC, she has sought financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell. In the future, Lyn wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is a  45-year-old married woman.  She has three children, one of which is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Analie has a dried fish business in the Philippines.  Analie has been in this business for 3 years. 

Analie requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish and salt to make more dried fish.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and salt for her dried fish business

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marivic is 38 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Marivic has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo and maintenance for her boat.

Marivic has been in this business for 15 years and earns additional income from buy and sell dried fish. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo and maintenance for her boat

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is a 46-year-old married woman and has three children who are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cecelia has a farming vegetable business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

Cecelia requested a 7,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 58 years old widow and has eight children, two of which are currently in school.

Clarita is in the agricultural business in the Philippines.  Clarita has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Clarita requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 58 years old and has six children.  She is married and has one child in school.

Edna is in the agricultural business -- raising pigs --  in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Edna has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and she has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain her efforts,

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 32-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two sons and one daughter, and her husband has been doing a scrap recycling business. Shazia's husband needs to buy scrap material in bulk to recycle it, but due to some financial constraints he is not in a suitable position to buy the scrap in bulk. Therefore, Shazia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to purchase the scrap material in bulk so that he can easily adopt the recycling procedure and earn a profitable income derived from his business. Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his scrap business

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 41-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her four children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years and is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Zahida is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the accessories listed above and will also help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services. Zahida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been providing transportation services by driving a Taxi for fifteen years.  Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Her husband needs to do maintenance to his Taxi because the current condition of his Taxi is not good and it requires maintenance on a daily basis which ends up costing more.   Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to do maintenance of his taxi. Therefore, Ghazala has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Ghazala's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. He will be able to provide better transportation services and earn a  profitable income. Ghazala also plans to make savings with a portion of the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Ghazala is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for her husband taxi repair

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is a 38-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and three children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 25 years. Her husband is only responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Zareena's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories, e.g., pieces of clothes, laces, needles and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable condition to buy the items listed above for his business purposes. Therefore Zareena has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will financially assist her husband to buy these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn a more profitable income. Zareena is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his tailoring business

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en: Nargis is a 48-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 10 children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past 30 years. He is only responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. Nargis's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, e.g., rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purposes. But due to financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all of the above products for reselling purposes. Therefore Nargis has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all of these commodities and will also help him to earn the maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. Nargis is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to increase his general store  business

loans.name: Jatypeka Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se destaca por el esfuerzo que vienen haciendo, para que todas y cada una vayan mejorando sus vidas por medio del esfuerzo en conjunto.
La Sra. Faustina es la presidenta del grupo, ella es Comerciante,  ella vive con su  hijo  el cual colabora en la casa con ella y busca el bienestar de la familia. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y por sobre todo emprendedora, ya que lucha por el bienestar de sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Faustina pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para la venta, como ser verduras, frutas, carne, panificados y otros para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad de crecimiento que ellas reciben.
texts.en:
This group is known for the efforts that have been made. All of the members have been improving their lives through their efforts as a group.

Sra. Faustina is the group president. She is a merchant and lives with her son, who helps her at home and with looking out for the welfare of their family. Faustina is a hardworking woman, but most of all she is enterprising and looks out for the well-being of her loved ones.

Sra. Faustina is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of various products to sell such as vegetables, fruit, meat, baked goods, and other items. As a result, she can continue her sales just as before. She appreciates the opportunity that her group has received so that they can grow.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, meat, baked goods, and other items.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin has been considerably preparing for the post harvest operations of his palay in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. He wants to ensure that he will have ample time for the threshing, drying, storage and processing of his harvest to make way for another cropping season. He presented his proposal to Paglaum MPC and received a loan. Benjamin hopes to continuously provide for his family and be able to save more money for future business opportunities.

loans.use: to pay for post harvest operations

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase onions

loans.name: Marry Ann

texts.en:
Marry Ann is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marry Ann is 32 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Marry Ann has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marry Ann requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her fishing business like bamboo, fish net and maintenance for her boat.

Marry Ann has been in this business for eight years and also earn additional income from raising pigs. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business like bamboo, fish net and maintenance for her boat

loans.name: Felma

texts.en:
Felma is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  Felma is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell to customers.

Felma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 51 years old and married with one child.

Cecilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like shampoo, sardines, noodles, soft drinks and other items to sell.

Cecilia has borrowed and paid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening and rice retailing businesses.

Cecilia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like shampoo, sardines, noodles, soft drinks and other items to sell.

loans.name: Lenlyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Lenlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell livestock business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Lenlyn is borrowing PHP 12,500 through NWTF to buy more livestock and sell it.

Lenlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock and sell it

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Michelle is 35 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Michelle has a fishing business in the Philippines. Michelle requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo and maintenance for her boat.

Michelle has been in this business for 13 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo and maintenance for her boat

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen works hard to support her family. Aileen is single and has a farming vegetable business in the Philippines.

Aileen requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Aileen has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Aileen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 49 years old, married, and has four children one of which is in school.  Estelita works very hard to provide for her children.

Estelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, soft drinks, etc.

Estelita has been in this business for 3 years.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to to sell like shampoo, canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva is 51 years old and married with 8 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Minerva has a fishing business in the Philippines. Minerva requested a PHP 14,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Minerva has been in this business for six years. In the future, Minerva would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 53 years old, married, and has three children who are still in school.  

Gloria is in the agricultural business in the Philippines.  Gloria has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Gloria requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 31 years old, single, and has two children, one of which is in school. 

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Jocelyn has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Jocelyn requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 38-years-old woman and the mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is butcher by profession, and sells beef, chicken, mattan, etc. Her husband is the sole provider responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Azra's husband needs to purchase meats for reselling purpose so that he can increase the size of the business, improve his sales, and earn more profits, but due to unfavorable financial conditions her husband is not able to purchase meats for his business.  Therefore, Azra has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for the business.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase meats for her husband's butcher shop

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Luzminda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell livestock business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  

Luzminda is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more livestock and sell to customers.

Luzminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more livestock

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 5 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. 

For the past several days her husband's rickshaw has not worked properly, and he is unable to generate any amount of income. Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Nazia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hairdressing material, extensions, and weaves, for her salon.

loans.name: Ilusión Group

texts.es:
En la comunidad donde se conformó el grupo Ilusión la mayoría de las personas se dedican a trabajar el campo, específicamente en la siembra de caña; de la misma forma, muchas personas se autoemplean en sus propios negocios para ofrecer mejores oportunidades a sus seres queridos.

La ilusión de tener éxito en sus actividades es lo que llevo a los integrantes a elegir el nombre que los identifica, ellos son:

Elvira - Venta de Postres
Carolina - Venta de Pollo
Sara - Venta de Productos para el Hogar
Luz, Silvia – Servicio De Molino 
Nicolasa  - Venta de Plásticos
Aaron, Mayra - Venta de Abarrotes
Carmela – Venta de Cosméticos 

En un pequeño corral construido con madera es donde Carolina mantiene a sus pollos. Ella se dedica a vender carne de pollo fresca y ha visto más beneficios al criar a los animales ella misma. Todos los días se levanta a las 4 am a preparar y tener todo listo para recibir a sus clientes. A las personas de más confianza les permite comprar a crédito, pero los vecinos le han comprado carne a Carolina desde hace ya 4 años. Ella decidió iniciar su actividad para apoyar a su esposo y beneficiar a sus hijos principalmente. 

Con el préstamo que ha solicitado comprará 24 pollos y alimento para mantenerlos en las mejores condiciones. Su meta a corto plazo es mejorar el pequeño corral para que los depredadores de la región como tlacuaches y coyotes no lastimen a los pollos.
 
*En la imagen: la señora Carolina es quien está cargando a su pequeña hija de 1 año, las integrantes del grupo son buena amigas o comparten algún lazo familiar.
texts.en:
In the community where the communal bank "Ilusión" (Hope) was formed, the majority of people make a living working in the field, specifically cultivating sugarcane. In the same way, many people are self-employed by their own businesses in order to offer their loved ones better opportunities. The hope of having successful businesses is what drove the members of this group to choose the name that identifies them. The members of the group are:

Elvira – dessert sales
Carolina – chicken sales
Sara – household products sales
Luz and Silvia – mill services
Nicolasa  – plastic products sales
Aaron and Mayra – grocery sales
Carmela – cosmetics sales

Carolina keeps her chickens in a small pen, which is made of wood. She makes a living selling fresh chicken meat, and she has had more success raising the animals herself. Every day, she wakes up at 4 am to prepare and to have everything ready so that she can attend to her customers. She allows those she trusts to buy on credit. Neighbors have been buying meat from Carolina for the past 4 years. She decided to start this business in order to support her husband and especially for the benefit of her children.

With the loan that she has requested, she will buy 24 chickens as well as food for them in order to keep them in the best condition. Her short-term goal is to improve her small pen so that predators in the region, such as opossums and coyotes, do not hurt her chickens. 

In the photograph, Carolina is the woman who is holding her small 1-year-old daughter. The members of the group are good friends or share a family tie.

loans.use: to buy 24 chickens as well as food for them.

location.town: Localidad Selva Segunda, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fruit

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan tiene 51 años, está acompañado y comenta que tiene 4 hijos, por quienes él está luchando para poder darles una vida digna y sin privaciones, el mismo se dedica a la plantación de Verduras y verdeos.
Hace varios años que se dedica a esta actividad y realiza sus ventas en el mercado. Posee clientela bien formada y obtiene buen ingreso mensual. 
Pide este préstamo para la compra de semillas, abonos y otros, y mejorar la calidad de vida de él y de su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan is 51 years old and in a relationship. He says that he has four children and strives to provide them a decent life without deprivation.

Juan plants vegetables and scallions. He has been in this business for several years and conducts his sales at the market. Juan has a well-established clientele and is able to generate a good monthly income.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, compost, and other supplies. As a result, he can improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, and other supplies.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is thankful that she was previously granted a 13,000 PHP loan which she used to maintain her jeep and purchase more varieties of fruit and vegetables to sell. Her earnings helped send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. Aside from her jeepney and vegetable business she now sells banana-cue for additional income.

She would like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan. She will use it to buy more quantities of different kinds of vegetables and dozens of kilos of bananas to make banana-cue to sell. She thanks God and you, in advance, for a good return on her investment, hard work and the financial help that will be given her. It will surely help fund her family's daily sustenance and the school needs of her children.

Zosima dreams of having a place of her own to sell her vegetables and banana-cue. She aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for bananas to sell as banana-cue and vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina tiene 34 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a sus dos menores hijos en el distrito de La Matanza, es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio, cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz y se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abono orgánico que ofrece a los agricultores de la zona, además de crianza de aves de corral como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, actividad que realiza hace más de 10 años, contando con experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales de ella. El crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de abono para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Karina espera obtener mayores ingresos que le van a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Karina is 34 years old, single, and lives with her two young children in her own home made of basic materials. They reside in the District of La Matanza, a place where the residents engage in agriculture, livestock breeding, and trade. This area receives basic services, such as running water and electricity. It is located in Morropón Province, which is in the region of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

Karina sells organic compost and offers this product to farmers in the area. In addition, she raises poultry such as hens, ducks, turkeys, and other fowl. She has been in business for more than 10 years and has the necessary experience. Karina has established customers who have provided good personal references on her behalf.

This loan will be used to buy a large quantity of compost in order to increase the inventory of her business. Karina will be able to generate more income so that she can improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of compost that she can sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 53 years old, married, and has nine children, three of which are still in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business  in the Philippines.  Jocelyn has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Jocelyn requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Julieta

Julieta is married and works hard to support her family. 

Julieta has a farming vegetable business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 5 years now.

Julieta requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 29 year old woman, who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her 2 children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Naseem also provides sewing services and earns an income to contribute, with her husband, in managing the household.

She needs different kinds of goods e.g needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories. It will also helpful to her in increasing her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Naseem is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy supplies to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Joeida

texts.en:
Joeida is 55 years old, married, and has three children.

Joeida is in the agricultural business in the Philippines.  Joeida has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Joeida requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertiliizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jesserie

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Jesserie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell root-crops business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  

Jesserie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. 

Jesserie is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more root-crops to sell to customers.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more root-crops to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 45 years old, married, and has eleven children, five of which are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Judith has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  Judith has been in this business for 10 years. 

Judith requested a 7,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a beauty salon business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  

Ramona has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. 

Ramona is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy new tools and beauty products for her beauty salon.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy new tools and beauty products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Kofi

texts.fr: Kofi est un homme marié âgé de 37 ans. Kofi vit à Gblinkomégan avec sa femme et leurs trois enfants. Pour assurer les charges de la famille, Kofi vend des téléviseurs d’occasions à des clients n’ont pas les moyens d’acquérir les téléviseurs neufs. Ce commerce lui permet de gagner le bénéfice qui pourrait l’aider à répondre aux besoins. Kofi achète une fois par mois les téléviseurs au Port et sollicite ce crédit pour lancer une nouvelle commande. Le profit tiré l’aidera à promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kofi is a 37-year-old married man. He lives in Gblinkomégan with his wife and their three children.

To support the family, Kofi retails second-hand TVs to clients who cannot afford new ones. This trade allows him to make the profit that could help him provide for the family. Kofi purchases TVs once a month, at the harbor. He is requesting this loan to put in a new order.

With the profit, he will be able to promote his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy five TVs.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 48 ans, Adjo est une femme qui vit à Kpogan avec ses trois enfants. Dans son domicile, Adjo vend du maïs en grande quantité à ses clients et trouve son revenu grâce à ce commerce. Pour répondre efficacement aux besoins, Adjo s’approvisionne trois fois par mois à Sokodé. Adjo demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de maïs et réaliser encore plus de revenus pour aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Married and 48 years old, Adjo is a woman living in Kpogan with her three children. From her home, Adjo sells large quantities of corn to her clients. She ensures her revenues through this trade.

To effectively meet demand, Adjo procures her supplies three times a month in Sokodé. She is requesting this loan to order bags of corn, and to generate even greater revenues. She will thus help her husband with the household’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy three bags of corn.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is a responsible mother of a daughter. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport services by driving a Taxi for twenty years. Her husband is responsible in fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Her husband needs to do maintenance to his Taxi, because the current condition of his Taxi is not good and it requires maintenance on a daily basis which is more expensive. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to do the maintenance of his taxi. Therefore, Sobia has applied for a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Sobia's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily, and provide better transportation services to earn a good income. Sobia  also plans to save a part of the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Sobia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's Taxi maintenance expenses

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mariée et agée de 43 ans, Afi est une femme qui vit à Bè avec ses trois enfants. Dans son domicile, Afi vend des détergents et des pates dentifrices à ses clients en parcourant les quartiers et trouve son revenu grâce à ce commerce. Pour répondre efficacement aux besoins, Afi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Afi demande ce crédit pour commander des cartons de détergents et de dentifrices afin de réaliser encore plus de revenus pour aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Married and 43 years old, Afi is a woman living in Bè with her three children. From her home, Ali sells detergents and toothpaste to her clients; she also sells door-to-door. She ensures her revenues through this trade.

To effectively meet demand, Afi procures her supplies monthly from the market. She is requesting this loan to order boxes of detergents and toothpaste, and to generate greater revenues. She will thus help her husband with the household’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy sixteen boxes of detergent and one of toothpaste.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran is 33 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. Her husband owns a printing shop, and he is the guardian of the family and responsible to fulfill the needs of all the family members. 

Kiran has been running her own beauty salon for past 15 years, and contributes her income to her husband to manage the household. 

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints she is not able to buy these items. Therefore, Kiran has applied for a Kiva loan. 

This loan will help her buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers. 

It will also help her maximize her profits to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

Kiran is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy different types of cosmetics such as creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for building a security wall.

loans.name: Py Renda Group

texts.es:
El grupo se formó en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, son 18 mujeres muy sacrificadas y apasionadas, forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una quiere luchar por crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Carmen, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que se encuentra en una situación de pobreza extrema. Entre el trabajo que ella hace se dedica a la venta de Frutas, Verduras,  y otros también se debe destacar el trabajo de que hace la fundación paraguaya que hace  un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones para cada una de las integrantes de este grupo.
La Sra. Carmen solicita de este préstamo para la compra de Verduras, Frutas y otros, lo que le ayudará  a la misma a obtener más producción y más venta el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group was formed in the city of Coronel Oviedo with 18 self-sacrificing and passionate women. They are participating in the poverty elimination program because each member is determined to grow and move forward.

One of the members is Sra. Carmen. Her latest survey indicated that she is at a Stage 1 poverty level, which means that she is in an extreme poverty situation. Her work involves selling fruits and vegetables. Another thing that should be mentioned is the work Fundación Paraguaya does to provide constant training and monitoring for each member of the group.

Sra. Carmen is requesting a loan in order to buy vegetables, fruits, and other products. This will help her become more productive and create more sales, which will lead to an improvement in her income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Her name is Milagros, 46, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nilo, a construction worker and has four children of which only one is in school, one is married and the rest work in a farm. She manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to meet the family’s basic needs.

Milagros has a laundry brush business. She buys several pieces of fish net then she cuts and makes them into laundry net brushes. Most of the Filipino household don't own a washing machine. They manually wash their clothes and use a laundry net to thoroughly clean and brush stained clothes. Their laundry nets are replaced almost every week. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 11,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy additional fish net to make more laundry brushes for sale. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be extended to her for it will surely help cover their daily sustenance and send her Elementary child to school.

Milagros hopes to grow her business to have a better life and be able to send her Elementary child to College. She prays for a happy and victorious life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fish nets to make them into laundry brushes for sale

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 43 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and has been doing so for five years.  She also earns additional income from a general store. 

Erlinda is borrowing PHP 11500 through NWTF in order to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Leziel

texts.en:
Leziel is 30 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Leziel runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Leziel has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Renita

texts.en:
Renita is 74 years old, widowed and has one child.

Renita is in the agricultural business for 10 years now in the Philippines. 

Renita requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  She has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. Rosalinda is widowed and has a peanut butter making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 1 year now.

Rosalinda requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like peanut, oil, sugar, etc for her food production business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like peanuts, oil, sugar, etc for her food production business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 60 years old, widowed and has eight children.

Rosalinda is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Rosalinda requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 48 years old and resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  She is the mother of 4 children. 

Her husband has been running a general store for past ten years, and is the only person fulfilling the needs of the entire family.  Shehnaz's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business. But due to financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all above these products.  Therefore, Shehnaz has applied for Kiva loan from its' field partner BRAC Pakistan.  This loan will enable her husband to buy these commodities and also help him to earn the maximum possible profits to manage his household and business. 

Shehnaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: 's husband expand inventory for his general store

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 40 year old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 4 children. Her husband has been running his electric store for the past 12 years. He is responsible for feeding his entire family and fulfilling their needs.

Shazia's husband has to purchase electric merchandise e.g wires, tube lights, plug shoes, and other electrical devices. Due to insufficient financial means, he cannot afford to purchase these items for business purposes.

Therefore Shazia has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase this merchandises for his business needs. This loan will also help her husband to increase the size of his business and earn maximum profits.

Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her husband's electrical goods business and help him increase it.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is married woman and has three children, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is medication.

For the past six years, Saida has owned a food stall, selling to neighbours and town dwellers.  She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients hence perishable goods can lead to losses.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour and cooking fat.  She dreams of expanding her business to include a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize,wheat flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is thankful that she was granted a PHP 19,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy coconuts to sell. Her earnings help support her family and meet their daily basic needs. She would now like to apply for another PHP 19,000 loan, which she will use to buy more coconuts to sell. Summer can be really hot in the Philippines, and coconut juice is the most refreshing drink enjoyed by both local people and foreigners. She is happy, and encouraged by a good return on her investment, and is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely help fund their daily needs and send her children to school. Teresita dreams that all her hard work will bear fruit, to give her family a better future and send all her children to College. She prays that she and her family will grow in their relationship with God. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts for resale in her business.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Her earnings helped sustain her family's daily needs.

She would like to apply for another 5,0000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items such as rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and frozen foods, which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely help fund their personal and household needs.

Esmeralda dreams of having a bigger general store to improve their lives. She prays to always have a happy and healthy family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 50 years old, married and has three children, all of whom who are still in school.

Lucita has been in the agricultural business for 15 years in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy additional pigs as well as feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has borrowed 1 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Lucita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs as well as feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en: Ruby is 34 years old and single, with one child. She works very hard to provide for the family. Ruby runs a general store in the Philippines, and she applied for a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more grocery items to sell, including shampoo, canned goods, sugar, eggs and rice. Ruby has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell, including shampoo, canned goods, sugar, eggs and rice.

loans.name: Ma. Genalyn

texts.en:
Ma. Genalyn is 44 years old, married and has four children, one of whom is still in school.

Ma. Genalyn has been in the agricultural business for 10 years now in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy additional pigs as well as feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She has borrowed 1 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Ma. Genalyn would like to save money to expand her business.
