loans.use: to buy additional pigs as well as feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 57 years old and married with three children. Margarita works very hard to provide for them.

Margarita runs a general store in the Philippines and  has been in this business for 15 years.  She has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell like shampoo, canned goods, milks, sugar, coffee, soft drinks, etc.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell like shampoo, canned goods, milks, sugar, coffee, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en:
Melodia is a single woman, 58 years old and has five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Melodia has a fishing business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 3 years. She has requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her business like fish nets, bamboo and maintenance for her boat.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business like fish nets, bamboo and maintenance for her boat

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is 28 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are still in school.

Genalyn is in the agricultural business in the Philippines and has been for 5 years.  

She has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  She has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en: Sheryl is 32 years old and married, with three children, who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Sheryl runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more grocery items to sell, including shampoo, canned goods, sugar, milk, coffee, bread, eggs, and rice. Sheryl has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell, including shampoo, canned goods, sugar, milk, coffee, bread, eggs and rice.

loans.name: Grey  Valeska

texts.es:
El éxito está en proponerse metas y luchar por cumplirlas. Grey es una joven de 23 años de edad, madre de un niño de 5 años, y quien actualmente estudia el último año de la carrera de mercadotecnia; profesión la cual eligió por considerarse una persona dinámica, elocuente y emprendedora. 

Ella solicita el crédito debido a que quiere pagar los gastos de su curso de titulación y de esta manera seguir luchando para cumplir sus sueños de ser una profesional, puesto que, esto le permitirá tener mejores oportunidades de empleo y desarrollarse más. Las metas y planes de Grey son sus estudios para que su familia se sienta orgullosa,  tener cada día mejor calidad de vida y establecer su negocio propio.
texts.en:
Success means setting goals and having the determination to complete them. Grey is a young woman who is 23 years of age and the mother of a five-year-old son. She is in her final year of study toward a degree in Marketing. Grey chose this profession because she considers herself to be a dynamic, eloquent, and enterprising person.

She is requesting a loan so that she can pay the expenses of her degree course. As a result, she can continue toward fulfilling her dream of becoming a professional. This will allow her to have more career and development opportunities. Her goals and plans include making her family proud as a result of her studies, having a better quality of life, and establishing her own business.

loans.use: to pay the expenses of her degree course.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, 44 years old, is married and has six children, three of them in school. Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. For the past 6 years, she has been running a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from pig fattening.  

Jocelyn has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell. Jocelyn has previously borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college and to repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Luna

texts.en: Ma. Luna, 43 years old, is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. For the past 4 years, Ma. Luna has been raising pigs in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a general store. Ma. Luna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Shahool

texts.en:
Shahool, 47 years old, is married. The man shown in the photo is her son, who is a driver by profession, providing transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses. 

The rickshaw now requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. Shahool  has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her son. He wants to buy new tires and some spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport services to his passengers. Shahool is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some spare parts for her son's vehicle.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita, 44 years old, is married and has eight children, four of them in school. For the past 2 years, Merlita  has been raising pigs in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a general store.

Merlita is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy additional pigs and feed. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feed

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is 52 year old woman, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her 4 children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Farzana is provides sewing services and earns an income to contribute with her husband to managing the household.

She needs different kinds of goods e.g needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc for her business purposes. Due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories, It will also be helpful to her in increasing her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Farzana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy supplies to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Librada de la Ciudad de Itá  están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mariela quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha ido mejorando por medio de su esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo.
Mariela se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma elabora y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que da todo de sí para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de verduras, carne, pollo y otros, con lo cual podrá seguir haciendo sus comidas variadas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de mejorar su vida y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group named “Santa Librada” is from the city of Itá. The members are participating in the poverty elimination program. One of the members is Sra. Mariela, whose latest survey indicated that she is at a Stage 3 poverty level. This means that she is making improvement as a result of her effort and continuous work.

Mariela sells food that she prepares herself. Her sales are conducted as a street vendor. She is a hardworking and determined woman who does everything she can to improve her living conditions.

Mariela is requesting a loan in order to buy vegetables, meat, chicken, and other supplies so that she can continue preparing various dishes just as before. She appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can improve her life and her income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, chicken, and other supplies for preparing the dishes that she sells.

loans.name: Ricardo Arsenio

texts.es:
El trabajo del campo es una de las labores más difíciles hoy en día por el gran esfuerzo que se debe hacer para progresar, pero Ricardo es un hombre que nunca se ha rendido a pesar del clima o las circunstancias que puedan pasar, ella siempre está dispuesta a conseguir los recursos para su familia.

Se levanta desde primera hora de la mañana para desplazarse a distintas fincas para cumplir con sus obligaciones laborales. 

Este oficio lo alterna con la venta de leche que obtiene de sus propias vacas.
 
Ella desea aumentar su capital de trabajo para garantizar el sostenimiento de sus negocios y es esta la razón que la lleva a solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de dos novillonas que le de un buen impulso a su negocio.
texts.en:
Farm work is one of the most difficult jobs today because of the great amount of effort it takes to make progress. However, Ricardo is a man who has never given up because of the weather or the existing circumstances. He is always willing to earn income for his family.

Ricardo wakes up extremely early in the morning so that he can travel to different farms and fulfill his work obligations. In addition to this job, he also sells milk that is produced by his own cows. Ricardo wants to increase his operating capital so that he can guarantee the sustainability of his business. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can invest in the purchase of two heifers. This will provide a good boost to his business.

loans.use: to buy two heifers to boost his business.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi is a married woman with one child, who does not attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. Mwanamisi operates a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. With the KES 20,000, she wants to buy bags of coconuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.es:
La Sra Etelvina, es casada, tiene familia formada, ella se dedica al comercio, vende materiales de construcción y artículos de ferretería en general, comenta que tiene buena clientela que siempre compra de ella todo tipo de productos.
Ella es una señora que cada día se esfuerza para poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no ha podido tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar materiales de construcciones para la venta, de manera a poder seguir cumpliendo con sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Sra. Etelvina is married and has an established family. She is a retailer who sells construction materials and general hardware goods. Etelvina says that she has a good clientele who are always buying all types of products from her.

She is a woman who strives each day to provide her loved ones with everything that she wasn’t able to have. Etelvina is requesting a loan in order to buy construction materials to sell so that she can continue to satisfy her customers. She appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can keep growing.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to sell.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 47-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her eight children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years, and he is responsible for meeting the needs of the family. Razia provides sewing services and earns income to join her husband in contributing to the household expenses. She needs a variety of goods, such as needles, thread, fabrics, pieces of clothes and machine oil, for her business, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these items. Therefore, she applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to buy what she needs and will help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services. Razia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase the volume of her tailoring business.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 50-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her spouse and five children. Razia's husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 12 years. He is the sole provider, responsible for fulfilling the entire family's needs.

Razia's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories, such as pieces of cloth, laces, needles and sewing machine accessories. Due to some financial constraints, he is not in suitable condition to buy these items for his business. Therefore, Razia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will financially assist her husband to buy these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs so that he can earn a more profitable income.

Razia is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy tailoring accessories to increase her husband's business

loans.name: La Esperanza 3 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Esperanza 3  está en su ciclo número 5° del programa de comité de mujeres, son de la Ciudad de Itá, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde este numeroso grupo de 31 mujeres quieren ir superándose día a día.
 A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de remedios naturales que hace, la Sra. Adolfina lucha por poder salir adelante, es una mujer muy sacrificada, que con gran entusiasmo empieza su día siempre, para poder luchar por sus seres queridos. Ella pide este préstamo para poder tener remedios naturales para la venta en su negocio.
Adolfina agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y luchando en su microemprendimiento.
texts.en:
The group named “La Esperanza 3” is in its fifth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. These women are from the city of Itá and all of them are working and helping one another to move forward. They have taken the poverty elimination survey. This large group of 31 women wants to excel each day.

Through her effort and continuous work of selling natural remedies, Sra. Adolfina has been able to get ahead. She is a self-sacrificing woman who always starts her day with great enthusiasm so that she can strive on behalf of her loved ones. Adolfina is requesting a loan so that she can buy natural remedies to sell in her business. She appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can keep growing and striving in her microenterprise.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow and increase her milk production to meet the demand of her increasing clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and satisfy his customers' demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a cow in order to pay school fees for her children through milk sales.

loans.name: Damas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Damas Trabajadoras es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ellas son unidas y solidarias entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades, manifiestan que están conformes y sienten el apoyo del programa de comité de mujeres para que puedan ellas aumentar sus ingresos y ser cada vez más independientes.
La Señorita Mariela vive con su esposo, ambos trabajan para el desarrollo y el crecimiento del nivel de vida de la familia. Ella es empleada doméstica, pero en vista a que necesita ayudar más a su familia quiere emprender en la venta de mandioca.
 La Señorita Solicita  este préstamo para emprender su negocio que es la venta de mandioca en su barrio. Ella desea progresar cada día más y gracia al programa está logrando sus objetivos.
texts.en:
The group called Damas Trabajadoras is from the city of San Ignacio.  They are united and supportive of each other.  They work together in businesses.  They say that they are pleased.   They feel the support of the women’s committee program enabling them to increase their earnings and become more independent each time.

Mariela lives with her husband.  They both work for the development and growth of the family’s standard of living.  She is a domestic employee.  

However, considering that she needs to help her family more, she wants to undertake a business of selling cassava.

She is requesting this loan to undertake her business, which is selling cassava in her neighborhood.  She wishes to progress more every day.  Thanks to the program, she is achieving her objectives.

loans.use: to buy cassava to sell.

loans.name: Elefina

texts.es:
Elefina tiene 56 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa familiar en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería principalmente.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como cuyes, gallinas, patos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 08 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como chivos, patos, gallinas, pavos, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, el préstamo le ayudará para tener una mayor variedad de animales que ofrecer a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir obtener mayores ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Elefina is 56 years old, living in a common law marriage, and residing in her family home in a rural zone of Oyotun district, located in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru. Life in this district is tranquil and the residents are dedicated principally to agriculture and cattle raising.

Elefina raises and sells, mainly, farm animals such as guinea pigs, hens, and ducks among others. Her business is located in her own domicile. She can count on eight years of experience in the business and very good references from her neighbors.

Elefina is requesting a loan to purchase a larger quantity of animals such as goats, ducks, hens, and turkeys to increase her business live stock. The loan will provide a greater variety of animals to offer her customers, permitting Elefina to obtain a larger income and, finally, improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy livestock such as goats ducks, hens, and turkeys in larger quantities, thereby increasing her business's livestock.

loans.name: Decery

texts.en:
Decery is 35 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Decery is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Decery has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is married and works hard to support her family.

She does business buying and selling livestock in the Philippines and also earns income from a general store. Mary Jean is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell.

Mary Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from clothing sales and a pig-fattening business. Leslie is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Leslie has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Kaniza

texts.en:
Kaniza is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family. He has been running his bookstore business for the past twenty years.

Kaniza's husband wants to purchase different types of books of all classes for his business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these books. Therefore, Kaniza has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, she’ll enable her husband to purchase relevant items for his business so that he can earn a more profitable income to manage his business and household.

Kaniza is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's bookstore business.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Jose  está en su segundo ciclo, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza donde 4 de las 18 señoras  se encuentran con una pobreza extrema.
Una de ellas es la señora Irma, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno. Para poder ayudar a la señora la fundación ha realizado capacitaciones lo cual le será de mucha ayuda. Irma es modista y pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, botones y otros.
Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group named “San Jose” is in its second loan cycle. All of the members are committed to working and helping one another so that they can move forward. They have taken the poverty elimination survey, which indicated that four of the 18 women are in extreme poverty.

One of the members is Sra. Irma, whose survey results indicated that she is at a Stage 1 poverty level. In order to help Sra. Irma, Fundación Paraguaya will be conducting training seminars that will be of great help to her. Irma is a seamstress and is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of fabrics, thread, buttons, and other supplies. She is grateful for the opportunity she has received because it will be of much assistance.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow for milk production so that he can meet his client's needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow. With the anticipated profit, she will buy more cows for rearing for milk production.

loans.name: Teko Poty Group

texts.es:
Teko Poty está en el ciclo número 5 del programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. En ciclos anteriores se ha hecho las encuestas de eliminación de pobreza, donde algunas señoras se encontraban por debajo de la línea de pobreza, pero ya se ha trabajado con ellas para que vaya aumentando sus ingresos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Emilce quien vende prendas de todo tipo, comenta que se ha hecho de muchos clientes, ya que siempre tiene todo tipo de productos para poder ofrecerles. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy temprano. 
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus esfuerzos por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
“Teko Poty” is a group that is in its fifth loan cycle with the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program. All of the members are working and helping one another to move forward. In previous loan cycles, the members have taken the poverty elimination survey. Some of the women were below the poverty line, but Fundación Paraguaya has worked with them to increase their incomes.

One of the members is Sra. Emilce, who sells clothing of all types. She says that she has many customers who are always buying the products that she offers them. Emilce is a hardworking woman who begins every workday extremely early.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy T-shirts, jeans, shirts, trousers, and other garments. Emilce will be able to continue her efforts with improving her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, jeans, shirts, trousers, and other garments to sell.

loans.name: Julianita

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of five children, Julianita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising chickens. Julianita is borrowing 19,500 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other paraphernalia for fishing.

Julianita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other paraphernalia for fishing

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married mother of one child who is still too young to attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Suseta

texts.en:
Suseta is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling seafood in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and selling purified drinking water. Suseta is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

Suseta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell

loans.name: Asster

texts.en:
Asster is a 29-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children.

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly, and so he is unable to generate any amount of income. Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw.

Therefore, Asster has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw.

loans.use: to enable her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow so as to increase her milk supply and get more clients, as well as to increase her income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow for milk production so as to meet his client's needs and increase his income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to get milk for selling in order to increase her overall income.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El comité SAN ROQUE, son de la ciudad Luque, inician el primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres. Que consiste en formar un pequeño grupo de mujeres, que cuenten actividades comerciales y accedan a su primera línea de préstamo para ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Claudia vende comidas que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante por su barrio, ella es una mujer que se destaca por mejorar cada día, todo esto es por su familia y sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, pollo y demás, de manera a poder seguir deleitando a sus clientes con las delicias que hace.
texts.en:
The San Roque committee, based in the city of Luque, is beginning the first women's committee loan cycle. Its objective is to create a small group of business women and enable them to obtain their first loan to improve their living conditions. 

Claudia prepares meals and sells them in the streets of her neighborhood. She works daily to get ahead for the sake of her family and loved ones. Claudia is requesting this loan to purchase vegetables, meat, seasonings, chicken, and other items in order to continue pleasing her customers with her delicious meals.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, seasonings, chicken, and other items to prepare meals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mesias

texts.es:
Mesias tiene 26 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en la provincia de Callayuc que se encuentra ubicada en la región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de esta zona se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales como actividades económicas principales.

El se dedica a la destilación y venta de aguardiente (bebida típica de la zona), realiza esta actividad desde hace 6 años y cuenta con clientes fijos quienes dan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El crédito lo utilizará para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento de los equipos que usa para la destilación de caña de azúcar y poder obtener un aguardiente de mejor calidad lo que tendrá un gran impacto en su nivel de ventas y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mesias is 29 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in the province of Callayuc which is located in the Cajamarca region, in the North Andes of Peru. The inhabitants of this region work in agriculture and raising livestock as their principal economic activities.

He works distilling and selling aguardiente (a traditional drink of the area). He has been doing this for 6 years and has regular clients who can provide him good personal and work references. The loan will be used to undertake repairs and maintenance on the equipment used for the distillation of sugar cane. Then he can obtain a higher quality of aguardiente which will have an large impact on his level of sales and in the end improve his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to use to have repairs and maintenance done to the equipment that is used to distill sugar cane.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan which she used to buy additional party supplies to improve her party needs business. Her earnings helped send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan which she will use to pay for party poppers, balloons, hats and souvenirs needed to operate her business. She is the only one in their town who has this kind of business and is known to serve her clients well. 

She is encouraged by the positive feedback of her service and is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely help fund their daily needs and the schooling of her children. 

Julieta dreams of having more clients outside their area. She wants to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future.

Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for party supplies, including party poppers, balloons, hats and souvenirs.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Ma. Theresa is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional wheels and spare parts for her tricycle.

Ma. Theresa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional wheels and spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Colonel

texts.en:
Colonel is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. A farmer who mainly grows coffee, he earns additional income from cattle rearing. He hopes to expand his coffee plantation and out-compete all the traders around. His vision is hindered, however, by variable weather that affects his farm output.

Colonel is requesting a loan to buy more fertilizers for his coffee plantation.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Ansar

texts.en:
Ansar is a 49-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for 20 years. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. 

Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Ansar is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. 

With this loan, she can help her husband purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Ansar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his clothing business.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 49-year-old lady residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of four daughters and one son. 

Her husband has been doing his own business of cattle farming for the past twenty years, and her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family and to manage the household.

Nargis's husband wants to purchase animals for his business purposes but due to financial constraints, her husband is unable to purchase these cattle.
Therefore Nargis has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy these cattle to fulfill the needs of his business, and this will also be good for him to earn maximum profitable income derived from his business.

For this financial assistance, Nargis is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's cattle business

loans.name: Mwamisi

texts.en:
Mwamisi is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbors and town dwellers come to buy. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients, hence the perishability of goods leads to losses.

With the Kshs 45,000 she wants to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a modern café business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Kuña Katupyry  está en su ciclo número 1, es un grupo nuevo que se formó con las expectativas de poder mejorar sus vidas y poder ayudar a sus familias. Forman también parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, con el cual cada una podrá ir mejorando.
Catalina se destaca por ser una mujer muy trabajadora, comenta que ella se dedica a la venta de prendas, y también tiene una despensa bien surtida. Catalina es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, que quiere dar todo a sus seres queridos, a la vez que va creciendo por medio de su esfuerzo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas, como ser jeans, camisas, remeras y otros, para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Kuna Katupyry is in its first loan cycle. It is a new group formed with the expectation that it could improve member's lives and help their families. It also forms part of the Elimination of Poverty Program in which each member can continue to improve.

Catalina stands out as a very hard-working woman. She reports that she is dedicated to selling items of clothing, and also, she has a stall that she keeps well supplied. Catalina is a combative woman and very enterprising, who wishes to provide for every need of her loved ones, and at the same time, to continue to grow through her own efforts.

Catalina is requesting this loan to invest in purchasing a variety of items of clothing, such as jeans, shirts, T-shirts, and other items, to be able to continue sales as she has in the past.

She is grateful for this opportunity to continue growing.

loans.use: buy clothing, including jeans, shirts, T-shirts, and other items, to sell.

loans.name: Jose Jaime

texts.es:
José Jaime tiene 24 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad con paisajes verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la destilación de aguardiente, una bebida tradicional de la sierra del Perú que se utiliza para fechas festivas y lo comercializa en los distritos aledaños a su comunidad, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de caña de azúcar, materia prima del proceso de destilación y de esta manera ofrecer en mayor cantidad a sus clientes, esto le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia
texts.en:
José Jaime is 24 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Callayuc district. Callayuc is a community with green landscapes where people make a living from agriculture, trade, and livestock raising. It is located in Jaén province, which is part of the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

José Jaime makes a living from distilling firewater—a traditional drink from the Peruvian mountains that is consumed during holidays—and sells it in the neighboring districts. He has experience in the business and good personal and professional references from his neighbors. José Jaime is requesting a loan to purchase a larger quantity of sugarcane, which is the raw material used in the distillation process, and thus increase the quantity of firewater he can supply to his customers. This will enable him to increase his income and improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of sugarcane, which is the raw material used in the distillation process.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to boost the milk supply she sells to her customers so as to increase her income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and get milk for selling, creating income to expand his barber shop business.

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Remy works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Remy is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear as well as groceries for her store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF, and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and goceries for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks and cement to construct her residential house

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a forty-seven-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main source of income comes from beekeeping and growing and selling maize, beans, and coffee. He started his business to have a better life. In the produce business he faces the challenges of competition and bad weather. 

John has a vision of owning a big and modern produce store and catering to his family's needs.  He is requesting a loan to buy manure and seedlings for his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Zaitun

texts.en:
Zaitun, a hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda, runs a retail shop as her main source of income alongside farming. She started this business to earn more income to better look after her family. High rates of taxation, competition and inadequate capital are her main problems, but she has a vision of owning a wholesale shop, educating her children and empowering her family.

Zaitun is requesting a loan to buy more crates of sodas, sugar and soap to sell during the Easter season.

loans.use: to buy more crates of sodas, sugar and soap to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Beatrice operates a vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mejumaa operates a business selling cashew nuts at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

With this Kshs 40,000 loan, Mejumaa wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for two years. 

Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. He needs to make repairs on his taxi because its current condition is not good. It requires more maintenance on a daily basis. 

Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to make repairs on his taxi. Therefore, Zahida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Zahida's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily, and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. 

Zahida also plans to make savings with some of the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

She is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his taxi.

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr: Martine est une femme mariée âgée de 46 ans  et vit à Kpogan. Mère de quatre enfants, Martine est très entreprenante et dynamique. Martine fait le commerce des sceaux plastiques et se déplace aux besoins de ses clients afin de trouver son gain. Martine s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché pour avoir ses articles. Pour acheter de nouveaux sceaux, Martine demande ce crédit pour réaliser son objectif.
texts.en: Martine is a married woman, 46 years old, and lives in Kpogan. The mother of four children, Martine is very enterprising and dynamic. Martine trades in plastic buckets and meets the needs of her clients in order to find her profit. Martine gets her supplies once per month at the market in order to have her goods. To buy new buckets, Martine asks for this credit to realize her goal.

loans.use: to buy 18 plastic buckets.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Mujeres unidas, ya que eso es lo que son,  mujeres muy unidas que luchan y se esfuerzan por sus familias, están en su ciclo número (1º) del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Andresa.
Ella se dedica a la  ventas de productos de limpiezas, ventas de lavandinas, ventas de suavizantes de ropas, que ella misma hace también se debe destacar el trabajo de la fundación paraguaya, que hace un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Andresa solicita de este préstamo para la compra de sus productos para poder hacer productos de limpieza tales como: envases, productos químicos, etc. lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio,  y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: This group is called Women United (Mujeres Unidas) because that is what they are: women who are united and who work and fight for their families. They are in their first loan cycle of the women's committee program, where they all work and help each other get ahead. The group is now performing the [Poverty] Eradication Survey, which identified one of its members [as living below the poverty line]: Andresa. Andresa makes a living selling cleaning products, bleach, and fabric softener that she prepares herself. (We should also note the work performed by the Paraguayan foundation, which continuously follows through with training and accountability programs. They manage to place demands on women while simultaneously motivating them to work hard to overcome poverty.) Andresa is requesting a loan to purchase containers, chemicals, etc., which will help her execute her business plan and improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase containers, chemicals, etc. to prepare cleaning products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, increase milk production, and thus meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is 26 years old and married to Ruth. They are blessed with 2 children. He has been in the dairy farming business for the last 12 years, earning 12,000 KES per month.

Jared has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya in the amount of 25,000 KES in order to buy a dairy cow so he can meet the high demand from his customers. He plans to use his anticipated profits to both expand his dairy production and educate his children.

Jared's hope is to buy a plot of land and build a house to use as a milk supply center for his clients.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and thus meet high customer demand and increase his overall income.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Unidas está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 integrantes se encuentran en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella va ir mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente para lograr un éxito total, ya que con ello podrá dar un mejor bienestar a su familia. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que es vendedora de helados variados. Y con ello tiene los ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo e n la compra de helados variados, de manera a poder seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas group is in its first loan cycle under the women's communal bank program, where everyone is participating in the poverty elimination survey, in which three of their members are in extreme poverty.

One of the members is Maria. Through her effort and constant work, and the application of behaviors vital to the successful woman, she is gradually improving her poverty situation. But she is also aware that this work and the effort she is making must be constant and on-going in order to achieve complete success, as she will thereby be able to provide better well-being for her family. 

One of the jobs she has is selling different kinds of ice cream, and with this she earns the income to help her family. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy various kinds of ice cream, and continue offering a good selection to her customers.

loans.use: To buy various kinds of ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Naguin

texts.es:
Naguin tiene 50 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica al cultivo de arroz, yuca, maíz , comercio y ganadería, se encuentra ubicado en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en la región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, entre otros, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Naguin ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de arroz, leche, menestras y de esta manera incrementar el stock de su tienda y así generar mayores ingresos para su familia y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Naguin is 50 years old and lives with his son in the district of Oyotún, where people make a living from growing rice, cassava, and corn and from commerce and raising cattle. He is located in the city of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

He makes a living by selling groceries like rice, sugar, milk, and oil, among other items. His business is located in his home. He has ten years of experience in this business and established customers who provide him with very good personal and work references. Naguin has asked for a loan to buy rice, milk, and beans in order to increase the stock at his store, thus generating greater earnings for his family and having a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, milk, and beans in order to increase the stock at his store.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 36 years old, and she is married with 2 children who are both in school.

Marjorie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marjorie has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 12 years, though she also earns income from food vending.

Marjorie aspires to save money so she can both expand her business and continue sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, supply his clients, and increase his income.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria, 39, is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married and the mother of four children, the oldest of whom is already in college. She manages her own household while operating a business, and works hard to support her family. She earns an income by selling clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Natasha. Dealers buy the products at a lower price and sell them at a profit.  Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her sustain her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan which she will use to buy more branded items to sell.  Filipinos prefer to buy branded personal goods for their good quality.  Ma. Victoria aims to grow her business so she can send her children to the best schools possible, and dreams that all of them will finish college.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather weekly to study religion, build social capital and pay loans.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 51 years old, and she is married with 2 children, 1 of whom is in school.

Emma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more items like soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, and other groceries.

Emma has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for the past 24 years. She also earns income from fish vending.

Emma aspires to save money so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, and other groceries.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: As the married mother of two children, Gina works hard to support her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She also earns additional income by raising pigs.  Gina has requested a loan for PHP 27,000 from NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her store. She has sustained her business activities through ten prior loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en: Enock is 45 years old, hardworking, married and the father of five children who live with him in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a farmer, and grows mostly watermelons. He also earns extra income by running a retail shop. He someday hopes to have a big, developed business and educated children, but has been limited by inadequate capital and weather changes. Enock is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay his children's school fees.

loans.name: Mwatime

texts.en: Mwatime is a married woman with one child who is enrolled in the local school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor plumbing. For more than three years, Mwatime has operated a clothes-selling business, going door to door and selling from home to neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the seasonality of her business. She is requesting this loan to buy a bale of children's clothing to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and feed, thus increasing his income and improve both his family's living standards and business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and increase milk sales

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 45 years old and from Marcos Dist, Talavera, Nueva Ecija. She is a widowed mother to her two children. One of her children is Kathleen, who is studying for a BS in Business Administration. She is hopeful of finishing her college education, to have a stable job, and help her family achieve financial stability. 

Rosita, being a solo parent, finds it hard to send Kathleen to college because of a lack of money; that’s why she wants to seek PHP200,000 financial assistance from the Kiva lenders. She hopes that lenders will approve her loan so she can continue sending Kathleen to college.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashewnuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen De Fatima está en su ciclo número (1) del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty, la cual se encuentra en crecimiento, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Maria, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, que lo hace con mucho sacrificio, es una mujer muy sacrificada que quiere dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Quiere que conforme pase el tiempo y con las capacitaciones vaya creciendo y luchando.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas, como camisas, jeans, remeras, pantalones y otros, y con ello poder seguir dando a sus clientes lo que piden.
texts.en: The group called "Virgen De Fatima" is in their first cycle with The Woman's Committee Program. It is based in the city of Curuguaty, which is growing. So the members of the group want to struggle to grow and give the area they live in a better environment and see that it grows slowly. Maria who works selling a variety of clothing makes a lot of sacrifice. She is a very demanding woman who wants to give her family all that she could not have. She wants to adapt to the passing of time and through the training grow and fight. She is requesting this loan to buy clothing like shirts, jeans, t-shirts, pants and others so she can continue to provide her clients what they request.

loans.use: to buy shirts, jeans, t-shirts, pants and others to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow which will boost her income from sales of in-demand milk.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of four children, Corazon works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling hardware. Corazon is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Corazon has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing and raising livestock. Arlene is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a twenty-eight-year-old hardworking married man with one child living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He sells agricultural produce and that is where he earns a living. He was inspired by the need to cater for his family. He hopes to construct a permanent house and rentals in future since he faces a challenge of high rental costs.

He is requesting a loan to buy more bags of maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Gardson

texts.en:
Gardson is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  He practices the rearing of cattle alongside farming where he gets his extra income. With this, he has been able to sustain his family. He hopes to expand his cattle farm and also construct a permanent house, however his main challenge is foot and mouth disease that attacks his cattle.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for his farm.

loans.name: Ndegwa

texts.en:
Ndegwa is married with four children, two of whom attend school. The other two are still too young for school. She owns a house that  has electricity but no piped water. 

She operates a cashew nut business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase two sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of cashew nuts for resale

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He practices agricultural produce, and that is how he earns his living. 

Wilson is inspired by the need to look after his family and pay the school fees for his children. He is optimistic that in some time to come he will become a prominent businessman.

Wilson is requesting a loan to buy more bags of maize and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more bags of maize and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Evarist

texts.en:
Evarist is a hardworking Ugandan living in Kamwenge. He is a married farmer who earns his income from raising cattle, as well as selling produce. From both of these, he has been able to sustain his family.  

Evarist hopes to expand his cattle farm. However, his main challenges are poor seasonal conditions and inadequate capital.

Evarist is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for his farm.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem  is 45 years old, a married woman. She is a mother of five children. She has been doing a business of animal sales and purchase for many years with the support of her husband. She is keen to provide her family with better living conditions through all her hard work. 

Now, Naseem has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en: Mercedita is 41 years old and married. They are blessed with three children. She sells street foods and roams around their town. She has been doing this for almost three years and earns a net income of 1,800 PHP daily. Due to insufficient funds for her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to 13,000 PHP to purchase beverages to sell and to put up an additional food cart. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve, expand, and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase beverages to sell and to put up an additional food cart.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie est une jeune femme célibataire sans enfants. Marie vit à Kpogan et est âgée de 36 ans. Pour réaliser ses gains, Marie prépare et vend des savons liquides fabriqués à l’aide d’une poudre. Marie arrive à subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens grâce à cette activité génératrice de revenu. Pour vendre efficacement ses produits, Marie achète deux fois par mois ses matières de préparations au Ghana et à Cotonou. Marie sollicite ce crédit pour acheter les poudres afin de réaliser plus de savons.
texts.en:
Marie is a young unmarried woman without children.She lives in Kpogan and is 36 years old. To earn a living, Marie prepares and sells liquid soap fabricated using a sort of powder. Marie manages to cover her daily expenses thanks to this money-earning activity. 

In order to sell her products efficiently, Marie buys her raw materials twice a month in Ghana and Cotonou. She is asking for this loan to buy the powder so as to manufacture more soap.

loans.use: to buy nine kilos of powder to use in fabricating liquid soap.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi vit à Avépozo et est âgée de 43 ans. Mariée, Akouvi est mère de cinq enfants et travaille activement pour favoriser leur éducation. Akouvi vend des poissons frais et fumés dans son quartier pour avoir son revenu de subsistance. Akouvi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des cartons de poissons, Akouvi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité nécessaire.
texts.en: Akouvi lives in Avépozo and is  43 years old. Married, Akouvi is the mother of five children and works hard to pay for their education. Akouvi sells fresh and smoked fish in her neighborhood to earn her subsistence living. She stocks up three times a month in the market. So that she can order some cartons of fish, Akouvi is requesting this loan to cover her purchase and make her business profitable.

loans.use: to buy five cartons of fresh fish.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Lucia tiene 17 integrantes, está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien se dedica al humilde trabajo de la venta de remedios naturales. Es una mujer muy luchadora que quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ayudar a su familia. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar su vida y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
La Señora Solicita de este préstamo para poder comprar mazos de remedios yuyos lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called Santa Lucia has 17 members and is in its third cycle of the women's committee program. The members are a part of the program for the elimination of poverty, as three of them are below the poverty line, or in extreme poverty.

One of the members is Maria, who makes a living from the humble work of selling natural remedies. She is a very hardworking woman who wants to improve her living conditions and help her family. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to improve her life and help her loved ones. She is asking for this loan to be able to buy bundles of herbal remedies, which will help her to materialize her business plan and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy herbal remedies for sale

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Comite de Mujeres Trabajadoras está en su ciclo número 4to Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. El grupo lleva este nombre porque son mujeres trabajadoras que luchan por mejorar y crecer cada día. Forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Estela, quien tiene una despensa que con sacrificio ha montado y crecido, también se debe destacar el trabajo de la fundación paraguaya, que hace un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Estela solicita de este préstamo para la compra de insumos para poder surtir su despensa, como ser verduras, carne, leche, panificados, bebidas y otros para vender, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group, called the Women Workers Committee, is in it's 4th cycle of the Women's Committee program, where all of the members work and help themselves to get ahead.  The group is named this way because they are very hard-working women who fight to improve and grow each day.  They are a part of the program to eliminate poverty by being able to help their families.

One of the members is Estela, who has a grocery store that she set up and grew through her sacrifice.  The work of the Paraquaya Foundation should also be emphasized, which does continuous training and follow-up that in some way requires and at the same time incentivizes the women to fight to be able to overcome poverty.

Estela is applying for this loan to buy supplies to stock her grocery store, such as vegetables, meat, milk, bread, drinks, and other products to sell, which will help her to have a concrete business plan and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, milk, bread, drinks, and other products to sell

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell personal products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy more items like perfume, shampoo, body-lotion and foot-wear to offer for sale.

Amy successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Amy's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like perfume, shampoo, body-lotion and foot-wear.

loans.name: Yowasi

texts.en: Yowasi is an older, hardworking married man with three children and all attend school in Hoima, Uganda. He operates a retail shop mainly selling salt, sugar, and soap among other items, in order to  earn an additional income on top of practicing farming. He dreams of expanding his business and paying school fees for his children. He will use the loan facility to buy more stock like salt, soap, and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock like salt, soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mariée et très entreprenante, Afi vit à Avépozo. Elle est âgée de 32 ans et est mère de trois enfants. Depuis 2014, Afi vend des tomates fraiches et en boite. Son activité l’aide à réaliser le revenu pouvant leur permettre de se nourrir. Afi achète ses marchandises trois fois par mois et les revend dans son quartier. Pour acheter des tomates, Afi demande ce crédit pour financer son activité et trouver un bénéfice pour l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
An enterprising married woman, Afi lives in Avépozo. She is 32 years old and mother of three children. Since 2014, Afi has been selling fresh and tinned tomatoes. Her business helps her bring in enough income so they can eat. Afi buys her merchandise three times a week and resells it in her neighborhood. 

To buy tomatoes, Afi is requesting this loan to finance her business so that she can make enough for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy four baskets of tomatoes and two sacks of hot peppers

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
Luciano tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus cuatros hijos en el distrito de Pucará, cuya población se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio, y se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado caprino, cuenta con más de 15 años de experiencia en el rubro y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. Dicho ganado lo vende a comerciantes de animales de la zona, además se dedica a la crianza de animales de corral como gallinas y pavos. El crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, con esto Luciano espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir incrementar sus ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luciano is 42 years old and lives with his spouse and their 4 children in the District of Pucará, whose residents make a living in agriculture, ranching, and commerce.  It is located in the Province of Jaén in the Cajamarca Region of the northern sierras of Perú.

He makes a living raising and selling goat livestock, and he has more than 15 years of experience in this trade as well as good personal and work references from his neighbors.  He sells the livestock to animal merchants in the area, and he also makes a living raising corralled animals such as chickens and turkeys.  

The loan will go towards buying a larger quantity of animals as well as balanced feed to fatten them, and with this Luciano hopes to offer a greater variety of animals to his clients which will allow him to increase his income and therefore improve the quality of life of himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals and balanced feed to fatten them

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
La Sra. Marta es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de comidas típicas, minutas, y a la venta de leche, está casada y tiene hijos, su marido es Policía, ella comenta que se dedica a su actividad  hace más de 10 años.
Marta es una persona  muy trabajadora y emprendedora y con buena moral de pago, tiene varias operaciones canceladas con la Fundación Paraguaya. Ella quiere ir mejorando su emprendimiento para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para sus comidas, como carne, pollo, condimentos, mandiocas y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Marta is a merchant; she makes a living by selling traditional foods, fast food, and milk. She is married and has children, and her husband is a police officer. She says that she has had this business for more than ten years.

Marta is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial woman and she has a good payment history; she has paid off various loans with Fundación Paraguaya. She wants to keep improving her business in order to help her family.

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy supplies for her food such as beef, chicken, condiments, cassava and other items. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to grow and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy beef, chicken, condiments, cassava and other items.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is 63 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Leonor has a fish vending business in the Philippines.She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Leonor has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Leonor would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover school expenses (buying school supplies)

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en: This time, Andrea is borrowing 20,000 PHP to fund her furniture-making business. Her furniture-making business was previously funded through NWTF and Kiva, and it continues to provide Andrea and her family an increase in income and improves their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Misheal

texts.en:
Misheal lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is aged 29 and is a single mother of one child aged 14. She deals in produce, mainly the buying and selling of maize, beans, and rice. To supplement her business, she also operates a bar. She has hopes of developing and expanding her businesses. 

Misheal will use the loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a variety store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing and pig fattening. Teresita is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of items like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and other groceries.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of items like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Ma. Riza

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Ma. Riza works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a motorized tricycle and raising livestock. Ma. Riza is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more seafoods to sell for her fish-vending business.

Ma. Riza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Marites works hard to support her family. She has a clothing business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a general store and from raising ducks. Marites is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell to customers.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Robinson

texts.en:
Robinson lives in Kasese, Uganda. He earns his living as a teacher. With his savings he also managed to open a shop from which is sold general merchandise.

For his past six years as a teacher he has dreamed of building himself a house. Now Robinson is applying for a 3,500,000 UGX loan through HOFOKAM to buy cement and bricks to construct it. He knows this will improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks to build himself a house

loans.name: Vjollca

texts.en:
This is Vjollca and Daut, her husband. Both are being photographed in the territory of their home. Their activity has been collecting scrap metal and plastic for cash. 

Note that a large number of the Egyptian Albanian community in Albania are pursuing this activity.
